0,"
The MoFU campaign continues!
 

Our last campaign on Kickstarter went very well (funded over 500%). In addition, MōFU just won GOLD in the A'Design Award Competition!!! Now I would like to keep growing the project so I can make even more animal toys! Feel free to comment, or tell us on social media the next animal you'd like to see.

Ｄuring this campain if funding reaches $30,000, the 6th MōFU animal, and $40,000 for 7th animal will be revealed!  

 

Before there were MōFU...

モーフが生まれる前は・・・

...the clever children and playful adults of the big city had nothing to play with, but in the wilds of the concrete jungles of Brooklyn, alone toymaker toiled away trying to solve the problem of making toys compact enough to fit in tiny NYC apartments. Remembering the hundred-year-old Japanese tradition of toys that transform through folding, the toymaker had an idea...

大都会ブルックリンのアパート密集地では利口な子供達や、独創的な大人達が満足できる遊びが見つからない。一人のトイデザイナーが小さなアパートにでも収まる、コンパクトで画期的な玩具のデザインに試行錯誤を重ねていた。日本の伝統玩具の折り返し、変形のアイデアを活用し・・・

And finally, MōFU were born!

結果、ついにモーフが誕生！

 

The people of the big city rejoiced, slid open their boxes and unfolded their new animal friends. They posed and played all day, then folded ‘em up and nestled ‘em away for bedtime knowing they'd never be bored again.

都会の人は喜びを取り戻し、箱を開け、時が経つのを忘れ動物さんたちとパズルを楽しみました。

What Are MōFU (Mighty Omega Folding Universe)?

モーフ （マイティ・オメガ・フォールディング・ユニバース）て何？

MōFU, are adorably expressive, poseable animals that can be neatly folded up into matching cuboids and nestled into their resting boxes. Created by award-winning designer and toymaker Yoshiaki Ito (Yoshi Ito), MōFU are at home everywhere—from your desk at work, to your coffee table, to your clever kid’s toy collection. They're toys, but they're also puzzles and folding a MōFU back into its box can be a real challenge.

モーフは頭脳パズルと可愛い動物の要素が一体になったツーインワントイ。楽しいポーズで、お家でもオフィスでも、インテリアにもよし。パズルをみんなでチャレンジしてもよし。お仕事中の癒しや、賢いキッズに人気間違いなし！

The five MōFU you are about to meet are just the beginning, more animals will be announced as the project grows!

モーフシリーズのは5種類の動物からスタート。 今後プロジェクトが成長するにつれて、他の動物も登場するよ。みんなでモーフを応援しよう！

Before we go any further, let's meet MoNKI the Monkey! 先に進む前にサルさんを紹介。
column5:
showinfo=0"">

MoNKI the Monkey is the leader of the crew. Wherever he goes, he likes to pose
column6:
make him stand, sit, squat, or do a handstand or two. He's so flexible, he might even swing in on a vine and start breakdancing. Puzzle Difficulty: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️ (5/5 Savage! You've gotta be pretty good at puzzles to figure out how to fold MoNKI back into a cuboid that fits in his resting box. )

サルさんは皆のリーダー。どこに行ってもポーズをするのが大好き。立って、座って、しゃがむことだって、逆立ちだってできる。体がとっても柔らかくて、ツタにぶら下がってブレークダンスまでできちゃう。パズル難度：❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️（5/5 ヤバい！かなりパズルに長けている人でないと立方体に畳んで、箱に戻すのは難しいかも。）

And here are some of your other fierce new friends! 動物シリーズの他のお友達！

 

ToRA the Tiger is as ferocious as they come. Set her up so she’s ready to pounce, let her stretch in the sun, or let her hide her in the houseplants and stalk your friends! Puzzle Difficulty: ❤️❤️❤️❤️ (4/5 Fierce! ToRA may not be as hard as MoNKI, but she's a real challenge too and she'll get your brain working.)

トラさんはとっても獰猛、飛びかかられないように注意が必要。お日様の下で背伸びをしたり、観葉植物の陰に隠れて友達に忍び寄る！パズル難度：❤️❤️❤️❤️（4/5 獰猛！おサルさんよりは難しくないかもだけど、トラさんも結構大変な頭脳トレーニング。）

 

KaBA the Hippo has been tucked away too long and now he's restless. Let's unfold him and let him run free! He’s a handsome feller, isn’t he? Puzzle Difficulty: ❤️❤️ (2/5 Frisky! Once you've got it figured out, you'll never forget.)

カバさんは長い間、しまい込まれていたから今は休む暇もない。元の姿に戻して、自由に走らせてあげて！カバさんはハンサムでしょ？パズル難度：❤️❤️(2/5 じゃれる! 一度答えを見つけたら、もう絶対に忘れない。)

 

 BuTA the Piggy is lazy, but boy is she cute. She’s also the smartest MōFU to boot! Her main skills include wallowing and contemplating the infinite nature of the universe. Puzzle Difficulty: ????? (1/5 Tame. Terrible at puzzles? You got this!

ブタさんは、怠け者だけど愛くるしい。MoFUの仲間の中で一番のお利口さん。ブタさんの得意なことは壮大世界の自然の考えにふけること。パズル難度: ❤️ (1/5 素直。パズルは苦手？これしかない！)

KiRIN the Giraffe may be the tallest of all the MōFU, but she loves her short buddy, KaBA. With those long legs and a crane-like neck, she's a real challenge to get back in her box! Puzzle Difficulty:❤️❤️❤️❤️ (4/5 Fierce! You know that friend who thinks they know everything? Hand them KiRIN and they'll quiet right down trying to figure her out.)

キリンさんは、MōFUの一番のノッポさん。でも、小さな相棒カバさんが大好き。長い脚をと、ツルさんのような長い首。キリンさんを箱に戻すのはかなりのチャレンジ！パズル難度: ❤️❤️❤️❤️ (4/5 ものすごい! 周りのお友達で何でも分かると豪語する人はいますか？キリンさんを渡してみて下さい。きっと静かになってパズルを必死に解き始めますよ。)

Note: These are just 3D-printed prototypes. Finished MōFU will be even better! They'll be made from wood and come in natural wood colors or bright colors similar to these guys.

注：写真は３Dプリンターによる現時点の試作品です。色合いは近いものを採用する予定ですが、実際の商品はとは異なります。ただし、写真の物より商品化の仕上がりは、より良い木製品に成りますので、乞うご期待を！

 

Who Are We?

We're a small team of friends of designer Yoshiaki Ito, and we want to help him get this project made! We've known Yoshi for years and seen him evolve and grow as a designer working with firms in Brooklyn and Manhattan for years. More recently we've seen him win awards and get international press for his own innovative designs. Anyone who has known Yoshi and seen his designs has probably asked him, ""Why don't you start your own company?"" Well, he's doing it! We're thrilled, but Yoshi's going to need your help to make this project the kind of success it deserves to be.

Here's Yoshi in his own words on why designing MōFU wasn't easy and how these transforming toys work:

""I had to think about each piece of shape very carefully. When the pieces are folded they have to fit into a square space perfectly like a jigsaw puzzle. But, when the pieces are unfolded, each piece has to be an abstract shape that still looks like a part of an animal body. All the pieces are connected by elastic cords. This flexible connection allows the animals to have articulated joints, but also creates so many more options for poses.""

What's the Indigogo for?

We need your help to turn these guys we think are mighty cute from a design concept at the prototype stage into professionally produced toys you can play with. Funds raised will pay for the production of the toys and its distribution to funders, and the development of even more MoFU. I'd love to create all the animals in the Chinese Zodiac.

Here is the TOP 10* REASONS you need MōFU in your life:
column7: >1. Each MōFU has a different level of complexity, so there's one that’s a perfect balance of fun and challenge for you.
column8: >2. MōFU love doing yoga! Have you ever seen a giraffe do a downward dog?
column9: >3. Try to beat the MōFU challenge and get your new friend back in his resting box.
column10: >4. In the long tradition of Japanese folding toys, MōFU stands apart not just as adorable animals, but as truly challenging puzzles.
column11: >5. If you master a MōFU, no sweat, you've graduated to a harder one!
column12: >6. Your idle fingers need something to fiddle with while you’re on the phone.
column13: >7. Getting kids to put toys away is always a challenge, but now it’s a fun challenge! “How fast can you get your MōFU in their boxes, Oliver?”
column14: >8. Bet your friends they can't solve the puzzle, then show them how it's done!
column15: >9. Practice till you've got it down, fold up a MōFU in seconds flat, and make your friends' jaws drop.
column16: >10. MōFU are for everyone! Even though the puzzle aspect of some MōFU can be really difficult, the unfolded toy is a cute animal that anyone can have fun posing and playing with.
column17:
>*This list goes to... 11. MōFU can act as an emotional support animal on a stressful plane, train, and automobile trips.

column1: XGO-Mini is a desktop-sized AI quadruped robot with 12 degrees of freedom which can achieve omnidirectional movement, six-dimensional posture control, stable posture, and a variety of motions.
<div data-id=""34399926""><figure style=""margin: 0px

Equipped with a 9-axis IMU, its joint position sensor and electric current sensor is able to reflect to its own posture and joint rotation angle and torque, which are used for algorithms verification and exploitation, and can be programmed by computer to alert poison words and python programming. It is designed for education, research, algorithm verification, and entertainment.
<div data-id=""34400686""><figure style=""margin: 0px
<div data-id=""34251455""><figure style=""margin: 0px
<div data-id=""34388933""><figure style=""margin: 0px

XGO-Mini has fully functional AI modules which can facilitate both entry and advanced-level AI applications. The Al modules come with the features of visual recognition, voice recognition, and gesture recognition giving XGO-Mini the ability to hear, recognize and reply to users like a real dog. It also can track multiple colors and recognize QR codes, April Tag, and DataMatrix, etc. Through different programming, it can achieve more functions beyond your imagination.
<div data-id=""34400784""><figure style=""margin: 0px
• Mask Detection
<div data-id=""34390256""><figure style=""margin: 0px
<div data-id=""34400686""><figure style=""margin: 0px
• Gesture Recognition
<div data-id=""34389124""><figure style=""margin: 0px
<div data-id=""34390580""><figure style=""margin: 0px
<div data-id=""34530171""><figure style=""margin: 0px
• AI Chip

XGO-Mini’s AI module has a built-in Kendryte K210 Chip, featuring RISC-V processor architecture, audio-visual, standalone IP core, and strong programmability. It supports images, audio, video, machine learning models, and other types of materials stored in a Micro SD card.
<div data-id=""34399167""><figure style=""margin: 0px

XGO Team has collaborated with Canaan by using its Kendryte K210 Chip, the most powerful edge computing chip, designs for both visual and semantic recognition, widely used in various scenarios. Canaan is a leading provider of supercomputing solutions, distinguished for superior cost-efficiencies and performance.
<div data-id=""34251461""><figure style=""margin: 0px
• 12 Degrees of Freedom
<div data-id=""34390269""><figure style=""margin: 0px

Based on inverse kinematics, XGO-Mini’s 12 active joints enable it to move forward, backward, left, and right and support omnidirectional movement and the superposition of motion in multiple directions. 

 
  •  More about the joints
<div data-id=""34340503""><figure style=""margin: 0px

XGO-Mini, as a quadruped robot, can mimic the motion of a dog walking and has certain advantages like walking on uneven terrain and extremely rough surfaces. It can even adapt to avoid obstacles by adjusting its height. With its unique bionic system, XGO Mini can perform any dynamic movement.
<div data-id=""34390594""><figure style=""margin: 0px

XGO’s joints are composed of DC motors, reduction gears, sensors, and control circuits, with a servo control PID algorithm system. Subverts the traditional steering gear without closed-loop function, 360° angle controllable, angle recognition accuracy 0.088 degrees, with built-in acceleration, start and stop function, making mechanized actions smooth and realistic (Design By Luwu Intelligence, Made By Feetech)
•  Self-stabilization
<div data-id=""34225730""><figure style=""margin: 0px
Built-in IMUs capture XGO-Mini movement data and generate a highly flexible &
column2: stable motion performance. Through the posture data obtained by the IMU, closed-loop control allows XGO-Mini to adapt to external forces, adjust to the target posture of the manual action, and enable the teaching function.

column1: <div data-id=""34340673""><figure style=""margin: 0px
When its feet are not moving, the motion control of six degrees of freedom of the body can be actualized. It has unprecedented mobility which coordinates all instinctive and sophisticated movements.
<div data-id=""34400686""><figure style=""margin: 0px
<div data-id=""34621649""><figure style=""margin: 0px
<div><div><div><div style=""width: 100%
<div><div><div><div style=""width: 100%
<div><div class=""campaignStoryVideoWrapper""><iframe src=""https://www.youtube.com/embed/U2nNI9Yp_0g?autohide=1&amp
<div>
<div><div class=""campaignStoryVideoWrapper""><iframe src=""https://www.youtube.com/embed/ZYeSgKPc02M?autohide=1&amp
<div data-id=""34251464""><figure style=""margin: 0px
• One-button Design
<div data-id=""34388894""><figure style=""margin: 0px

XGO-Mini comes as an assembled kit, so it's ready to be used. With its one-button design and exclusive app, you can interact with XGO-Mini right away with ease. With the Edge Computing Chip, AI can run on local systems and can be controlled without the Internet and mobile.
<div data-id=""34390281""><figure style=""margin: 0px
• App Control
<div data-id=""34389472""><figure style=""margin: 0px
<div data-id=""34400686""><figure style=""margin: 0px
<div data-id=""34339944""><figure style=""margin: 0px
•  Open-source and DIY Your XGO-Mini
<div data-id=""34388982""><figure style=""margin: 0px

XGO-Mini allows users to program it with Python and we also supply ROS packages run on Ubuntu or Raspberry for developers. Everyone can create their own functions for XGO-Mini for education, entertainment, and commercial use. Unlimited programming possibilities help you to explore, learn, and have fun.  If XGO-Mini is not enough for you, we will provide you an advanced version, XGO-Ultra.
<div data-id=""34621983""><figure style=""margin: 0px
<div data-id=""34621987""><figure style=""margin: 0px
<div data-id=""34423337""><figure style=""margin: 0px
<div data-id=""34401019""><figure style=""margin: 0px
<div data-id=""34399410""><figure style=""margin: 0px

<div data-id=""34400098""><figure style=""margin: 0px

XGO-Mini is the latest product of Luwu Intelligence Technology. Luwu Intelligence is a STEM education technology company founded by a team from HIT (Harbin Institute of Technology). The company focuses on the development of XGO robot, a bionic quadruped robot dog for youth AI education.
<div data-id=""34251485""><figure style=""margin: 0px
<div data-id=""34400989""><figure style=""margin: 0px
<div data-id=""34400686""><figure style=""margin: 0px
column2: > ","XGO-Mini is a desktop-sized AI quadruped robot with 12 degrees of freedom which can achieve omnidirectional movement, six-dimensional posture control, stable posture, and a variety of motions.

column1: Equipped with a 9-axis IMU, its joint position sensor and electric current sensor is able to reflect to its own posture and joint rotation angle and torque, which are used for algorithms verification and exploitation, and can be programmed by computer to alert poison words and python programming. It is designed for education, research, algorithm verification, and entertainment.

XGO-Mini has fully functional AI modules which can facilitate both entry and advanced-level AI applications. The Al modules come with the features of visual recognition, voice recognition, and gesture recognition giving XGO-Mini the ability to hear, recognize and reply to users like a real dog. It also can track multiple colors and recognize QR codes, April Tag, and DataMatrix, etc. Through different programming, it can achieve more functions beyond your imagination.
Mask Detection
Gesture Recognition
Object Analysis
AI Chip

XGO-Mini’s AI module has a built-in Kendryte K210 Chip, featuring RISC-V processor architecture, audio-visual, standalone IP core, and strong programmability. It supports images, audio, video, machine learning models, and other types of materials stored in a Micro SD card.

XGO Team has collaborated with Canaan by using its Kendryte K210 Chip, the most powerful edge computing chip, designs for both visual and semantic recognition, widely used in various scenarios. Canaan is a leading provider of supercomputing solutions, distinguished for superior cost-efficiencies and performance.
12 Degrees of Freedom

Based on inverse kinematics, XGO-Mini’s 12 active joints enable it to move forward, backward, left, and right and support omnidirectional movement and the superposition of motion in multiple directions.   More about the joints

XGO-Mini, as a quadruped robot, can mimic the motion of a dog walking and has certain advantages like walking on uneven terrain and extremely rough surfaces. It can even adapt to avoid obstacles by adjusting its height. With its unique bionic system, XGO Mini can perform any dynamic movement.

XGO’s joints are composed of DC motors, reduction gears, sensors, and control circuits, with a servo control PID algorithm system. Subverts the traditional steering gear without closed-loop function, 360° angle controllable, angle recognition accuracy 0.088 degrees, with built-in acceleration, start and stop function, making mechanized actions smooth and realistic (Design By Luwu Intelligence, Made By Feetech)
Self-stabilization

Built-in IMUs capture XGO-Mini movement data and generate a highly flexible & stable motion performance. Through the posture data obtained by the IMU, closed-loop control allows XGO-Mini to adapt to external forces, adjust to the target posture of the manual action, and enable the teaching function.
When its feet are not moving, the motion control of six degrees of freedom of the body can be actualized. It has unprecedented mobility which coordinates all instinctive and sophisticated movements.
One-button Design

XGO-Mini comes as an assembled kit, so it's ready to be used. With its one-button design and exclusive app, you can interact with XGO-Mini right away with ease. With the Edge Computing Chip, AI can run on local systems and can be controlled without the Internet and mobile.
App Control
Open-source and DIY Your XGO-Mini

XGO-Mini allows users to program it with Python and we also supply ROS packages run on Ubuntu or Raspberry for developers. Everyone can create their own functions for XGO-Mini for education, entertainment, and commercial use. Unlimited programming possibilities help you to explore, learn, and have fun.  If XGO-Mini is not enough for you, we will provide you an advanced version, XGO-Ultra.
All Metal Design

XGO-Mini is the latest product of Luwu Intelligence Technology. Luwu Intelligence is a STEM education technology company founded by a team from HIT (Harbin Institute of Technology). The company focuses on the development of XGO robot, a bionic quadruped robot dog for youth AI education.",45.0,2,"1 Campaign
|","Harbin, China",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/xgo-mini-advanced-quadruped-robot-with-ai-modules/pica

Imagine if you could build your very own mobile phone

MAKERphone is an educational mobile phone that you assemble and code yourself.

It’s a kit, it’s fun, it’s simple… and we need your help to make it happen.

What can I do with it?

MAKE...
• A fully functional mobile phone that you can code yourself
• Games such as space invaders, pong, or snake
• Apps such as a custom media player that only plays cat videos
• Programs in Arduino
• Lines of code in Python
• Your first working piece of code in Scratch
• A custom case
LEARN...
• What a resistor does
• The basics of electronics
• How to solder
• How your smartphone works
• How to code
• Physical computing
• Scratch
• Python
• Arduino (which is based on C/C++)

Turning consumers into creators

Mobile phones are revolutionary. They’ve changed and shaped the life of a modern man like nothing else. 

Everybody has one and daily activities without this tiny black “brick” are unthinkable for most of us.

Despite their presence little does an average person know what’s inside this magical device.

With MAKERphone we’re trying to show people that every machine you see was designed by a human being not different nor smarter than themselves.

MAKERphone is actually an educational device disguised in the shape of a mobile phone.

Our main goal is turning consumers into creators.

MAKERphone steps up the game

We’ve learned A LOT from manufacturing and shipping over 6000 MAKERbuino kits in the past year and here’s a short list of most notable changes and improvements that we’ve implemented in MAKERphone:
•  A color screen
• Better microcontroller with our custom software
• Python programming language compatibility
• Scratch programming language compatibility
• Dedicated DAC and electronic volume controller for sound regulation and mp3 playback
• 8 individually programmable RGB LEDs for a lightshow in your palms
• Better PCB architecture for easier soldering
• New prettier box with a black touchy cut-out sponge (IMPORTANT!)
• The thing can now make calls, has a SIM card, and built-in Wi-Fi, Bluetooth
• RTC (real time clock) - MAKERphone now keeps time and wakes you up!

4G or not to 4G?


MAKERphone used to come in two variants - 2G and 4G.

We have decided to discontinue the 2G version as there was a lot of confusion about the difference between the 2G and the 4G version of the phone.

All MAKERphones bought after 19th April 2019 support 4G networks and come preconfigured for your region’s network.

How is MAKERphone 4G different?

MAKERphone 4G is a version of MAKERphone with a 4G chipset (SIM7600) instead of a 2G GSM chipset (SIM800) that’s included on the standard MAKERphone. 

The other aspects of MAKERphone will work similarly on both models.

MAKERphone teaches you about wires and chips (a.k.a. “hardware”)

MAKERphone is hardware. 
MAKERphone is wires. 
MAKERphone is chips. 
MAKERphone is education.
MAKERphone runs on electricity and has the same components as your smartphone.

It comes in a kit form (not assembled) - you get a box with all the electronic components necessary for building your own fully working mobile phone.

You’ll need two things to build your MAKERphone:
1) some basic tools
2) passion and interest in technology

MAKERphone is FUN

We’re living in the 21st century when kids are not only playing Fortnite. They are building their own electronic devices in their garages #badass #supersmart 

There’s internet, open-source code and wires you can buy on the internet. All knowledge is a few clicks away and you just need the willpower to start learning and doing something new!

Try building your own mobile phone, you'll see how much fun it is!

MAKERphone needs tools

MAKERphone teaches you REAL electronics, it’s not like those wanna-be Lego-like electronics kits.

hus, you'll need some REAL tools and equipment for assembling your MAKERphone:
• A regular soldering iron (nothing super expensive)
• Some solder
• Diagonal cutter pliers
• A regular screwdriver
• A piece of insulating tape

If you're a maker, you probably already have these tools.

If you're a maker-to-be and still don't have these tools, don't worry as we've got you covered.

We've prepped a special version of the MAKERphone kit that already comes with the required tools.

Check out the rewards section (at the bottom of the listing) for more info about the available kit versions.

Who is this kit for?

Based on our experience, an 11-year-old kid should be able to assemble their own MAKERphone with a tiny bit of help from an adult. 

Therefore, the estimated age group is 11+. 

Estimated hardware build time: 7 hours. 

Build time varies and depends on the skills of the person and if the person has ever soldered before.

Estimated play time: unlimited

Estimated software development and learning time: unlimited

Building the MAKERphone is just the beginning. After that you'll spend numerous hours creating your own games, apps, learning about software, and experimenting with hardware.

What's in the kit?
<li>
MAKERphone circuit board - the main board that connects all the components in a uniform device that can work as a mobile phone
<li>
MAKERphone casing - multiple sheets of acrylic cut with the power of lasers. They protect the innards and give MAKERphone this sleek look
<li>
128*160 full-color TFT LCD - for playing games, displaying phone numbers and everything in between
<li>
GSM module - a tiny module responsible for everything related to calling and texting other people
<li>
Main microcomputer module - a dual-core processor with built-in Wi-Fi, BLE, and a charging circuit
<li>
Sound module - a board with a DAC (digital to analog converter) chip and a headphone jack for music playback (responsible for ringtones, alarms, game sound effects)
<li>
Amplifier module - makes loud buzzes, bleeps and bloops
<li>
Stick-on antenna - for superb phone signal (a.k.a. send text messages while in the bathroom)
• A bag with other tiny electronic components such as pushbuttons and colored button caps with a 128MB SD card preloaded with games and apps included

What’s in the tools pack?

If you choose a perk with a tools pack included, you’ll get this neat wooden box filled with all the essential tools needed for  MAKERphone assembly:
<li>
USB soldering iron (lightweight and portable, solder on the go!)
<li>
Metal soldering iron stand
<li>
USB cable for the soldering iron
<li>
Screwdriver
<li>
USB power brick for powering your soldering iron
<li>
Some solder
<li>
Needle nose pliers
• Diagonal cutter pliers

MAKERphone teaches you Python

Python Is Everywhere.

Python is and has been for a while one of the world's most popular programming languages.

Every day, without realizing it, you probably use software that is written in Python and big companies use it to write all sorts of useful applications.

Python is easy to learn, intuitive, pleasing to the eye and comes with a plethora of libraries.

In fact, Python’s creator Guido van Rossum said that he wants to make computer programming accessible to everybody.

The best thing - you can code your own apps and games for MAKERphone using Python!

MAKERphone runs a special version of python called MicroPython - which has all the basic functions with some specific ones that we’ve defined in order to help you control your MAKERphone’s hardware.

Python is a type of programming language that’s not compiled but instead interpreted by the device in real time.

Despite that, we’ve designed special code snippets that will “freeze” your Python code and generate an executable file that can be placed on your MAEKRphone’s SD card!

MAKERphone teaches you Scratch

Scratch is a revolutionary program that makes it easy for kids as young as 5 to learn how to code with a simple drag-and-drop system of programming.

It already is one of the most popular programming tools for schools.

An awesome project called Whitecat IDE made it possible to control MAKERphone’s hardware with ease! It’s an open-source online tool that allows you to create code in a Scratch-like environment.

If you’ve never coded before, this is the way to go. 

Scratch’s intuitive design will let you code your first MAKERphone app in mere minutes!

MAKERphone loves Arduino

YES, we love Arduino!

Oh, Arduino, you’ve taught us to code and we’ve delved into the word of electronics thanks to your board. 

This product and our company was made possible thanks to Arduino’s open-sourcefulness and community.

Albert: “If Arduino was a lady, I’d take her to a fine dinner… with my GF’s permission, of course!”

Therefore, MAKERphone is based on Arduino-compatible ESP32 microcontroller and can be programmed in Arduino IDE (based on C/C++) - the most popular programming environment for makers and hardware enthusiasts.

MAKERphone is compatible with numerous Arduino related examples of manipulating various hardware and software components. 

In fact, it's compatible with most Arduino software libraries available online and will work with many Arduino shields and modules with minimal or no library code modifications.

MAKERphone takes you from Padawan to Jedi Master

You’ve never coded before? 

You also don’t know a thing about hardware? 

Absolutely no problemo as MAKERphone will take you from learning how to wield a soldering iron through assembling your very own fully functional mobile phone all the way to coding your very own app or game for your very own DIY mobile phone.

We’ve segmented the learning process into levels (like in a video game):

MAKERphone does games and apps

MAKERphone comes with a 128MB SD card preinstalled with dozens of useful applications, tools and games.

It comes with all the basic mobile phone-ish apps such as contacts, SMS, phone dialer, music player, as well as a collection of neat GameBoy-inspired games. 

MAKERphone is MAKERbuino-compatible

MAKERbuino games can be played on MAKERphone and they’re in full color this time!

MAKE your own apps and games!

YES! 

MAKERphone is DIY in its every aspect. 

Assemble the bits and pieces together in order to create a fully functional phone and get down to coding your own games and apps.

Our comprehensive tutorials will lead you through every step of your creative process.

There are three main ways to create a game/app for your MAKERphone:
<li>

Scratch! 
A.k.a. colorful blocks that you drag and drop together in order to make your first app.
<li>

Python! 
Use one of the most popular programming languages used in almost every educational institution or school that teaches people coding.
<li>

Arduino (C/C++)
The most popular programming platform for makers and DIY-ers is MAKERphone-compatible and we like it a lot.

After coding your app, you can compile it to an “executable” binary file and put it on your MAKERphone’s SD card.

Apps located on the SD card are accessed through MAKERphone’s main menu via the “Apps” icon.

We’ve coded a programming library with sets of commands that let you easily:
• develop in-app menus and other GUI-related content
• play and develop sound FX and background music
• draw, display, and animate bitmaps
• control MAKERphone’s hardware (i.e. make calls, read files from SD card, flash LEDs)

CircuitMess world is a place for MAKERphone users to share their creations, exchange knowledge, and download programs made by others as well as a collection of tutorials, guides, and MAKERphone-related documentation.

Every game or app in CircuitMess world is open-source and available with a downloadable source code along with a compiled binary file that you can load directly on your device’s SD card.

To put it simply, you can take a look at the code of every MAKERphone compatible game or app, learn something new, change the code and implement parts of the code in your own project.

Our tutorials collection consists of two main parts:
<li>
Official tutorials and guides written by the MAKERphone team
<li>
User-created tutorials that everyone can write and share a bit of knowledge with other creators

Customize your MAKERphone's UI 

MAKERphone is customizable.

Express yourself by customizing your phone's UI.

This can be done through MAKERphone's settings or editing a setup file on MAKERphone's SD card. 

MAKERphone does multimedia

MAKERphone plays music, shows photos and runs videos.

MAKERphone does multimedia!

It supports mp3 files and you can set your favorite song as a ringtone by simply dragging and dropping it on MAKERphone’s SD card and selecting it in the menu.

MAKERphone GLOWS!

8 individually controllable RGB LEDs with 60FPS refresh rate make your MAKERphone glow (it’s literally glowing).
column3:
showinfo=0"">
 

Control LEDs for neat in-game or in-app effects.

Make your MAKERphone turn red when you’re low on health or shooting projectiles in your mobile game.

Use RGB LEDs as a giant flashlight or just as a giant notification light. 

MAKERphone has (wicked) specs

Oh, so you’re that smarty pants that talks about teraflops and other imaginary words?

Well, here you go. Here’s a detailed explanation of MAKERhone’s hardware:

column1:
Microcontroller (the chip that does smart stuff):

ESP32 with Xtensa dual-core 32-bit LX6 microprocessor, operating at 160MHz and performing at up to 600 DMIPS.

4MB of built-in flash memory + 520kB of SRAM.

I2c interface, i2s interface, UARTs, PWM, ultra-low power consumption and what not.

Display: 1.8"", 160*128px full color (RGB 16bit) 

25FPS refresh rate by default, up to 50FPS.

Digitally controllable backlight level.
<li>

Battery: LiPo 3.7V 600mAh, charged through micro USB B port.

Sufficient for approximately 3 days of normal use.
<li>

Sound: 10bit dedicated DAC (PCM5102) 

multi-channel MP3 playback 

2W class-D audio amp, audio jack 3.5mm, 1W speaker, dedicated EVC (electronic volume controller - PT2257)
<li>
Backlights: 8 independently addressable and controllable RGB LEDs for light effects in your palms!
<li>
Buttons: 4-way mechanical joystick, 12-button numeric keypad, A (confirm), B (back), 4 multi-purpose addressable buttons (C, D, E, F)

Micro SD card socket: FAT and FAT32 compatible.

Every console comes with a 128MB SD card with dozens of MAKERphone-compatible games and apps preloaded!

Change between games and apps on the go, no computer required!
<li>
RTC (real time clock): DS3231 Extremely Accurate I²C-Integrated RTC with temperature compensation - this thing keeps time and takes care of alarms
<li>
Force feedback: eccentric rotating mass vibration motor (ERM) a.k.a. a tiny motor that vibrates the phone

Network: Built-in Wi-Fi 802.11 b/g/n and Bluetooth v4.2 BR/EDR and BLE

SIM800L GSM chipset (the thing that calls other people) with built-in Quad-band 850/900/1800/1900MHz.

Micro SIM card slot.

Help us make MAKERphone happen! Share the project with your friends!
column5:
source="" rel=""noopener nofollow"">

MAKERphone <
column6:
3 open-source

We love open-source. 

We’ve learned how to code and design electronic devices thanks to the internet and open-source technology.

Thus, we want to push our work back into the community.

MAKERphone's software is fully open-source and available for you to download.

MAKERphone's hardware's schematics along with the bill of materials are also open-source and available online.

That means that you can use our documentation to experiment with our hardware design using the provided documentation and schematics and create your own MAKERphone compatible boards and modules.

Oh, and implement our code in your other projects too!

MAKERphone has colors

HOLY COW! TUTTI FRUTTI!

MAEKRphone’s aesthetic design comes in many color options:

column1:
Elegant black 

I’M BATMAN, pick this one if you’re a tough guy/girl

• Hipsterish wood

Genuine wood… even smells like wood

Plain white
White… just that

Yucky yellow   
YUCK! Looks like cheese, though...

Adriatic blue 
Blue as the Croatian sea

Radioactive orange 
Made out of freshly squeezed radioactive oranges

Cherry red
No cherries were harmed in the making of this case

You’ll be able to pick your desired style in a survey sent after the campaign ends (that’s how Kickstarter works, DUH!)

MAKERphone has rewards

MAKERphone has a timeline

Follow us on social media 

We’ve got all of them:

TWITTER
FACEBOOK
INSTAGRAM
even YOUTUBE

The story of MAKERphone (and CircuitMess)

Albert here! Let me tell you a story of CircuitMess and MAKERbuino.

CircuitMess is a technology startup founded a year and a half ago after a successful Kickstarter campaign for MAKERbuino (https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/albertgajsak/makerbuino-a-diy-game-console). 

The name of our startup stems from two words:

Circuit (we make electronic circuits) + Mess (our company is a mess) 

After successfully delivering MAKERbuino, we were collecting feedback from thousands of users and have started thinking about our next big step.

An idea of a DIY mobile phone came in and we had so much fun brainstorming, developing and goofing around whilst preparing this amazing product and this exciting campaign :)

Thank you!

Our company was founded over a year ago thanks to generous Kickstarter supporters just like you.

As a result of your help, our lives have changed and our hobbies turned into full-time jobs.

This wonderful experience allowed us to spread positive influence, open jobs and learn A LOT.

This shaped and defined us as people that we are today. 

MAKERphone has a “gang”

This whole story was started by Albert, his brother, and a few friends back when he was in high school.

They were all working on it after school/work as much as they could.

Since then, a lot has changed.

We've rented a real workplace and started employing people (job interviews yay!).

CircuitMess has grown to 7 full-time employees and a few part-timers and we've successfully converted this small hype-driven business into a self-sustainable startup.

Oh, and we have a microwave oven now too! 

Special thanks to: Matija Fućek, Tena Marčac, Degordian, Miron Bedić, Bruno Staroveški, Matea Tepić, Borna Bedić, Laura Rožić, Emil Gajšak, Antonio Valentić, Fran Božidar Prahić, Ana Car, Tomislav Car, Eric the Dog, Infinum, Luka Travas, Darko Kontin, Flavorific, Mediatoolkit, Bornfight, FabLab Hrvatska, Roberto Vdović.

Risks and challenges

Having a hardware startup can sometimes be harsh. 

Mass production risks are real and we’ve taken every precaution to prepare for them:

-MAKERphone uses common, easy to get components that can be easily purchased in large quantities.

-Hired workers and helpers will be doing the production of kits at our headquarters. We will directly control the manufacturing process and the quality of the finished kits

-We already have certain experience with producing similar kits and a production line set up as we’ve already successfully delivered a total of 6000 MAKERbuino kits sold via Kickstarter, our webshop and more than 25 of our distributors worldwide

- We’re a team of hard-working young technology enthusiasts living for what we do and believing in what we live for 

We promise we'll keep you updated about any issues that may arise. 

Keep making!

Metal soldering iron stand
USB cable for the soldering iron
Screwdriver
USB power brick for powering your soldering iron
Some solder
Needle nose pliers
Diagonal cutter pliers

MAKERphone teaches you PythonPython Is Everywhere.Python is and has been for a while one of the world's most popular programming languages.Every day, without realizing it, you probably use software that is written in Python and big companies use it to write all sorts of useful applications.Python is easy to learn, intuitive, pleasing to the eye and comes with a plethora of libraries.In fact, Python’s creator Guido van Rossum said that he wants to make computer programming accessible to everybody.The best thing - you can code your own apps and games for MAKERphone using Python!MAKERphone runs a special version of python called MicroPython - which has all the basic functions with some specific ones that we’ve defined in order to help you control your MAKERphone’s hardware.Python is a type of programming language that’s not compiled but instead interpreted by the device in real time.Despite that, we’ve designed special code snippets that will “freeze” your Python code and generate an executable file that can be placed on your MAEKRphone’s SD card!MAKERphone teaches you ScratchScratch is a revolutionary program that makes it easy for kids as young as 5 to learn how to code with a simple drag-and-drop system of programming.It already is one of the most popular programming tools for schools.An awesome project called Whitecat IDE made it possible to control MAKERphone’s hardware with ease! It’s an open-source online tool that allows you to create code in a Scratch-like environment.If you’ve never coded before, this is the way to go. Scratch’s intuitive design will let you code your first MAKERphone app in mere minutes!MAKERphone loves ArduinoYES, we love Arduino!Oh, Arduino, you’ve taught us to code and we’ve delved into the word of electronics thanks to your board. This product and our company was made possible thanks to Arduino’s open-sourcefulness and community.Albert: “If Arduino was a lady, I’d take her to a fine dinner… with my GF’s permission, of course!”Therefore, MAKERphone is based on Arduino-compatible ESP32 microcontroller and can be programmed in Arduino IDE (based on C/C++) - the most popular programming environment for makers and hardware enthusiasts.MAKERphone is compatible with numerous Arduino related examples of manipulating various hardware and software components. In fact, it's compatible with most Arduino software libraries available online and will work with many Arduino shields and modules with minimal or no library code modifications.MAKERphone takes you from Padawan to Jedi MasterYou’ve never coded before? You also don’t know a thing about hardware? Absolutely no problemo as MAKERphone will take you from learning how to wield a soldering iron through assembling your very own fully functional mobile phone all the way to coding your very own app or game for your very own DIY mobile phone.We’ve segmented the learning process into levels (like in a video game):MAKERphone does games and appsMAKERphone comes with a 128MB SD card preinstalled with dozens of useful applications, tools and games.It comes with all the basic mobile phone-ish apps such as contacts, SMS, phone dialer, music player, as well as a collection of neat GameBoy-inspired games. MAKERphone is MAKERbuino-compatibleMAKERbuino games can be played on MAKERphone and they’re in full color this time!MAKE your own apps and games!YES! MAKERphone is DIY in its every aspect. Assemble the bits and pieces together in order to create a fully functional phone and get down to coding your own games and apps.Our comprehensive tutorials will lead you through every step of your creative process.There are three main ways to create a game/app for your MAKERphone:
Scratch! A.k.a. colorful blocks that you drag and drop together in order to make your first app.
Python! Use one of the most popular programming languages used in almost every educational institution or school that teaches people coding.
Arduino (C/C++)The most popular programming platform for makers and DIY-ers is MAKERphone-compatible and we like it a lot.

After coding your app, you can compile it to an “executable” binary file and put it on your MAKERphone’s SD card.Apps located on the SD card are accessed through MAKERphone’s main menu via the “Apps” icon.We’ve coded a programming library with sets of commands that let you easily:
develop in-app menus and other GUI-related content
play and develop sound FX and background music
draw, display, and animate bitmaps
control MAKERphone’s hardware (i.e. make calls, read files from SD card, flash LEDs)

CircuitMess world is a place for MAKERphone users to share their creations, exchange knowledge, and download programs made by others as well as a collection of tutorials, guides, and MAKERphone-related documentation.Every game or app in CircuitMess world is open-source and available with a downloadable source code along with a compiled binary file that you can load directly on your device’s SD card.To put it simply, you can take a look at the code of every MAKERphone compatible game or app, learn something new, change the code and implement parts of the code in your own project.Our tutorials collection consists of two main parts:
Official tutorials and guides written by the MAKERphone team
User-created tutorials that everyone can write and share a bit of knowledge with other creators

Customize your MAKERphone's UI MAKERphone is customizable.Express yourself by customizing your phone's UI.This can be done through MAKERphone's settings or editing a setup file on MAKERphone's SD card. MAKERphone does multimediaMAKERphone plays music, shows photos and runs videos.MAKERphone does multimedia!It supports mp3 files and you can set your favorite song as a ringtone by simply dragging and dropping it on MAKERphone’s SD card and selecting it in the menu.MAKERphone GLOWS!8 individually controllable RGB LEDs with 60FPS refresh rate make your MAKERphone glow (it’s literally glowing). Control LEDs for neat in-game or in-app effects.Make your MAKERphone turn red when you’re low on health or shooting projectiles in your mobile game.Use RGB LEDs as a giant flashlight or just as a giant notification light. MAKERphone has (wicked) specsOh, so you’re that smarty pants that talks about teraflops and other imaginary words?Well, here you go. Here’s a detailed explanation of MAKERhone’s hardware:

Microcontroller (the chip that does smart stuff):ESP32 with Xtensa dual-core 32-bit LX6 microprocessor, operating at 160MHz and performing at up to 600 DMIPS.4MB of built-in flash memory + 520kB of SRAM.I2c interface, i2s interface, UARTs, PWM, ultra-low power consumption and what not.
Display: 1.8"", 160*128px full color (RGB 16bit) 25FPS refresh rate by default, up to 50FPS.Digitally controllable backlight level.
Battery: LiPo 3.7V 600mAh, charged through micro USB B port.Sufficient for approximately 3 days of normal use.
Sound: 10bit dedicated DAC (PCM5102) multi-channel MP3 playback 2W class-D audio amp, audio jack 3.5mm, 1W speaker, dedicated EVC (electronic volume controller - PT2257)
Backlights: 8 independently addressable and controllable RGB LEDs for light effects in your palms!
Buttons: 4-way mechanical joystick, 12-button numeric keypad, A (confirm), B (back), 4 multi-purpose addressable buttons (C, D, E, F)

Micro SD card socket: FAT and FAT32 compatible.Every console comes with a 128MB SD card with dozens of MAKERphone-compatible games and apps preloaded!Change between games and apps on the go, no computer required!
RTC (real time clock): DS3231 Extremely Accurate I²C-Integrated RTC with temperature compensation - this thing keeps time and takes care of alarms
Force feedback: eccentric rotating mass vibration motor (ERM) a.k.a. a tiny motor that vibrates the phone

Network: Built-in Wi-Fi 802.11 b/g/n and Bluetooth v4.2 BR/EDR and BLESIM800L GSM chipset (the thing that calls other people) with built-in Quad-band 850/900/1800/1900MHz.Micro SIM card slot.Help us make MAKERphone happen! Share the project with your friends! MAKERphone <3 open-sourceWe love open-source. We’ve learned how to code and design electronic devices thanks to the internet and open-source technology.Thus, we want to push our work back into the community.MAKERphone's software is fully open-source and available for you to download.MAKERphone's hardware's schematics along with the bill of materials are also open-source and available online.That means that you can use our documentation to experiment with our hardware design using the provided documentation and schematics and create your own MAKERphone compatible boards and modules.Oh, and implement our code in your other projects too!MAKERphone has colorsHOLY COW! TUTTI FRUTTI!MAEKRphone’s aesthetic design comes in many color options:
Elegant black I’M BATMAN, pick this one if you’re a tough guy/girl
Hipsterish woodGenuine wood… even smells like wood
Plain white White… just that
Yucky yellow   YUCK! Looks like cheese, though...
Adriatic blue Blue as the Croatian sea
Radioactive orange Made out of freshly squeezed radioactive oranges
Cherry redNo cherries were harmed in the making of this case

You’ll be able to pick your desired style in a survey sent after the campaign ends (that’s how Kickstarter works, DUH!)MAKERphone has rewardsMAKERphone has a timelineFollow us on social media We’ve got all of them:TWITTERFACEBOOKINSTAGRAMeven YOUTUBEThe story of MAKERphone (and CircuitMess)Albert here! Let me tell you a story of CircuitMess and MAKERbuino.CircuitMess is a technology startup founded a year and a half ago after a successful Kickstarter campaign for MAKERbuino (https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/albertgajsak/makerbuino-a-diy-game-console). The name of our startup stems from two words:Circuit (we make electronic circuits) + Mess (our company is a mess) After successfully delivering MAKERbuino, we were collecting feedback from thousands of users and have started thinking about our next big step.An idea of a DIY mobile phone came in and we had so much fun brainstorming, developing and goofing around whilst preparing this amazing product and this exciting campaign :)Thank you!Our company was founded over a year ago thanks to generous Kickstarter supporters just like you.As a result of your help, our lives have changed and our hobbies turned into full-time jobs.This wonderful experience allowed us to spread positive influence, open jobs and learn A LOT.This shaped and defined us as people that we are today. MAKERphone has a “gang”This whole story was started by Albert, his brother, and a few friends back when he was in high school.They were all working on it after school/work as much as they could.Since then, a lot has changed.We've rented a real workplace and started employing people (job interviews yay!).CircuitMess has grown to 7 full-time employees and a few part-timers and we've successfully converted this small hype-driven business into a self-sustainable startup.Oh, and we have a microwave oven now too! Special thanks to: Matija Fućek, Tena Marčac, Degordian, Miron Bedić, Bruno Staroveški, Matea Tepić, Borna Bedić, Laura Rožić, Emil Gajšak, Antonio Valentić, Fran Božidar Prahić, Ana Car, Tomislav Car, Eric the Dog, Infinum, Luka Travas, Darko Kontin, Flavorific, Mediatoolkit, Bornfight, FabLab Hrvatska, Roberto Vdović.Risks and challengesHaving a hardware startup can sometimes be harsh. Mass production risks are real and we’ve taken every precaution to prepare for them:-MAKERphone uses common, easy to get components that can be easily purchased in large quantities.-Hired workers and helpers will be doing the production of kits at our headquarters. We will directly control the manufacturing process and the quality of the finished kits-We already have certain experience with producing similar kits and a production line set up as we’ve already successfully delivered a total of 6000 MAKERbuino kits sold via Kickstarter, our webshop and more than 25 of our distributors worldwide- We’re a team of hard-working young technology enthusiasts living for what we do and believing in what we live for We promise we'll keep you updated about any issues that may arise. Keep making!",62.0,1,"4 Campaigns
|","Karlovac, Croatia",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/makerphone-an-educational-diy-mobile-phone/pica

STEM Powered Kits have found many problems in the STEM learning industry. Three (3) of the biggest problems are poor quality and non-reusable materials in the existing STEM learning boxes on the market today. Sustainability is a growing concern in today’s consumer market. 90% of STEM learning boxes are made of toxic plastics and cause waste disposal issues in the environment. Lastly, market leaders enforce subscription plans that are not economical and penalize buyers by charging higher prices for not joining a subscription plan. More parents and businesses are shifting towards STEM learning boxes that are more eco-friendly, durable, accessible and affordable. This apparent need has opened a new lane that STEM Powered Kits is currently filling.

STEM Powered Kits has created a new lane in an untapped market by curating STEM learning boxes that are more eco-friendly, affordable and durable. STEM Powered Kits are 55% less expensive than the market leaders. The company does not enforce subscription plans and has no hidden fees. We have designated a line of STEM learning kits made of natural wood, with a smooth finish and minimal non-toxic plastic. In addition, STEM Powered Kits are not cardboard-based. All kits are made of durable materials and are reusable.

STEM Powered Kits have science kits for kids of all ages without the worry of a required monthly subscription fee. Science kits are just the beginning! We dig deep into the concepts of science, technology, engineering and math with a splash of art with your sustainable and natural wood eco-friendly customizable designs.

Building, constructing and exploring STEM Powered Kits will spark moments of wonder &
column2:
discovery! Our kits help kids to feel more confident and capable with every aspect of STEM as they develop their stem identity and technology fluency.

After completing a 5th-grade science project, Alaina and Zakiya noticed that there was a lack of STEM learning boxes that were affordable, accessible, eco-friendly and durable. In addition, most parents, students and businesses did not know where to start or what materials to use to explore the world of STEM. The vast majority of schools do not have STEM programs and the schools that do on average hold classes once a week for 1 (one) hour with no take-home projects.

STEM Powered Kits is actively addressing the demand for durable, sustainable and eco-friendly learning materials. Our STEM learning kits are gaining popularity among kids and parents by addressing the growing desire to learn and explore away from computers, phones and television screens. STEM Powered Kits is allowing customers to purchase STEM learning boxes without being obligated to commit to a subscription service, closing the accessibility gap.

STEM Powered Kits has accomplished many milestones and has been gaining traction since the launching of the company. From securing strategic partnerships to establishing affiliate agreements with influential players in the STEM industry, STEM Powered Kits is destined for continued success and growth.

STEM Powered Kits are 55% less expensive than the market leaders. Customers get twice the products for the same price and far better quality. Apart from our amazing prices, STEM Powered Kits gives customers the freedom to purchase without the obligation of committing to a subscription plan with hidden fees. Customers love our STEM learning kits because of the use of minimal plastic and durable materials.  Our kits are made of natural wood and other high-quality, long-lasting materials. All learning kits are reusable and designed to last for multiple uses. Parents love the sustainable aspect, while kids love the fun factor. 

As we have continued to gain traction, we have established great partnerships with many influential organizations.

column1: <li>

Donors Choose - DonorsChoose is the nonprofit classroom funding site for public school teachers. Educators from every corner of America create classroom project requests, and donors can give any amount to the project that inspires them.
<li>

Georgia Cyber Academy - Georgia Cyber Academy is a statewide, tuition-free, online, accredited public charter school for students in grades K-12.  GCA provides a learning environment where students are empowered to reach their full academic potential through active participation in live interactive classes and an engaging curriculum that supports individualized and differentiated student learning paths.
<li>

Decatur Makers - Located in downtown Decatur in 2,500 square foot makerspace, Decatur Makers is a diverse community made up of makers from 5 to 105 years old. Their goal is to foster a place where all makers feel welcomed and accepted regardless of background, race, gender, lifestyle, skill sets, experience, or age.

Meet the Mother-Daughter duo! STEM Powered Kits is a family-owned and female-owned business with a combination of both youth and experience. Alaina Davis is the 11-year old Chief Executive Officer of STEM Powered Kits. She is an A-Honor Roll Student at Georgia Cyber Academy is a HUGE stem fanatic! Zakiya Brown is the Chief of Operations at STEM Powered Kits. She is an Alumni of the Unsinkable Albany State University. She holds both a Bachelors's and Master's degree and has over 13 years of experience in true entrepreneurship and growing and scaling businesses.

Check out just a few of our features in the News &
• WTOC
• Savannah Morning News
• The Creative Coast
• Decatur Makers
• Georgia Cyber Academy
• And many more!!!

Check out our Eco-Friendly STEM Powered Kits!
column3:
/>

Ball Pitching Machine: Enjoy the thrill and accomplishment of building your own ball pitching machine. Learn how motor and mechanics interconnect. Made of eco-friendly and long-lasting materials. Feel free to paint and decorate this kit. Let your creativity and imagination run wild!

STEM CONCEPTS EXPLORED

column1: • Engineering
• Electric Wiring
• Switches
<li>Potential &amp

Solar Race Car: Almost every form of energy used by humans originates as energy from the sun—give kids a hands-on lesson on its importance by constructing our solar-powered race car! Children will learn how solar cells transform light into energy and how vehicles use this energy to complete daily tasks. Using solar power also teaches the importance of using environmentally friendly power. 

STEM CONCEPTS EXPLORED
• Electric Wiring
• Gears
• Switches In Circuits
• Solar Energy

Hydraulic Lift Table: Develop an understanding of basic mechanical structures and power transmission with the hydraulic lift table. Young engineers learn how fluid transfer can make the workload easier and discover the mechanical advantage of levers when moving objects. Experimenters use syringes to manipulated the lift table to go up and down. Lift table kit can be operated with or without liquid in the pistons. Made of eco-friendly and long-lasting materials. Feel free to paint and decorate this kit. Let your creativity and imagination run wild!

 STEM CONCEPTS EXPLORED
• Engineering
• Hydraulic Systems
• Robotics
• Power Transmission

Graffiti Robot: Learn about the science of robotics in a fun, hands-on way! Challenge your child's imagination with our Graffiti Robot STEM kit. Perfect for any young scientist, this fun robotics stem kit uses the vibration and spin generated by its motor to create works of art. Adjust the angle and height of the robot's colored pens to make new patterns. Not only does this kit foster creativity and teach mechanical principles, but it's an excellent opportunity to show kids how toys are assembled and function.

This STEM Kit is a great way to investigate balanced and unbalanced forces by solving open-ended engineering problems. Kids can identify how forces acting on the motor cause the robot to vibrate, and how those vibrations in turn cause the robot to draw graffiti.

Modify the robot to recreate a specific drawing. Adjust predetermined variables to produce unique drawings. Change variables of the robot, test, and observe in order to create unique drawings. Investigate the robot’s movement and discover which modifications produce the desired result — a specific drawing.

STEM CONCEPTS EXPLORED
• Engineering
• Electric Wiring
• Switches
• Motion and Stability
• Automated Drawing

Electric Wired Jeep: Explore engineering, circuits and switches with the electric wired jeep. Easily grasps the concepts of wiring and mechanics with this STEM Kit. Made of eco-friendly and long-lasting materials. Feel free to paint and decorate this kit. Let your creativity and imagination run wild!

STEM CONCEPTS EXPLORED
• Engineering
• Electric Wiring
• Gears
• Switches In Circuit

Electric Wind Car: Explore engineering, circuits and switches with the electric wind car. Easily grasps the concepts of wiring and mechanics with this STEM Kit. Made of eco-friendly and long-lasting materials. Feel free to paint and decorate this kit. Let your creativity and imagination run wild!

CONCEPTS EXPLORED
• Engineering
• Electric Wiring
• Switches In Circuits

LED Flashlight: Learn about circuits and positive and negative charges in a fun way with our LED Flashlight. Made of eco-friendly and long-lasting materials. Feel free to paint and decorate this kit. Let your creativity and imagination run wild!

CONCEPTS EXPLORED
• Engineering
• Electric Wiring
• LED Circuits
• Switches

Mechanical Hand: Learn about tension, engineering and articulation with our Mechanical Hand. Made of eco-friendly and long-lasting materials. Feel free to paint and decorate this kit. Let your creativity and imagination run wild!

STEM CONCEPTS EXPLORED
• Engineering
• Tension
• Articulation

Balloon Race Car: Explore the force of air and the momentum it produces while building a car that’s powered by a balloon. Build a balloon race car then attach a balloon, inflate it, and let it go! After measuring and recording the distance you can make alterations to the design to find ways to make the car go faster, slower, or farther. They can also experiment with friction by testing the car on various surfaces, such as a smooth floor or a carpeted floor, to see how the car reacts. This introduces students to the basics of power and pressure as the air escapes from the balloon. They can also see how changing variables, such as adding rubber bands for friction to the wheels or adjusting the inflation level of the balloon, can affect the speed of the car or how far it travels. Explore with hands-on learning the force, power, thrust, and Newton’s Second and Third Laws of Motion as you observe the car racing from the starting line.

STEM CONCEPTS EXPLORED
• Change
• Constancy
• Measurement
<li>Motions &amp
• Engineering
• Data Analysis
<li>Reasoning &amp

Electric Circuit Kit: Everything from digital watches to electronic fuel delivery on today’s vehicles relies on circuits to create the required electricity. Children learn the fundamentals of circuitry as they follow the flow of electrons from a battery with the electric circuit kit. They’ll see how the power of circuits can convert potential energy of electrons into chemical, electrical, light, sound, motion, and heat energy! Then they’ll observe how energy flow differs when using batteries and loads in series and in parallel. 

CONCEPTS EXPLORED
• Electric Wiring
• Gears
• Switches In Circuits
<li>Simple &amp

Fruit Battery: Experience the mystery of science and develop your child's imagination with hands-on learning, so that knowledge is no longer theoretical. This STEM Powered Kit fruit battery science experiment project help to develop children's imagination, improve observation, increase scientific knowledge and cultivate scientific invention hobbies.

Package Includes: 1 watch face, 4 copper sheets, 4 zinc sheets, 3 LED Light Bulbs, wires, 4 1oz cups, 1 instructional guide (lemons/fruit not included).  No batteries required.

Cups are included if you prefer to use liquid with your project.

Interlocking Building Links: Introduce your child to science and engineering early! This 200-piece mega set arrives with a bulk supply of twisting, locking and linking snowflake-shaped discs in a variety of vibrant colors. Each of our interlocking building blocks have a letter or number engraved in it. Unlike traditional building Links, which limit little ones to stacking alone, this creative toy unleashes their creativity in every direction. Watch as they construct structurally sound buildings, countless geometric patterns, or even a 3D ball they can actually play with when done. Best of all, our lightweight, easy-clean, non-toxic material is safe for all elementary-aged kids as they discover the wonders of STEM education. To support their developing cognition, logic, imagination and spatial understanding, the answer is creative.
• Color: various
• Non-toxic
• BPA-free
• Not recommended for children under 3

PRODUCTION

Investigate the robot’s movement and discover which modifications produce the desired result — a specific drawing.STEM CONCEPTS EXPLORED
Engineering
Electric Wiring
Switches
Motion and Stability
Automated Drawing

Electric Wired Jeep: Explore engineering, circuits and switches with the electric wired jeep. Easily grasps the concepts of wiring and mechanics with this STEM Kit. Made of eco-friendly and long-lasting materials. Feel free to paint and decorate this kit. Let your creativity and imagination run wild!STEM CONCEPTS EXPLORED
Engineering
Electric Wiring
Gears
Switches In Circuit

Electric Wind Car: Explore engineering, circuits and switches with the electric wind car. Easily grasps the concepts of wiring and mechanics with this STEM Kit. Made of eco-friendly and long-lasting materials. Feel free to paint and decorate this kit. Let your creativity and imagination run wild!CONCEPTS EXPLORED
Engineering
Electric Wiring
Switches In Circuits

LED Flashlight: Learn about circuits and positive and negative charges in a fun way with our LED Flashlight. Made of eco-friendly and long-lasting materials. Feel free to paint and decorate this kit. Let your creativity and imagination run wild!CONCEPTS EXPLORED
Engineering
Electric Wiring
LED Circuits
Switches

Mechanical Hand: Learn about tension, engineering and articulation with our Mechanical Hand. Made of eco-friendly and long-lasting materials. Feel free to paint and decorate this kit. Let your creativity and imagination run wild!STEM CONCEPTS EXPLORED
Engineering
Tension
Articulation

Balloon Race Car: Explore the force of air and the momentum it produces while building a car that’s powered by a balloon. Build a balloon race car then attach a balloon, inflate it, and let it go! After measuring and recording the distance you can make alterations to the design to find ways to make the car go faster, slower, or farther. They can also experiment with friction by testing the car on various surfaces, such as a smooth floor or a carpeted floor, to see how the car reacts. This introduces students to the basics of power and pressure as the air escapes from the balloon. They can also see how changing variables, such as adding rubber bands for friction to the wheels or adjusting the inflation level of the balloon, can affect the speed of the car or how far it travels. Explore with hands-on learning the force, power, thrust, and Newton’s Second and Third Laws of Motion as you observe the car racing from the starting line.STEM CONCEPTS EXPLORED
Change
Constancy
Measurement
Motions & Forces
Engineering
Data Analysis
Reasoning & Proof

Electric Circuit Kit: Everything from digital watches to electronic fuel delivery on today’s vehicles relies on circuits to create the required electricity. Children learn the fundamentals of circuitry as they follow the flow of electrons from a battery with the electric circuit kit. They’ll see how the power of circuits can convert potential energy of electrons into chemical, electrical, light, sound, motion, and heat energy! Then they’ll observe how energy flow differs when using batteries and loads in series and in parallel. CONCEPTS EXPLORED
Electric Wiring
Gears
Switches In Circuits
Simple & Complex Circuits

Fruit Battery: Experience the mystery of science and develop your child's imagination with hands-on learning, so that knowledge is no longer theoretical. This STEM Powered Kit fruit battery science experiment project help to develop children's imagination, improve observation, increase scientific knowledge and cultivate scientific invention hobbies.Package Includes: 1 watch face, 4 copper sheets, 4 zinc sheets, 3 LED Light Bulbs, wires, 4 1oz cups, 1 instructional guide (lemons/fruit not included).  No batteries required.Cups are included if you prefer to use liquid with your project.Interlocking Building Links: Introduce your child to science and engineering early! This 200-piece mega set arrives with a bulk supply of twisting, locking and linking snowflake-shaped discs in a variety of vibrant colors. Each of our interlocking building blocks have a letter or number engraved in it. Unlike traditional building Links, which limit little ones to stacking alone, this creative toy unleashes their creativity in every direction. Watch as they construct structurally sound buildings, countless geometric patterns, or even a 3D ball they can actually play with when done. Best of all, our lightweight, easy-clean, non-toxic material is safe for all elementary-aged kids as they discover the wonders of STEM education. To support their developing cognition, logic, imagination and spatial understanding, the answer is creative.
Color: various
Non-toxic
BPA-free
Not recommended for children under 3

column2:
>“Children, more than ever, need opportunities to be in their bodies in the world. 
It’s this engagement between limbs of the body and bones of the earth
where true balance and centeredness emerge.”
~ David Sobel

column1: Introduction

True North (TN) is a place for self-directed learning in Santa Barbara, CA.  We started our journey in September 2020 after a couple years of visioning.  Oddly enough, the unpredictable nature of the pandemic offered us an open door to step through.  And, we did just that!

Inspired by Rock Tree Sky (Ojai), the Agile Learning Center, Sudbury Valley Schools, Open Schools, and Peter Gray's book 'The Freedom to Learn,' True North is actively creating a meaningful place for children and youth to become creative, compassionate and accountable adults.

True North does this by facilitating the hunger and love for learning that children and youth naturally have.  We hold space for mixed-ages social interaction and learning (our goal is K-12 ages).  Truly, we are re-imagining what education looks like by encouraging participants to direct their own learning in ways that engage and inspire them.

column2:
>“Children learn from anything and everything they see. 
They learn wherever they are, not just in special learning places.”
~ John Holt

column1: What We Need &

We need a home!  Currently, we are utilizing the amazing outdoor spaces of Santa Barbara until we find our home-sweet-home.  Of course, being outside 100% of the day is an ideal situation given the nature of the pandemic.  At the same time, we are eager to find our home so that we can create a space for the continuity of projects and learning adventures.  

Ideally, our home would be a structure/space that opens easily onto the land, close to wild places, and neighboring a year-round creek.  To find out more about what we are looking for, please visit our Support TN link .

This Indiegogo campaign is not only about raising funds to get our foot in the door of our new location, it is also a way to spread the word about our program.  True North has wonderful leadership and support from an amazing team and we are  excited to see where our collective, creative juices take us.

Check out our perks and offer support where you can!  We have organic cotton, plant-based ink t-shirts and baseball caps printed by our friends at Burleap Apparel of Chattanooga, TN!  The logo was created by the talented artist and naturalist, Robin Whitfield, of Grenada, Mississippi.  We also have some exciting adulting workshops!  As well, we have some beautifully crafted items from our extended True North family!

column2:
>“I recognize June by the flowers, now. I used to know it by review tests, and restlessness.”
~ Lisa Asher, unschooled teen (Life Learning Magazine)

column1: The Impact

It is becoming apparent to us, that during these times of navigating the pandemic, we need to put down what we are familiar with and find the courage to dream and think outside of the box.  Our team feels the need to explore what it means for learning to be resilient by experimenting with ways to support our children as they grow and mature.

With the increase of on-line learning for children which lacks the social capital that in-person learning provides, True North is honored to currently host engaging learning spaces for our community in a safe way.  With a focus on democracy, conflict resolution, social-emotional intelligence, creativity, and ecoliteracy, we are creating a humble yet hearty response to challenges our education system is facing.
Now is the time.
At True North, we know we can't change the nature of this pandemic, but we can change our response to it.  And, that response...we feel...is captured in the essence of self-directed learning.
From this surprising opportunity to re-frame education, we know we will steward something meaningful and lasting for our community.

column2:
>""Self-education through play and exploration requires enormous amounts of unscheduled time—time to do whatever one wants to do, without pressure, judgment, or intrusion from authority figures. That time is needed to make friends, play with ideas and materials, experience and overcome boredom, learn from one’s own mistakes, and develop passions.”
~ Peter Gray (Free to Learn)

column1: Risks &

Of course there will be challenges along the way.  Considering that we plan to create a new model of learning in Santa Barbara, it will take time to build the community.  The right parents and families will need to find us (and they already are!).  And, it will take time to create a culture around the principles of self-directed learning.

However, we have a wonderful team of facilitators who are ready for the journey of stewarding this learning center into fruition.  As well, we have AMAZING examples of schools and learning centers all over the country that have already been doing this work for years (for some, since the 1960s!). We are actively networking with staff members at these learning centers for best practices, inspiration, and problem-solving.

column2: ><i>“Passion is lifted from the earth itself by the muddy hands of the young
column3:
it travels along grass-stained sleeves to the heart. If we are going to save environmentalism and the environment, we must also save an endangered indicator species: the child in nature.”
~ Richard Louv (Last Child in the Woods)

column1: Other Ways You Can Help
If you are not able to donate to our campaign, then just visit our website to check out what we are doing!
Share our campaign with families you think are interested in self-directed learning!
Share our campaign with people you know are interested in re-imagining learning and creating new models of learning resiliency in our community!

column2:
>Check-out our amazing, on-line resource library with information on self-directed learning!


THANK YOU from the bottom of each of our hearts!  We appreciate you!

My Story

Hi! My name is Virtuous Cornwall, the CEO of my own publishing company Vncbooks LLC.  I am a Christian, a military wife, mother, teacher and author. I enjoy writing and telling stories. I decided to pursue the desire of becoming an author after I had my son in 2018. I was rejected by a traditional publisher.   December of 2019, I published my first book ""FINDING LITTLE DOGGINS"" under the Animalsville Series.  The expense was crucial but with the support of family, friends and love ones I overcame and published the book.  In spite of it all, some great things happened.   Since then I had the privilege of visiting schools and libraries to read and discuss my book, while engaging children in interactive activities.  As a former teacher I enjoy being in the presence of children, as an author I find it fun and exciting to visit children in any settings.  I was invited live on Facebook by Homer Drive Elementary School as their principle Ms. Belinda George, who was featured on the Steve Harvey's show read my book. My book can be found in local libraries and stores in New Jersey. As of March 2020 I provide Story and Activity time live on my Facebook page.  I read and demonstrate child like activities for children. Additionally I also provide remote visit to schools, libraries and churches. My goal is to continue writing stories for children and families.  I believe that stories takes us on teachable journeys to help us better ourselves.
All about Virus Busters (Animalsville)
Join us as we explore a variety of ways in which a group of children came together to target the spread of germs and viruses.
Rooted in Animalsville, Little Doggins and his friends created an adventure to bring awareness in their town about the importance of virus protection.
FAMILIES

Animalsville, full of love diversity, and unity, welcomes all children and families.  A place created for adventures in every story everyone enjoys being their best self while learning moral values. Each story helps us to develop skills that interconnects families and communities.

There is always something interesting happening in Animalsville.  When Little Doggins and his friends had an unpleasant experience at school, their teacher  Mrs. Flamingozip decided to read a book on viruses and germs. Stirred with curiosity, Little Doggins and his two classmates paid a visit to their local library to do some research. They came up with so much information they decided to share it with everyone. Follow along with Little Doggins, Little Elephanta and Little Owlfin in this Animalsville series to find out how they created the Virus Busters team.   These friends became agents of change to spread awareness about practicing good hygiene and working together as a unit.
<h3>What We Need &amp
Yes! I need your help.

To help me fund this project all you need to do is choose the reward you would like in the rewards section of this page and follow to make payment.  When the campaign reaches its goal, you will get information from me and your pledged reward will be sent to you.  If you choose to support my campaign, your contribution will be used to fund the following, editing, illustrations, marketing, printing of the book, and shipping.
ANY CONCERNS OR QUESTIONS YOU CAN REACH ME AT www.vncbooks@gmail.com OR call me at 201-618-5902

Virus Busters has been written and edited, it's in the last stage of illustration and will be ready to print soon.  I will definitely keep every backer up to date. Connect with us and follow the journey of Animalsville on  Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter. Look out for Animalsville series because there's more books to come.

Other Ways You Can Help
