column1: ","Our StoryMore than 130 million girls worldwide were out of school even before Covid-19 hit. 15 million girls of primary-school age will never enter a classroom. And over 11 million girls may not go back to school after the pandemic. The Covid-19 crisis has exacerbated the education and digital divide, magnifying inequality like never before and putting millions of girls at risk of sexual exploitation. They could become techpreneurs, scientists, innovators – but instead, they’re paying the price of this crisis with their future. XOCO is on fire to change the game for girls. We’re a non-profit edtech venture empowering adolescent girls to leapfrog from basic education to digital jobs of the future.In partnership with grassroots organizations and the world’s most innovative companies, we’re developing a powerful digital education model to create new pathways from basic education to skilled jobs in the digital economy. We’re a global team of impact investors, tech geeks, digital leaders, education ninjas and entrepreneurs leveraging our networks to develop a digital education model that will bring world-class business education to young women with low levels of formal education.The objective of this crowdfunding campaign is to launch XOCO Leapfrogging Academy – a global accelerator for adolescent girls and young women, preparing them for futuristic jobs in the digital economy.
Our Digital Education Model
Our digital education model covers world-class online training in the following areas:
Empowerment & A Digital MindsetAnything from self-esteem and goal setting to team work, communication, problem solving and digital leadership.
Digital SkillsFrom the most basic skills like logic and math to G-suite and social media management, all the way to coding and big data.
Agile CollaborationFrom new ways of collaboration like design thinking, scrum and design sprint to agile collaboration tools like Miro, Mural, Jira, Kahoot! and Padlet.
Entrepreneurship, Business & FinanceWhatever you learn in business studies and actually need in the real world of business.
Social & Market ResearchPractical training in qualitative and quantitative research, including innovative participatory methods

XOCO Leapfrogging Academy is an accelerator program to prepare adolescent girls and young women for future jobs in the digital economy. The accelerator starts with a summer school and continues with an on-going digital education program broken down into multiple 3-month sprints. Leveraging gamification, the main program allows participants to reach different levels and focuses on the range of horizontal skills relevant to succeed in the digital economy of the future. Complementary side tracks offer opportunities for specialization.Key features of the program include the following:
Live digital classes delivered by business professionals working for local and global companies that are champions in digital transformation, agile collaboration and innovation
Digital mentoring program with role models in the digital economy
Peer-to-peer empowerment sprints
Collaboration on business projects to build a track record and co-develop solutions to real world challenges
Being part of a global business network and a community of game changers for life
What We Need & What You Get

Our Fundraising GoalOur initial fundraising goal is € 50K to kickstart our pilot projects. Our own team is contributing an additional € 50K in-kind. We’re already all-in for this venture. But we can’t make this happen without your financial support. Latin America Pilots:Our LatAm pilots will be rolled out in collaboration with our local partner organizations MDYM Colombia and Care Ecuador. We will launch XOCO Leapfrogging Academy with the first cohort of vulnerable adolescent girls in our pilot countries Colombia and Ecuador. Girls participating in our pilots are those hit hardest by the Covid-19 crisis and who need an urgent way out of situations of gender-based violence. The contribution you make will pay for their stipend (food, shelter, health insurance, digital access), so they can fully focus on their education at XOCO Leapfrogging Academy and are no longer at risk of sexual exploitation due to the economic crisis. The € 50K funding will allow us to launch the Colombia pilot and aims to crowd in additional funding for the Ecuador pilot. Global Pilot:In addition, we will run a global pilot focusing on vulnerable adolescent girls across the global South who will have the opportunity to join our XOCO Leapfrogging Academy programs for free, but do not need a full-fledged stipend. The contribution our team makes is in-kind valued at 50K € (in 2021) and will cover the full accelerator program, including course development, live classes delivered by business professionals, our mentoring program connecting participants with role models, and collaboration with companies on real world projects. Our initial pilot projects are key to reach proof of concept stage and then scale.The € 50K target will allow us to reach 50 vulnerable adolescent girls participating in our LatAm and global pilot accelerator programs in the first year. This will allow us to get ready to scale up exponentially in the second and third year.  If we don’t reach the entire fundraising goal, we can still do smaller pilots and flexibly adjust. However, the more we raise, the more girls we can empower and the faster we can grow our global accelerator programs. For every additional € 20K raised, we will start another cohort of girls who participate in our accelerator program.
Our Perks for You

We’ve mobilized our collective superpowers to bring you the most exciting perks!Please note: XOCO is a non-profit organization, so your contributions are a donation. As a special thank-you for your donation, we are offering exciting perks provided pro-bono by our network. Boosting Your Visibility
A range of perks from a simple Instagram shout-out to getting featured in XOCO’s Podcast
Networking opportunities to connect with entrepreneurs, investors and change makers from around the world
Future of Impact Summit 2021

XOCO’s Future of Impact Summit 2021 brings together impact-driven entrepreneurs, investors, digital leaders, empowerment champions, policy makers, and ecosystem players to connect, learn and inspire action towards an equitable, inclusive and sustainable recovery on the journey to the SDGs 2030.
Join us for a lively and action-driven 5-day virtual Summit.
Check out the full program on our events page.
Summit Special Packages:
Join our special tracks: 1) Entrepreneurship, 2) Investors, 3) Agile SuperPower
On top of VIP access to all Summit sessions over 5 days, get strategically matched to business partners and invited to exclusive pre-and post-Summit special sessions, tailored to your objectives.
Be a Partner @ the Summit
Shape a session with us at the Summit!
To discuss details, get in touch!
XOCO SuperHero All-InYou’re all in – we love it! With this package, you get absolutely everything:
Breakfast with the XOCO team to contribute ideas, ask questions and get inspired
Be a VIP at our 5-day global Future of Impact Summit (virtual)
Get featured in XOCO’s Podcast (meet & greet, ask a question)
Xocer@ Status for 12 months: Get VIP access to XOCO Insights, our digital platform delivering impact research, practitioner tools and behind-the-scenes insights
VIP invitation to XOCO’s Annual Gala (virtual)
Tell us how we can help you reach your goals & we’ll try to work some magic
The Impact
Since its advent, the COVID-19 pandemic has been a disaster for girls
column2: pulling them out of education and pushing them into sexual exploitation. Given the unprecedented speed of this occurrence, it has quickly become evident that we have to be faster, bolder and more innovative in our response. We launched XOCO in 2020 as an unconventional edtech venture to change the game for girls.We are on fire to connect the dots and build innovative partnerships, co-creating new solutions to bridge the digital divide and the equity gap in education. The impact of our Indiegogo crowdfunding campaign will be catalytic: It will enable us to pilot and refine our model with parallel pilot cohorts across Latin America, Africa and Asia. This will lead us to the milestone of proof-of-concept and subsequently allow us to scale our model exponentially.

column2: >Join us in opening an early education studio for young children and parents in Portland
column3:
>This location will feature a Mentorship Institute for Montessori teachers

 

Our Story

Studio June is a first-of-its-kind early education studio for young children and parents, offering a variety of interactive and educational classes, camps, and programs.

In the tradition of Dr. Maria Montessori, Studio June began as an experiment. We asked the questions, “How do we bring Montessori Education to more families?” With a prepared space, activities for children, and partnership with parents, we created an adaptable experience with a variety of classes and programs that encourage families to bring Montessori into their lives. Welcoming new families each month, Studio June allows parents to benefit from bringing Montessori into their parenting and their child's education.
column4:
>“To assist a child we must provide them with an environment which will enable them to develop freely.”  —Maria Montessori

The brainchild of author, speaker, and education expert Sarah Moudry, Studio June launched in 2015 in Houston, Texas. Immediately, the rave reviews flowed in. Today, the Studio proudly serves nearly 500 families in person  each year. 

The Studio June community continues to grow. It’s time to expand our work by opening additional locations. That starts this fall in Portland, Oregon.

 

What We're Building

1.  We will have an amazing new physical studio space in Portland with two beautiful indoor studios, lots of natural light, and a garden area that will serve as an outdoor studio. Our Studio will serve parents and children with classes, camps, cooking experiences, workshops, all available in-person in NW Portland.

2. We will expand our already popular mentorship program. For years, Sarah Moudry has mentored other teachers to follow their passion and open their own Montessori parent- child programs around the world. Our mentorship program will expand to offer more in-person training and workshops for professional educators, more online options for educators around the world, and create retreats and workshops where teachers can observe, reflect, and imagine the possibilities for serving more families and building access to more high quality experiences for children and parents.
column5:
>""It [Studio June's mentorship program] has given me focus and direction and I feel I am starting this business stronger and more knowledgeable. I am confident that I will be able to bring Montessori to my community and spread the benefits of Montessori practice to many homes."" —Sarah C.

The expansion of our Mentorship program will make classes like Studio June’s available to so many more families. At the new location we plan to train ten new teachers in the first year. If each of these 10 teachers go on to open a studio with the same impact of Studio June, our current reach of 500 new families yearly expands to 5,000 families a year. As we continue to mentor and train more and more teachers, our impact grows to millions of families around the world.

* Mentee programs are already running in the United States, England, Thailand, and the Philippines.
 

What We Need

We are looking to raise $15,000 to launch Studio June Portland. This will cover the essential furniture, materials and toys, paint, flooring, child-size fixtures, etc. The more we raise, the more we can immediately do for the community. 

Studio June Portland will offer local families a beautiful environment to learn and practice Montessori, a garden to connect to nature, and a Mentorship Institute that trains more teachers to open programs around the world.

 

What You Get

Thank-you gifts including:  your name on our one-of-a-kind Parent Education Wall in our new location, several educational packages, and some fun Montessori goodies (many which make great gifts). 

Pride: you can proudly say that you played a part in helping a small, independently owned business make a positive, life-long impact on thousands of parents and children. 

Our Gratitude: thank you to our customers, friends, family, and fellow Montessori colleagues for continuing to support Studio June on this journey. We’re grateful you’ve joined us on this ride!

 

Why We Need Your Help

Since 2015 we have served parents in a new way. We created a space where families feel connected, welcomed, and engaged in their children’s development. We have shown that schools are not the only place to learn and that children and their parents can have fun and learn side-by-side.

As amazing and rewarding as this road has been, it has also been bumpy. In 2017 Hurricane Harvey flooded Studio June Houston. With hard work and focus, we were able to quickly reopen. Reopening meant that we could immediately offer our families—many who had lost their houses— a sense of normalcy that they needed. Then came Coronavirus in 2020. While we found ways to regularly connect with our families (virtual classes, material delivery to doorsteps via Studio To Go, screen-free lesson plans, and a materials lending library), revenues took a hit—as they did for virtually all small businesses. Through it all, we’re still here. We’re still going and we’re more motivated than ever to help and inspire families. We just need some help to lift this new location off the ground.

 

What Others Are Saying About Studio June

“It’s incredible to see how much infants and toddlers grow through the classes and camps offered at Studio June. People are amazed when my toddler was potty trained at 14 months or would clear his dishes from the table at 15 months, but I tell them he learned this at Studio June!” —Catherine H.

“An educational experience with my toddler in a beautiful classroom.” —Christy H.

“[The classroom is] set up in a visually beautiful and peaceful space that encourages order and allows children to calmly learn how to focus without being easily distracted.” —Luissa A.

“I’ve watched my children explore, engage, and become more independent while taking classes at Studio June.” —Richard Y.

""Studio June is a special place that supports and inspires self discovery and development not only for children, but parents too."" —Lauren D.

“Just amazing! A great place to learn for both parents and children!” —Lori D.

“We were definitely struggling as first time parents before we enrolled our child in Studio June classes, and the difference these classes have made has been life changing.” —Carlie F.

“My son and I love our infant/parent class at Studio June. Beautiful environment! A perfect place to foster infant exploration and discovery.” —Deidre L.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

column1: • Share this campaign on Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, Reddit, and Pinterest using the Indiegogo share tools.
• Tell a friend!
• Send us words of encouragement (sarah@studiojune.com)!
• Any of these actions help tremendously!

Most Importantly, Our Gratitude

There is no way we could do what we do without you. Studio June is possible because of you and your trust: trust in the work, trust in our passion and vision, and trust in your own children. You have helped us build the Studio June community. We now ask you to help us make these incredible experiences possible for more parents, more children, and more teachers. Let’s grow our community, to make it stronger, to stay connected, and to ensure our children grow up in a world with strong communities.

From the bottom of our hearts, thank you. 

—Sarah Moudry and the Studio June Team

About CryptoEQ

Like most disruptive tech startups, CryptoEQ started as a small group of like-minded individuals. Each of the co-founders — Spencer Randall, Michael Thoma and Brooks Vaughan — were cryptocurrency investors and traders before the crypto explosion of 2017. They met attending local crypto conferences and immediately began to admire each other's perspective and maverick approach to the assets available on the market. After some time getting to see each other in action, they each noticed a glaring hole in the crypto-asset market — truly unbiased, thorough insights and research.

In traditional equity markets (read: old-guy stuff), there is a plethora of the main types of insights
column2:
fundamental, technical and sentiment analysis. With the latter, investors can attempt to determine when the market is being driven by emotion rather than by rational decision making. They can pick up changes in sentiment before there is any news to explain the behavior of stock prices.

We launched CryptoEQ v1 in July 2019 and acquired approximately 3,000 new users. Meeting our goal to always be launching, CryptoEQ v2 debuted in January 2020 with new features and an all-new sales funnel. Our third iteration, v3, launched in June 2020 with average quarterly revenue growth of over 300%. We also blew through our 5,000-user milestone. Recently, our v4 launch incorporated a new and intuitive user interface and exclusive, 1-on-1 consulting sessions. And currently, we're tracking to exceed our next goal of 10,000 users!
column4:
showinfo=0"">

Why are we on Indiegogo? 

We have hit a point where our needs vastly exceed our capacity. Our community of free and premium users is constantly seeking new CORE reports and market insights, and we don't currently have the capability to grow into what the users are seeking. So this is where you come in — we need your help to grow the capital to launch CryptoEQ v5! Along with sentiment signals, we will be adding interactive charting, customizable alerts, video tutorials, and an extensive overhaul of our UI/UX platform to make CryptoEQ more streamlined and intuitive.  In order to do this, we need people — analysts, researchers, authors, and contributors — who are vital to balanced, thorough research of crypto assets.
column6:
showinfo=0"">

So, why me? 

Well - you're reading our page so I'll assume you have some passing interest in cryptocurrency. Maybe you've heard about the trendy DeFi movement, or maybe you're just a millennial who's wanting to diversify their portfolio into decentralized assets, or maybe you're completely new to non-traditional investment opportunities. Any of these are a perfect fit for the CryptoEQ community! We are only as good as the quality of our data and our people, and we want to be able to continue to provide best-in-class market insights and reports for people onboarding into the space. 

Help take us from part-time to BIG time - invest in this wonderful community that is primed to turn into a massive movement today. The best part — you'll get an exclusive look into what CryptoEQ is all about only available to our Indiegogo backers!

Established in 2006,Muhanga Modern Primary school caters for the children in and around Muhanga area and also from far distance looking for low cost high value Primary education.

It is found in former Kabale District, in south Western part of Uganda along the Kabale to Mbarara Road 30 km away from Kabale town.

It is a day and boarding Mixed Nursery and Primary School. It offers candidates at Primary Seven Leaving Examination of Uganda.

It caters for orphans and other economically and disadvantaged children as well as those with physical disabilities. It is a non Government managed /owned school.

Under its founder and Managing Director Mr.Medad Twesigye the school has had a lot of success amidst a lot of challenges mainly financial.

Some of the achievements being construction of classrooms and dormitories and a high level of performance as indicated from the previous Primary Leaving Examination results.

The school has many challenges especially that of expensive water, electricity and food stuffs, teaching materials etc.

I am therefore appealing for the support of raising funds to at least purchase and or construct one 10000 liters tank at the school to help on the high cost of water and improve the water sanitation and hygiene of the school especially for the girl children and more so those already in puberty stage.

What we need is as follows:

WHAT IS NEEDED:

1.The school therefore requires at least 1 plastic water tanks costing Uganda Shillings 3,500,000/- (Three millions five hundred thousands). This cost includes transport of the tank to the school by the supplier.

2.The water Outlet Units cost each 100,000/= (One hundred thousands)

3.Total Cost of making basements slabs for each tank 500,000/-(Two hundred thousands)

4.Cost of gutter and other plumbing accessories required for the systems = 200,000/= (Two hundred shillings)

5.Total cost of labor on the system at 300,000/=

This totals to Uganda Shillings 4,600,000/= (Four Millions Six hundred thousands) 

Equivalent to US Dollars 1200

This is what is being requested for.

OUT COME OF THE PROJECT:

There will be no more shortages of water at the school once these tanks are secured.

As a result the school will no longer incur the expenses it incurs in paying for purchase of water and thus save the money for other useful necessities of the running of the school.

The school will be safe from sanitary related diseases.

This will improve the efficiency running of the school, the comfort of the pupils and staff thus promotes discipline and academic performance of the students.

It will reduce or remove possibilities of pupils’ strikes.

MAINTENANCE AND MANAGEMENT.

Once the tank has been installed the School administration with participation of the pupils and staff body, will maintain and make sure the project keeps running at the school.

Contribute using the BERK IT Button on the campaign.

Contact me: muhangamodernprimaryschool@gmail.com

NEW: THIS CAMPAIGN IS NOW RUNNING IN IN DEMAND.WHICH MEANS YOU CAN MAKE A CONTRIBUTION.

WE DID THIS SO WE CAN RAISE MORE FUNDS AND BUY MORE TANKS TO SETTLE THE WATER PROBLEM AT THE SCHOOL.

THANK YOU:

RISC-V is a trending now, we have seen more and more RV32 chips last few years, but the RV64 chip which able to run standard Linux System is rare and expensive.
Now, we have an affordable choice for 64bit RISC-V SBC: Nezha.

Nezha is based on Allwinner's newest RISC-V chip, D1 @1.0GHz(T-Head XuanTie C906 core), with 1GByte DDR3 and 256MByte onboard Nand Flash. 
It has basic resources and environments that allow you to research RV64 features on itself, just like a desktop PC.
It is likely your first universal RV64 Linux SBC~

Nezha is not designed for heavy computation applications but designed for the RV64 opensource community and IoT application.
It is easily run without a heatsink, and the temperature is below 50℃, chip power consume <
column2:
0.1A@5V
Nezha has most of the peripherals you need in IoT applications:  MIPI LCD, HDMI, USB, ETH, SPI/UART/IIC/PWM/LEDC/IIS/GPIOs.
You can build your projects easily and quickly.

column1: Nezha has an open-source SDK thus that will allow us to port Debian Desktop System to it, and we can test many popular program environments on it: C/C++, JS, WASM, Rust, GoLang, Python, etc.
Nezha is the first Sub-100$ RV64 Linux SBC that can run almost all regular software development experiments, the Basic Kit(With cables and pre-burned Debian image micro SD card) starts from $99.
This campaign is authorized by Allwinner Online, aim to promote RV ecology .
We will send out the first 100 boards before the campaign end(20days). Both Telegram Group and Forum are open for communication.
<ul>
• SoC – Allwinner D1 single-core XuanTie C906 64-bit RISC-V processor @ 1.0 GHz with HiFi4 DSP, G2D 2D graphics accelerators
• Memory – 1GB DDR3 memory
• Storage – 256MB SPI NAND flash, MicroSD card slot
• Video
<li>Output – HDMI 1.4 port up to 4Kp30, MIPI DSI &amp
• Decoding – H.265 up to 1080p60 or 4Kp30, H.264 up to 1080p60 or 4Kp24, MPEG-1/2/4, JPEG, VC1 up to 1080p60
• Encoding – JPEG/MJPEG up to 1080p60
• Audio – 3.5mm audio jack, digital audio output via HDMI, a connector for Microphone Array board
<li>Connectivity – Gigabit Ethernet via RTL8211F PHY, 2.4GHz WiFi 4 &amp
• USB – 1x USB 2.0 host port, 1x USB Type-C OTG portport
• Expansion – 40-pin GPIO connector
• Debugging – 4-pin UART header, USB ADB debugging supported
<li>Misc – Power LED, tri-color user LED, OK &amp
• Power Supply – 5V/2A via one of the two USB-C ports
• Dimensions – 85 x 56 mm (6-layer PCB)
<ul>
• CPU – Alibaba XuanTie C906 64bit RISC-V core with 32 KB I-cache + 32 KB D-cache
• DSP – HiFi4 DSP 600MH with 32 KB I-cache + 32 KB D-cache, 64 KB I-ram + 64 KB D-ram
• Memory I/F – Up to 2GB DDR2/DDR3
• Storage I/F – SD3.0, eMMC 5.0, SPI Nor/Nand Flash
<li>Video Engine Video decodingH.265 up to 1080p@60fps, or 4K@30fps<ul>
• H.264 up to 1080p@60fps, or 4K@24fps
• MPEG-1/2/4, JPEG, VC1 up to 1080p@60fps
• Video encoding – JPEG/MJPEG up to 1080p@60fps
• Supports input picture scaler up/down
<li>Video OUT RGB LCD output interface up to 1920 x 1080@60fps<ul>
• Dual link LVDS interface up to 1920 x 1080@60fps
• 4-lane MIPI DSI interface up to 1920 x 1080@60fps
• HDMI V1.4 output interface up to 4K@30fps
• CVBS OUT interface, supporting NTSC and PAL format

• Video IN 8-bit parallel CSI interface
    • CVBS IN interface, supporting NTSC and PAL format
<li>Audio 2x DAC’s and 3x ADC’s<ul>
• Analog audio interfaces – MICIN1P/N, MICIN2P/N, MICIN3P/N, FMINL/R, LINEINL/R, LINEOUTLP/N, LINEOUTRP/N, HPOUTL/R
• Digital audio interfaces – I2S/PCM, DMIC, OWA IN/OUT
• Networking – 10/100/1000M EMAC with RMII and RGMII interfaces
• USB – USB2.0 OTG, USB2.0 Host
<li>Other peripherals SDIO 3.0, SPI x 2, UART x 6, TWI x 4<ul><li>PWM (8-ch), GPADC (2-ch), LRADC (1-ch), TPADC (4-ch), IR TX&amp
• Package – LFBGA BGA13*13/0.35/0.65mm,337 PINS
• Manufacturing process – 22nm
<ul>
• 8inch Panel: 8inch 1280x800 IPS LCD with capacitive touch panel, and PMMA holder
• Mic array R6: 6 DMICs + 5 ADC keys + 12 serial RGB LEDs
• USB camera: 720P USB camera

AFAIK, we will meet next step (Sub-10$ RV64 Linux SBC) half years later.

Sipeed Technology is an young team from Shenzhen, China. We are focusing on  AIoT Applications, RISC-V popularization, we have promoted K210, GD32VF103, BL60x/70x RV chips last few years, and it is time to make RV64 Linux SoC popularize.

Github: https://github.com/sipeed
Twitter: https://twitter.com/SipeedIO
Telegram: https://t.me/sipeed

Nezha (哪吒) is a protection deity in Chinese folk religion. His official Taoist name is ""Marshal of the Central Altar"" (中壇元帥). He was then given the title ""Third Lotus Prince"" (蓮花三太子) after he became a deity.

At Altered Natives, we are creating nature based learning opportunities for all ages. Our first project will literally be starting from the ground up to build a preschool for 'Siargao Wildlings'. It will also serve as a community center as part of an outreach program, for children with little or no access to education within our local community.

 

We moved onto our farm nearly a year ago and to be honest it has been challenging. Trying to start a preschool during a global pandemic comes with its own unique struggles, especially financially. With your support, we are hoping to raise $40,000. This will cover the costs of building the school and to start a scholarship program for the locals, in our community.

 

It has always been a dream of ours to create a space where anyone can come to learn and grow. To deepen their potential in different areas of ones interest, to learn new life skills and tools, and to become the best versions of themselves. We primarily wanted to focus on alternative workshops for adults...  but then realized we needed to start with the younger generation first!

 

Since our first visit to Siargao (a couple of years ago..), we noticed that there was a lack of alternative schools, or at least a sort of school that resonated with us.  As parents, we obviously want the best for our children.. especially when it comes to education. Ever since our children were first born we've done a lot of research to all the types of educational modalities out there. From Montessori to Waldorf, from traditional to homeschool, and unschooling to worldschooling, etc.  It was then, when we saw that there was a void for an alternative school, that we decided to take matters into our own hands and create our own. 

 

Our son Django (now 4 yrs old) and our daughter Teal (now 2.5 yrs old), were our main inspiration for starting Siargao Wildlings. It is a farm and nature based preschool for ages 3-6 and we use a holistic approach through child led play. We also combine elements of Forest School, Montessori, and Waldorf modalities. Research shows that early childhood education is the most fundamental stage of a persons development. Hence, we wanted to offer a holistic approach that would support a young child in all areas of their development. Not only that, but to also instill valuable life skills to benefit them in their future. 

 

For the last 7 months we have literally been 'homeschooling' the students at Siargao Wildlings as the school was in our house!.  Although it had a homely feel to the learning experience, we feel it's now time to separate the school from our home. Hence, the reason we would like to build the new school and have a base for our outreach program as well.

 

As part of our mission it was also important for us to start a social enterprise. So that local children of our community could also experience a unique education that would naturally further their development. While teaching them the importance of nutrition and learn where their food comes from, to then also gain knowledge of their own capabilities through one of the best teachers, which is Nature.

 

✨

✨

✨
column2: >✨ So this is where you would come in.... ✨
column3: >✨ To become part of our journey and to share our mission.✨

column1: • If you only want to make a one off donation, so in that case.. Indiegogo is the place to be!  Here you will have the option to choose a perk that best suits you in how you would like to contribute to our mission.
<li>

If you wish to contribute to our ongoing project.. then Patreon is the place to be! Choose from the different Tiers, that best suits you in how you would like to contribute.  Also, signing up for any of the Levels of Membership (tiers).. will get you up to date on our progress of the school build and our farm-life!  Through 'behind the scenes' videos that will give you glimpses of where your contribution is going.  Please follow the link here:    https://www.patreon.com/altered_natives

✨   We can understand that not everyone will be able to contribute to our goal financially..  but there are other ways you can help! So being a farm and a nature based preschool, we will always need volunteers.  So please get in touch to learn more information, if this is something that calls you. When you volunteer with us, you'll then get to experience nature based learning, first hand.. at The Wildernest Farm!   ✨

 

✨

✨

✨

 

Thank you all so much for showing an interest in Altered Natives and Siargao Wildings! When donating through Indiegogo or becoming a Patreon to this project, you will give us the tools and materials we need.. to start building a new educational future for all.

 

Many Thanks,

 

Chi, Boley, Django, and Teal ❤️

The Wildernest Farm:  https://www.instagram.com/the.wildernest/

Hence, we wanted to offer a holistic approach that would support a young child in all areas of their development. Not only that, but to also instill valuable life skills to benefit them in their future.  For the last 7 months we have literally been 'homeschooling' the students at Siargao Wildlings as the school was in our house!.  Although it had a homely feel to the learning experience, we feel it's now time to separate the school from our home. Hence, the reason we would like to build the new school and have a base for our outreach program as well. As part of our mission it was also important for us to start a social enterprise. So that local children of our community could also experience a unique education that would naturally further their development. While teaching them the importance of nutrition and learn where their food comes from, to then also gain knowledge of their own capabilities through one of the best teachers, which is Nature. ✨✨✨ ✨ So this is where you would come in.... ✨✨ To become part of our journey and to share our mission.✨ The Ways to Donate:

column1: If you only want to make a one off donation, so in that case.. Indiegogo is the place to be!  Here you will have the option to choose a perk that best suits you in how you would like to contribute to our mission.

If you wish to contribute to our ongoing project.. then Patreon is the place to be! Choose from the different Tiers, that best suits you in how you would like to contribute.  Also, signing up for any of the Levels of Membership (tiers).. will get you up to date on our progress of the school build and our farm-life!  Through 'behind the scenes' videos that will give you glimpses of where your contribution is going.  Please follow the link here:    https://www.patreon.com/altered_natives

✨   We can understand that not everyone will be able to contribute to our goal financially..  but there are other ways you can help! So being a farm and a nature based preschool, we will always need volunteers.  So please get in touch to learn more information, if this is something that calls you. When you volunteer with us, you'll then get to experience nature based learning, first hand.. at The Wildernest Farm!   ✨ ✨✨✨ Thank you all so much for showing an interest in Altered Natives and Siargao Wildings! When donating through Indiegogo or becoming a Patreon to this project, you will give us the tools and materials we need.. to start building a new educational future for all. Many Thanks, Chi, Boley, Django, and Teal ❤️   ✨ Follow Us ✨ Altered Natives:  https://www.instagram.com/altered.natives/ Siargao Wildlings:  https://www.instagram.com/siargao.wildlings/ The Wildernest Farm:  https://www.instagram.com/the.wildernest/",0.0,0,"1 Campaign

What is Amal ou Salam?

Project Amal ou Salam, meaning Project Hope and Peace in Arabic, is a non-political, grassroots, organization that works with Syrian refugee children in Jordan, Lebanon, and Turkey, as well as children in Syria to empower the future leaders of Syria through education, intervention, and trauma-based care. 

We developed an innovative educational approach that seeks to empower the future leaders of Syria. The core tenets of the approach include working to ensure that every child has the right to an education, a childhood free from trauma and violence, and the hope of a peaceful tomorrow. Project Amal ou Salam has a successful track record of delivering this approach in week-long workshops in Jordan, Lebanon, and Turkey with volunteers from around the world, in the school that it funds in Jordan and in its community and educational partnerships around the region.  

Our Origins

While visiting an IDP camp in Syria in 2013, Co-Founders Nousha Kabawat and Aziz Abu Sarah were struck by the bored children mirroring the anger, violence and sectarianism around them and began to imagine a grassroots effort to feed the children’s self-esteem and character. With a background in conflict resolution and peacebuilding in post-war societies, Nousha worked to turn her dream of a multicultural, interfaith community into a reality called Project Amal ou Salam.

Free from politics and sectarian dogma, Project Amal ou Salam operates across Turkey, Jordan, Lebanon and Syria – few NGOs for Syrian refugee children founded in the past few years are working across borders. 

According to the UNHCR, to date there more than 5 million registered and unregistered Syrian refugees living in neighboring countries, of which more than half are under the age of 17. Since the revolution began in 2011, these children have been forced from their homes and country and have been unable to access basic needs or education. In 2019, children up to eight years old have known nothing but a life of war and conflict. 

Through our workshops, schools and community centers, Project Amal ou Salam has supported over 7,500 children in four different countries, aided by nearly 200 volunteers from around the world.

Project Amal ou Salam School – Ajloun, Jordan

In October 2019, with the help of our amazing supporters, Project Amal ou Salam opened a new school center in Ajloun, Jordan to meet the needs of local Syrian children and their families living there. At this center, we focus on early childhood education, preparing the youngest members of the Syrian community with the tools they’ll need to succeed in the Jordanian schools. The school currently serves approximately 70 children, ages 5-8 years old, and is staffed by 2 full-time teachers, all from Syria. 

Since the Covid-19 outbreak began, our team, students, and their families have been working hard to keep our kids safe and provide them with the best educational environment possible. In Jordan, 2.4 million students missed out on school last year, the majority did not have any option for online learning or support while schools were closed. Our school maintained online instruction and support (for both students and parents), using zoom, whatsapp, and carefully distributed supplies. The kids were able to learn their alphabets, numbers, healthy habits and tons more, because they had continued access to our amazing teachers and supporters. 

Once restrictions were lifted, our students and teachers resumed in-person classes and started making up for all their lost time. We are happy to report we are continuing split day classes to maintain healthy safeguards and create new opportunities for our students. Through the generous donations of our supporters (you!!) we are able to offer year round services for the kids, including fall, spring and summer terms, ensuring that they are all as ready as can be when they graduate to the government schools in first-grade. 

Project Amal ou Salam Workshops – Jordan and Lebanon

Project Amal ou Salam’s workshops provide open dialogue, giving the kids a safe space to tackle the issues that they face and develop their own ideas and visions for the future of Syria. With activities not present in the refugee camps, our workshops for Syrian refugee children arm them with the tools and confidence to rebuild Syria through art, health, photography, sports and music.

Other Activities &
column2:
Past Work

In addition to activities run by Project Amal ou Salam, we have provided material donations (e.g., coloring books, games, sports equipment) and monetary support to schools both within and outside of Syria (Turkey and Lebanon). Additionally, we have supported activities in Idlib, Syria
column3: sent school and art supplies to a refugee camp in Ersal, Lebanon
column4: hosted a football tournament for hundreds of Syrian kids as well as hosted Ramadan meals and Eid celebrations for hundreds of Syrian children and their families in Jordan
column5:
and hosted Eid celebrations in Suroui, Turkey for Kurdish refugees who had recently arrived from Kobani, Syria. 

In 2015, Project Amal ou Salam volunteers in Aleppo, Syria provided an underground community center and pre-school for children during the siege. This center provided a safe and secure place away from the war for the children to learn and grow, enjoying movie days, arts and crafts, and activities to help them process their trauma. Our center remained open until our last volunteers were evacuated from the city. 

In 2019, we closed our flagship school in Jordan, feeling that we had successfully met the needs of the Syrian community there. Our school served by filling a gap in the education system: Syrian children were not allowed to enroll in Jordanian schools until they were able to pass tests at their appropriate grade level. This gap left many school aged children at a significant disadvantage to their peers, manifesting in poor grades, difficulty coping with the rigors of a school setting, depression, anxiety, and acting out. Before the war, nearly all Syrian children were enrolled in school. For many years, most Syrian children living as refugees in Jordan had been out of school for a long time and were in need significant catch-up time and individualized attention to make up for the hundreds of hours of class time they have missed out on. The Amal ou Salam school prepared students to engage in their new school settings, catch up on the lessons they missed out on and ensures that they can perform as well as their Jordanian peers in their new classrooms. More than 200 students were successfully matriculated into the local Jordanian system and given additional support to help them thrive. After they entered the Jordanian schools, we continued to provide after-school support and tutoring, a safe place to grow, and resources for their families. 

Spreading the Word

We are always honored when Project Amal ou Salam is featured in the media because it is a great opportunity for more people to learn about the work that we do. Here are some of our favorite features:

BBC, Syria’s Next Generation, http://goo.gl/SvIGA0

Elle Magazine, Young, Syrian, Female: This Is How you Fight ISIS's Values http://goo.gl/SFeJth

Huffington Post, 6 Organizations Helping Syrian Refugees That You Might Not Have Heard Of, http://goo.gl/Cn1Mwe

National Geographic, Life Through the Lens of Syria’s Uprooted Teens, http://goo.gl/lWktpO

When speaking on a panel at the UN's Global Forum on Youth, Peace and Security, Nousha summarized the issue well when she said: ""Syria has become a complex issue but please don't think it is only about violence and killing. Think about the children who need love, attention and caring from everyone around the world so that they become the future generation, not a lost generation.""

Impact – Why Your Support is Critical

Providing a safe space for the psycho-social development of Syria’s children is both crucial for the rebuilding and reconciliation processes and for the future of Syrian society, and is more sustainable than direct aid. When PTSD and depression are not treated in children, it results in flashbacks, emotional instability, violent and aggressive behavior, nightmares, isolation and poor academic achievement. Helping the next generation cope with the trauma and tragedy of war will aid them in becoming strong, capable, and productive members of society ready to rebuild their country!

Your donation will go directly towards expanding, building and developing the implementation of Project Amal ou Salam. More specifically, your donation will fund:

The Amal ou Salam School and Community Center in Ajloun, Jordan

Support to the Girls Learning Center in Gaziantep, Turkey

Support for the development of educational programming and school resources 

Thank you for your donation!

Keep Spreading the Love <

The story so far

The Learning Cooperative is a global network of educators. We confront and try to overcome national, class, and language barriers to create a worldwide problem-solving learning environment dedicated to anti-imperialist politics and the emancipation of workers worldwide. We study the environmental destruction and domination of globalised capitalism. Together, we help to imagine and build a new society in the shell of the old.

We offer courses in subjects like languages and social sciences, and a growing range of services like translation and interpretation. Knowledge is too often commodified and trapped behind paywalls, used to oppress and dominate rather than liberate and enliven. We build alternative approaches to knowledge that see learning as an urgent interrogation of the problems we face as workers. We do this by ensuring that anyone who wants to can join our courses, regardless of ability to pay. We believe that we all have something to learn from each other. We’re not focused on making money, but on abolishing it. We aren’t out for personal power, but to transform the world into something better.

The Learning Cooperative is particularly committed to understanding the problem of imperialism. We pursue material equality by paying everyone the same global living wage, wherever they work. This wage is a London Living Wage adjusted for a reduced, four-day working week. Anti-imperialism is built into everything we teach and the way we teach it. 

TLC is a workers’ cooperative, in which all profits are democratically controlled and reinvested into the company. We use our collectively generated surplus to hire more staff, provide more services, and expand our confrontation with the social, economic and physical forces that oppress us.  

 

Why we need money (Goal: £10,000)

We'll use any donations to advance our project in a number of ways: 

 

1. Building a new website

Aim: We need to improve our website and develop a more efficient backend system for sorting and analysing students’ data, assigning them to classes, and improving students’ pedagogical experiences and outcomes. A better website will help us attract more students, increase retention rates for returning students and help the systems of the cooperative run more smoothly.

 

2. Triple our course provision and revenue

Aim: TLC’s main aim is to provide radically affordable tuition across a range of subjects, while generating jobs and income for tutors living in the global south, all while creating global networks of people committed to understanding and overthrowing capitalism.

Over the past twelve months we have taught courses in Arabic, Irish, Spanish, Italian, French, Portuguese, Urdu, Islamic philosophy, and law. But the list doesn’t stop here. We have ambitions to teach many more subjects over the coming months. Funds raised will help us to greatly expand the quality and range of our courses.

 

3. Pedagogy training 

Aim: our cooperative exists to build an engaging and critical learning environment for both students and teachers. Unlike most of the private tuition market, which is often based on exploiting both the teachers and students, we invest all collectively generated profits and surpluses back into improving the skills of the workers whose labour keeps the cooperative alive.

An important way to improve the quality of our services, is to run a monthly pedagogy workshop for all tutors in the cooperative. This will be a space for training, sharing ideas and bringing in other professionals to deliver professional development workshops.  

 

4. OISC (Office of the Immigration Services Commissioner) accreditation

Aim: to expand our law training program, we plan to provide OISC courses to individuals and organisations. To do this, we need to become OISC accredited (See here for more details https://assets.publishing.service.gov.uk/govern...) 

Being OISC accredited will enable us to provide professional law training courses that will empower a new generation of radical immigration lawyers. Graduates will leave our course armed with the practical tools needed to fight Britain’s oppressive border and hostile environments.

 

5. Subsidised courses for Arabic tutors

Aim: Most of the people interested in tutoring Arabic with TLC come from the global south, including places like Lebanon and Syria. We will provide a free 10 session language and pedagogy course with Karama, one of our Arabic tutors based in Gaza. Tutors will graduate from the course with a deepened understanding of how to teach language to the highest level.

 

Rewards

Our supporters will get discounts off in the next round of group classes in September. They'll also be invited to an exclusive, donor-only online thank-you event in September 2021.

<h2 dir=""ltr""><span>The Johnson &amp
column2: Wales University Ad Team is at it again!

column1: After placing first in the District 1 National Student Advertising Competition for the past two years, we're ready to head back up to Boston to defend our title.

Every year the American Advertising Federation sponsors the National Student Advertising Competition which brings together universities from around the nation to pitch their marketing campaign for the client (this year, Glidden Paint). The client gives us a real business challenge and budget, and we are judged on our research, strategy, and creative executions in a 20 page plansbook and a 20 minute presentation.
We've worked over 3,000 hours to develop the best possible campaign for Glidden.
<h3><span><strong id=""internal-source-marker_0.8650826846715063""><span>What We Need &amp
<div>
In order to compete, the JWU Ad Team travels to Boston for one night. This is obviously a costly endeavor (hotel, parking, etc.) and that’s why we’re asking for your help.
100% of the funds you help us raise will go towards funding the trip to Boston.

Not only will you receive recognition for your help, but you can also get a signed photo, pick up a shirt, see your name on the shirt, get your own signed plansbook, or even a DVD of our presentation! (Why not all five?)
<div>
The Impact
Your contribution not only will make it possible for us to compete in Boston, but it will help cultivate the next Ad Team.
Johnson &
column2: Wales University has a strong reputation both in New England and around the nation. You're helping build that reputation by providing much needed support during our shining hours.

Help us get to Boston!

Sustainability needs leaders: those brave souls who venture into the unknown, and tug us all along in their wakes. Ecovillage Education is hands-on, transformative, inspiring and wholistic training for those leaders to take their skills to the next level.

In the words of 2013 course grad Marita Albert: ""what the course is ultimately doing is putting a fire under people to change the world....and that's always worth funding."" We agree!

Located at Dancing Rabbit Ecovillage-- a sustainable living demonstration project in northeastern Missouri-- the course gives students a direct experience of ecovillage life while learning the diverse skills necessary for sustainable living. The students walk away ready to help their town, organization, school, family, neighborhood or intentional community transition to a more sustainable way of life.

We’re raising $14,000 to support our 2014 course. Over half of this money will go directly to scholarships, enabling EEUS to lower the financial barriers for students to attend this life-changing course.

So is this just fluff, or are we for real? The Ecovillage Education curriculum has four components: ecological, economic, social and world view. And our organization really walks its talk. For instance, we have a huge commitment to local economies.  Last year, 87% of our budget was spent within five miles of our community, with most of that money flowing through our local currency called ELMs.  (Check out our cool infographic in the updates to show you how that works.)
And did you see those PERKS? They are another example of both our local economy and the support our community has shown for the course.
Of the $14,000 you’re helping us raise, here is how the budget breaks down:

column1:
Ecovillage Education US needs your help to fulfill our mission of equipping the next generation of sustainable culture leaders with the skills necessary to positively transform our world. This course has the power to change lives as our students from last year are demonstrating right now.

Three students are actively developing ecovillages, in Texas, Oregon and Seoul, South Korea. Watch our video to hear directly from three of the students about how their lives have been positively affected!
column2:
>

With your contribution, we can help ensure that tomorrow’s leaders receive the training they need to build more sustainable cultures across the globe. And ultimately, their work will benefit us all.


This Campaign is Verified Non-Profit - Your Donation may be tax-deductible. 

LOOK: SUSTAINABLE PERKS from our EcoVillage:

column1: Remember, your contribution is tax-deductible and you’ll get a tangible LOCAL PERK for helping us fund scholarships! If a contribution isn’t possible for you at this time, please take a few moments to share our campaign with your friends and family and anyone else you know who values sustainable culture.

This year's course runs from July 4th - August 10th, 2014

To learn more about EEUS visit http://www.ecovillageeducation.us
To learn more about Dancing Rabbit Ecovillage visit http://www.dancingrabbit.org/

To view EEUS Course Director Ma’ikwe Ludwigs’ recent TEDx Talk, visit http://www.dancingrabbit.org/tedx-talk-about-dr/

Our Premier PERK for 2014 is an Behind-the-Scenes Weekend at Dancing Rabbit Ecovillage. Enjoy luxury accommodations for two at the Milkweed Mercantile Eco Inn, rated 5 stars and Platinum Green Leader from TripAdvisor.

Reviews for Milkweed Mercantile Eco Inn

","Sustainability needs leaders: those brave souls who venture into the unknown, and tug us all along in their wakes. Ecovillage Education is hands-on, transformative, inspiring and wholistic training for those leaders to take their skills to the next level.In the words of 2013 course grad Marita Albert: ""what the course is ultimately doing is putting a fire under people to change the world....and that's always worth funding."" We agree!Located at Dancing Rabbit Ecovillage-- a sustainable living demonstration project in northeastern Missouri-- the course gives students a direct experience of ecovillage life while learning the diverse skills necessary for sustainable living. The students walk away ready to help their town, organization, school, family, neighborhood or intentional community transition to a more sustainable way of life.

We’re raising $14,000 to support our 2014 course. Over half of this money will go directly to scholarships, enabling EEUS to lower the financial barriers for students to attend this life-changing course.

So is this just fluff, or are we for real? The Ecovillage Education curriculum has four components: ecological, economic, social and world view. And our organization really walks its talk. For instance, we have a huge commitment to local economies.  Last year, 87% of our budget was spent within five miles of our community, with most of that money flowing through our local currency called ELMs.  (Check out our cool infographic in the updates to show you how that works.)
And did you see those PERKS? They are another example of both our local economy and the support our community has shown for the course.
Of the $14,000 you’re helping us raise, here is how the budget breaks down:
62% will be used as needs based scholarships for students
13% goes to amazing videography to make these materials accessible to many more people online
12% covers campaign fees (including 5% to our awesome fiscal sponsor, the Fellowship for Intentional Community: http://www.ic.org/)
13% covers shipping PERKS to you and the wholesale cost of PERKS that weren’t fully donated... supporting the small businesses that support us!

What We Do:

The Bahath Centre, located in a Moshi, Kilimanjaro, is home to 21 Tanzanian street children who have been orphaned by either neglect, abuse, or poverty.  Orphaned children and children whose families cannot properly provide for them come to the Centre for daily support, shelter, food, education, healthcare, guidance, and love.
We don't see the Bahath Centre as an orphanage.  Instead, we see our Centre as one big family.  Our motto: The Home of Love and a Better Future for the Children.

The Bahath Centre was founded in June 2011 by two local Tanzanian men, Joseph Lyimo and Emmanuel Tesha.  Both Joseph and Emmanuel experienced difficult hardships as young children growing up in impoverished Tanzanian families so they decided they wanted to help other children in their community who deal with  similar struggles.

Education is a major priority of the Bahath Centre.  The Centre believes that education is the most important tool when escaping poverty.  Thus, the Centre aims to ensure that each child has an equal opportunity to a strong and complete education.

With this campaign, we are striving to raise enough money to send each child to school for the 2013/2014 school year.  Without a proper education, these children will not have an open door to a strong and prosperous future.  With our funding goal of $3,000, we will be able to pay for a full year of schooling for all of the Bahath Centre children.  This includes school fees, uniforms, exercise books, pencils, and other necessary school supplies.
What We Need:

All 21 of our children attend local primary school 5 days a week, 9 months out of the year.  Our children LOVE to learn and love to go to school!  The school provides classes in Kiswahili, English, Mathematics, Science, History, Arts, and Health.  The children run home to the Centre everyday, excited to share what they have learned with each other.
We need a total of $3,000 to pay for the school fees, uniforms, and school supplies for all 21 children for the next school year.  Here is a breakdown of our costs:
<ul><ul>
• $50 pays for 1 child to go to primary school for 1 year
• $42 pays for 1 school uniform
• $38 pays for 1 year of school supplies for 1 child
Total - $130 covers all primary school expenses for 1 child for 1 year
Impact:
“Education is the most powerful weapon which you can use to change the world.”
-  Nelson Mandela

Every child should have the right to a strong education.  Here at the Bahath Centre, we believe that education is the key source to breaking free from the prisons of poverty.  When you give a child education, you are giving that child a gift of a future full of opportunity.
""I want to be a pilot and fly planes!""
- Joseph, age 6
“I want to be a teacher.”
- Jackline, age 8
The children at our centre are already dreaming big!  A proper education provides these children with a chance to reach their goals.

column2: >Help us to help them make their dreams come true!!!

column1: Other Ways YOU Can Help!:
We fully understand that not everyone has the means to donate money.  However, there are other ways that you can help our cause!
<ul>

• Spread the word!!! - Share this campaign and information about our project with as many people as you can!  The more people who become aware of our Centre, the more chances we have to make a difference!
For more information about our project:
We are a registered NGO in Tanzania and will soon have 501c3 status in the United States.  Our Tanzanian NGO Registration Number is: NGO/00006312
<ul>
• Facebook: www.facebook.com/bahathcentrefororphansus
• Email: bahathcentreus@gmail.com
Pamoja, tunaweza kuleta tofauti!!!

0,"

After teaching in the public schools for four years, I decided to go to law school so I could make a difference in our educational system.  While in law school, I realized that what I really wanted to do was to start schools with a healthy educational philosophy that would empower children to reach their full potential in life and actualize their dreams.   I believe that Waldorf Education does this.  I have completed law school, passed the Utah State Bar, and have decided to follow my heart and go back to school in order to formally train in Waldorf Education.  My vision is to create Waldorf-Inspired farming communities centered around a Waldorf School that is open to the public.
I am asking for $5200.00 to cover my educational expenses.  $4800 is my tuition for the first year.  $100 is for books.  $50 is for art supplies.  $250 is for elective enrichment course allowance.

One person can make a difference.  I make a difference.  You make a difference.  And together, we can make lasting change in our world.  I believe that the fastest way to make a positive change in our world is through education.  I believe in Waldorf Education.  It is an educational model that is simple, close to Nature, and very practical.  It nurtures the healthy, holistic development of our children and provides tools that enable them to live satisfying, meaningful lives.  I am committed to creating Waldorf farms and schools that are open to the public.

I appreciate ANY support you can give--including positive thoughts, prayers, and any material/financial contributions you are able to give.  I believe in a better way.  I believe in a better world and I am committed to be my contribution in making it happen.  Let's make it happen together!

Short Summary

Green Hope Organization is a small NGO with a big reach. The group works
with orphans, street youth, and most vulnerable families (often child headed
households) to try to make a difference. This May, I am traveling to Tanzania to teach English to illiterate street youth. The goal is to help the youth of Tanzania develop language skills and life skills that will provide them with a better future.

Many of the supplies and resources that I will need, such as pencils, pens, notebooks and flashcards are not available. Sadly, many of the children do not even own shoes or clean clothing. Soap, deodorant and toiletries etc need to be purchased for the children. The program is costly and requires around $30 a week for each child to eat.  This is money that is not being raised elsewhere at this time. In addition, other items that are lacking in the program would include educational books and computer technology and it would be incredibly beneficial to provide these resources.  I would like to raise as much money as possible to help benefit the organization and the children involved.

Every dollar makes a tremendous difference.

This program aims at providing youth with learning opportunities that will enable them to work in the future and stimulate the economy and provide better living conditions overall.

If you are interested in reading more about the project, click on the Arusha location from the link below.

http://www.greenhopetz.com/

While I am in Tanzania, I will be working with the boys and teaching them to write in English. One of the projects will be writing thank-you cards to all who donate, specifically detailing how your money has helped each child!
<div>
<h3>What We Need &amp
What we need is monetary donations that will help us purchase the resources necessary to provide the students with the education that they deserve.
Arnold who is 15 is very bright and needs to go to school. His tuition would be 65$ per month -but he wants to be a doctor - so he is a great investment.

Noel has just started an apprenticeship for an automotive repairman. What I anticipate is that he needs tools (spanners/wrenches, etc.) and he also needs to get a driver's license so he will likely need 150 shillings for the licence and 100 shillings for the tools.

Hamedi is 11 years old and really should be in a boarding school.  This would cost about $45 per month plus a few extra dollars for books, etc. For the youth on the street the biggest needs are shoes and food.

We are looking at the opportunity for a group home or drop in setting, but buildings are very expensive here and this continues to be a wish. We also have a few street boys who are learning how to be barbers - we have some of the supplies but this is another area for support to buy clippers and hair driers.

We always have need for bicycles - these are a way for the youth to make money (they can be couriers/delivery people). Bicycles here are expensive but they use them until there is literally nothing left!
We could use chicken coups at any of the orphanages - these are about 200$ plus about 50$ for the chickens

We could use beds for the boys.  We have mattresses, but need the beds
which are about 150$ each.

*Our perks are amazing. Donated items from friends include an original 1 of 2 lithiograph signed from Batmans creator Bob Kane, 2 bottles of Patron donated by Patron your choice of bottle, 15 cosmetic and skincare gift bags from Armani at Holt Renfrew (Sherway Gardens) appreciation cards and a facebook invite to follow the learning experience.
<div>
The Impact

THE BUTTERFLY EFFECT: It states that the action of a single butterfly flapping its wings causes a ripple effect in the air around it, thus in the atmosphere. This change brought about by the butterflies flapping of its wings (for example in the USA) can cause a tropical rainstorm in South-East Asia. Decisions or actions we take now, no matter how small they are, can play a huge role in determining the outcome of our lives and the lives of others. Oftentimes we are unaware of the impact we have on others – just taking action may start a personal revolution for some people. You can do the same – and affect more than just yourself.

This is why Gandhi’s famous quote “Be the change you want to see in the world,” is so effective. It shows how one decision to change our personal world can end up inspiring others to do the same. This is a call to action.
The youth of Tanzania deserve our help.  The impact these donations will have on their lives is indescribable.
<div>
Other Ways You Can Help
If you wish to contribute in other ways, your help is still greatly appreciated!
Please spread the word to friends and family and help create awareness about the Teaching in Tanzania campaign:
1. Share and like this link on your facebook and twitter pages
2. Use the Indiegogo share tools!

column1: ","I had no idea this is where my life would take me. I was 26, just finished a masters degree. On a whim, I flew into Uganda. Within 24hrs of arriving in Gulu Town, I was volunteering at a local Reception Centre for children and women abducted by the rebel group, the Lord’s Resistance Army – aka the LRA.

At the Centre, I worked with some Unaccompanied Minors – kids born into the captivity of the LRA who had been rescued without parents. Although they're usually united with loving extended families, the extreme poverty across the region force many of these kids into orphanages.  My local colleagues agreed:
It didn't make sense – these kids were being raised in orphanages, when only a small amount of support would let them to grow up in a loving family instead
...Empowering Kids in Uganda (EKU) was born.

EKU now supports 19 kids who were born into LRA captivity to stay with their loving families. We keep costs to a minimum and have only one paid staff – a local Ugandan social worker I’ve known for 3 years. Our voluntary board is made up of Canadians and local Ugandans. Everyone is so committed!My heart remains in Uganda, but I returned to Canada to fundraise and build EKU. We are in the middle of getting registered as a charity in Canada so we can issue tax receipts for donations.
But, we need money NOW to get the kids through Term 2 of school this year.
We need $2500 to ensure that all our kids stay in school.
These children have had a tough life and have been through more than we can imagine. But every day they teach us about the power of resilience, smiles, and laughter.
~ Thank you. Alison McConnell, EKU Founder & Managing Director.
Come 'Like' EKU on facebook and get the latest news about the kids, EKU, and life in Northern Uganda!",0.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","Gulu, Uganda",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/empowering-kids-in-uganda/pica
0,"<div class=""routerContentStory-storyBody"" data-v-1df7bf5a=""""><div>
Our Story

Humming Hive Forest Preschool is a Waldorf-inspired, outdoor preschool on the edge of over 5000 acres of forest within the city limits of Portland, Oregon.  The children, ages 3 to 5 years old, spend their entire day outside, rain or shine, even through the cold, rainy season.  The children play, sing, tell stories, make art and crafts, garden, visit the chickens and ducks that live on the land
column2: they experience the rhythm of the seasons intimately, and form meaningful relationships with each other and the plants and animals of the forest. We also offer summer camp programs to include as many children from the area as possible. If you would like to learn more about our school, please visit our website, www.humminghive.org.

column1: Our home base for the school day is our outdoor kitchen, the Fern House.  We began in our first year with a plastic tarp, hanging between trees, over a table. While this has worked for a couple of years, we wish to offer the children a stronger, more beautiful and inspiring roof under which to eat meals, paint and make crafts.  We are also building an earthen oven, made of clay, sand and straw, so that we can bake bread with the children each week for snack, and other baked treats for special occasions.
This is where you come in: We are a preschool with a good vision and a small budget, so we need your donations to make this possible!
Your donations will go toward:
-skilled builders to facilitate the building of the cob oven and the roof
-materials for the roof, including reclaimed wood, steel, and weatherproof canvas fabric
-industrial sewing of canvas fabric
Thank you!

To express our gratitude for your donations, we have some wonderful gifts to share with you. Every donor, no matter how small or large the donation, will receive a card printed with one of the children's drawings.  For larger financial donations, the parents and teachers have come up with a variety of exciting gifts to show their gratitude, including hand-knitted children's mittens, a jar of herbal healing salve, hand-dyed silk cloths, a week of summer camp at our school, and more.

If we do not reach our goal, we will pursue other fundraising efforts, as we are committed to building this oven and roof for the children. 
   If we exceed our financial goal, the remaining monies will help purchase materials and supplies for the children, support future projects, and go into a tuition assistance fund for low-income families.
The Impact

Our love and commitment to children, society, and the Earth motivates us to offer the children an experience of connection with nature, which is becoming more and more rare in these times when it is most needed.  This connection provides the children with a sense of confidence as they climb hills and trees, a healthy lifestyle as they spend most of their days in a natural environment, breathing fresh air and eating whole grains and vegetables, and wonder, creativity, and powerful observational skills which will lead to strong academic skills in later years.  This connection provides society and the Earth with strong and balanced individuals who have cultivated a caring relationship with the natural world.
Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone is able to contribute with money. You can still help by spreading the word about this fundraising campaign, our school, and nature immersion schools as a growing educational movement.  Use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word instantly, and like us on Facebook!
","Our Story

Humming Hive Forest Preschool is a Waldorf-inspired, outdoor preschool on the edge of over 5000 acres of forest within the city limits of Portland, Oregon.  The children, ages 3 to 5 years old, spend their entire day outside, rain or shine, even through the cold, rainy season.  The children play, sing, tell stories, make art and crafts, garden, visit the chickens and ducks that live on the land
column2: they experience the rhythm of the seasons intimately, and form meaningful relationships with each other and the plants and animals of the forest. We also offer summer camp programs to include as many children from the area as possible. If you would like to learn more about our school, please visit our website, www.humminghive.org.

Short Summary
“The orchestra and choir are much more than artistic studies. They are examples and schools of social life. To sing and to play together, means to intimately coexist” - Maestro Jose Antonio Abreu

We are an El Sistema inspired music program in North Philadelphia! We are Tune Up Philly, a program of the Philadelphia Youth Orchestra. We strive to build community by cultivating a positive and rigorous learning environment, utilizing the orchestra and choir as model societies.

We see our students every day after school for 2 hours, 5 days. They are learning 8 orchestral instruments. We have seen the amazing effect that this program has had on our students, and we have realized how important it is for them to be in front of an audience, especially in their own neighborhoods! We are already able to chart change in their behavior at school....help us continue!
We are the recipients of a $150,000 matching grant, for every dollar you donate we will be able to double it. That's twice the number of concerts on this North Philadelphia Tour.
<div>
<h3>What We Need &amp

We need to get our children out performing more within the community! In order for this to happen we need funding for transportation, faculty members, Tune Up Philly uniforms, and instrument supplies.
Our students attend a title 1 school with no arts program. Help us to provide them with opportunities!
If you donate to us, we will honor you, bow down to you, and invite you to everything we possibly can!
If we reach our entire goal will be able to put on 10 concerts within communities in Philadelphia where there is little to no live music.
The Impact
""I don't even know how to explain the feeling I'm having right now. PROUD! I'm so proud I feel like I'm going to explode!""
- Mother of 4th Grade Tune Up Philly student
""The best part about the concerts is seeing my family out in the audience clapping for me. It makes me feel so good.""
- First Grade Tune Up Philly student
""Is that a cello? You go little orchestra, you go. Right here in North Philly!""
- Community member watching our students leave for a concert
<div>
Other Ways You Can Help
Interested in volunteering or donating an instrument? Contact us at: tuneupphilly@gmail.com

Hello, My name is James Matrisciano, the founder of Operation-Ride, and I am here  asking for your support.

Operation Ride is a non-profit organization with the unique mission of getting wounded wartime veterans back on motorcycles.  Our task is to identify amputee, PTSD and Traumatic Brain  injured hero’s  that have had past motorcycle experience and to help them determine the actions needed to get back on two wheels.   It could be motorcycle modifications by moving gear shifters or brakes or just coaching and motivating them in gaining the confidence to overcome the challenges they are confronted with.

We believe there is no better way to see this beautiful country of ours then on two wheels in the back roads and through untouched landscapes, that’s why the first Major goal is to help 5-10 wounded veterans regain the confidence and ability to traverse the nation on adventure style motorcycles using the trans American trail: a trail that crosses the United States from Eastern Tennessee to the Oregon Coast This will take place on nothing but dirt roads, fire breaks, and walking paths, a distance of 2000 miles.  A true measure of endurance.

We will then take any and all knowledge learned about prosthetic challenges then document needed changes to give back to other organizations, (learning institutions and the veterans administration) so that they can build better products for our troops and for other disabled people so that they too can get back on motorcycles.
Once we have establish  the nation wide ride, our plan is to hold regional quarterly training events with multi day rides for disabled veterans.
We are proposing a 50,000 dollar goal over a 50 day period.  Money raised will be used to help in the promotion and start up of operation ride
This money will be used for  three separate purposes:
To help facilitate our outreach campaign that will generate awareness and interest in our organization.  This will include attending veteran, motorcycle and disability events.
To assist in the purchase of equipment to include motorcycles, modifications, helmets…. and to help maintain the equipment
To hire  certified instructors to teach best riding practices and to
pay for the travel costs to bring wounded veterans to our tampa florida based location, from locations nationwide for modifications and training.
We are counting on donations for all operational costs.  All employees,  including myself, work purely on a volunteer basis, so all money raised will go towards this cause.
Please visit our website at www.operation-ride.org for more information on our mission.
We are also on face book is as operationride (one word).  Please follow us to see what is new and to track updates.

Please, contribute what you can and spread the word, tell your friends. Thank you for taking your time to watch this informational video and for considering us for your worthy donation, no matter how much it is.
