Stop Settling

Before you invest another hour, minute, or second into someone else’s empire, check with our new plan for individual success. We joined forces to create an unorthodox blueprint to turn your passion into a full-fledged, profitable business!

By not allowing the “fear of failure to stifle your dreams,” Plan “B” Sucks is a prescription created as a guide for success. In our book, we offer more than a mere option on how to escape a repetitive life cycle
column2: instead, we tackle the core issues associated with the benign slumber of a lackluster life. Plan “B” Sucks was written to challenge readers to reflect, plan, and execute their dreams. It will capture the reader’s attention and change their outlook on any current situation regardless of where you are in your career. We pull you out of a world where you may work for someone else, and push you into a world that enables you to work towards your dreams.

column1: We like to think of ourselves as Mavens or “information specialists.” Mavens are individuals who are informed in a particular field and possess certain information that others do not. A true maven takes his or her information expertise a step further and shares the knowledge with others. We are doing just that. We are taking on the duty of sharing information as a social responsibility.

Having four dynamic young authors enables us to draw from our different experiences in entrepreneurship, innovation, and lifestyle creation. We wholeheartedly believe in the statement “failure is not an option.” Aside from academic accolades, we look to single- handedly redefined the traditional route of obtaining wealth and living your best life. In our new book, entitled,Plan “B” Sucks, we share our formula on finding your passion and profiting from that which you love to do.
Why We Need Your Help

Self-publishing is a long road, and without the proper funding we won’t be able to make the impact we are striving to accomplish. So we want to enlist the Indiegogo community to build support to propel Plan “B” Sucks to the next level. By backing us, we will be able to accomplish the following:
<ul>
<li>A Book Tour (5 Cities: Chicago, IL
• Marketing Material for the book tour (Signage, business cards, stickers, drop cloth, etc...)
• Another book order run of 250 (A goal to sell at least 50 books in each city)
• Film a viral video for each of the 12 mantras in the book

We plan to capture the book tour on film as well, so we can post it to our website www.planbsucksbook.com to inspire others. Nowadays people may be clinching their wallets a little tighter, but we believe investing in your dream is the only way it can become your reality. So, by backing us, you are investing in yourself. How? Because in return for your pledge we are offering insight and tools to help you turn that idea you always had into a business.
DREAM Package
MOTIVATION Package
SUCCESS Package
Help us inspire others.  Please share this campaign with your social networks, your email lists, and your co-workers and family.
Risks &

In the past 12-months, we've had the opportunity to speak at several colleges, high schools and seminars. So we are no stranger to the challenges of creating, promoting, and executing a successful speaking engagement. Looking ahead at a 5-city book tour, logistics and marketing will be the largest hurdles. But, we are confident that through our past experiences we have gained valuable knowledge to make it happen. Also having four people enables us to get multiple things done simultaneously. Our focus is getting the word out, and helping as many people as possible.

column4: >We are Rising. We speak from our hearts and our Voice reverberates, touching the spirit of each person and each seed
column8: >each who has the ears to hear and the heart to witness. We are rising, hands held, voices heard, action led through courage and compassion, transforming ourselves and our community, nurturing the seeds of change and harvesting the joy of our visions.

column1: Project Summary

column4: >Daniel Stein and Ashley Portman are community organizers located in the Barre-Montpelier area of Vermont. Throughout the last decade Daniel and Ashley have worked with at-risk youth in a variety of awesome and inspiring ways. Most recently they are planning a summer empowerment program for the youth of Barre City, Vermont. Barre recently lost a summer and after-school program called CityScape, which helped youth “increase academic achievement, build new skills and interests, increase health and fitness, build connections with the community, and make healthy choices.”

>In light of losing CityScape, Ashley and Daniel have developed a program which focuses on personal transformation and social change through direct action, exploration of personal values, earth-centered consciousness and holistic health education.

column3: >This program will engage youth in their communities, developing and strengthening vital skills and developmental assets which will help empower and enable youth to become strong leaders in our changing world -- leaders that are connected to themselves, each other and the Earth which sustains them.
column5: >With your support, youth will have the opportunity to learn about issues which affect their community and create action plans to respond.

column4: >The project will be held at Aldrich Public Library in the heart of downtown. Participants will grow a plot at their local community garden, learn how to cook healthy local foods, explore sense of self and their relations with families, communities and the Earth. But most importantly, with your help and support, youth will have the opportunity to express their Voice and Know that they are an important asset in their community.
>                                    Check out the awesome space we get to hang out in this summer.
>This program requires two full-time positions for the summer, materials and supplies and a small general cash fund for expenses incurred throughout the project.

>The exciting thing about this program is that Youth will be driving it. Our young friends will brainstorm a community issue and cooperatively create solutions that work for everybody. We believe that youth are inherently creative and innovative, and by nourishing these qualities and exhorting their personal strengths, youth will play a pivotal role in creating positive and sustainable changes in their world.

>Your funds will help pay the full-time Organizers leading this initiative. It will provide each youth with a Youth Rising Toolkit, complete with lessons, activities, and art supplies. Youth will receive nourishing snacks every day and participate in cooking a meal once a week. They will have the opportunity to play at the recreation center, go swimming and explore and learn during a field trip. Funds will also support a community garden plot that will feed and nourish their friends and neighbors.
>

>In a world of uncertainty and change, where we are witnessing the loss of many important programs for youth, it is imperative that we guide and assist them in designing and building their own programs that directly reflect what they need and hold important for their personal growth and well-being. This summer program is the first step in a long process of offering the youth of Barre with an opportunity to create their own youth-led initiative. Essentially, the “older youth (Daniel and Ashley)” are guiding mentors who provide counsel, structure, and safety, as well as serving as a link to community resources.

>In Bethlehem, PA when we created a similar program, we had 10 middle school youth, all of whom came from challenging backgrounds. However, for 8 weeks, 5 days a week, 6 hours a day these kids showed up, ready to change themselves and their community. They created campaigns, researched, interviewed community members, wrote poetry and made art, sang, danced, and most importantly they expressed their Voice! The experience was a huge success.

>This summer, in Barre, Youth Rising Project will nurture a powerful seed that will sprout into a youth-led afterschool program. Youth Rising Project will continue to grow to eventually emerge as a fully youth-led organization. Supporting this project will enable youth to attend this dynamic summer program for free and strengthen their connection to their community. This is why your funds are critical to success!!

column1: Barre, VT

column4: >Thank you for getting this far and believing in the power of the youth voice! If you cannot contribute money but still wish to help, thats great!! send an e-mail to youthrisingproject@gmail.com and let us know what you'd like to do. If you live in the area and want to volunteer this summer? Do you have a box of art supplies you've been wishing to get rid of? Old laptops? Just send a note and let us know!!

column2: >Ashley Portman has a passion for youth-led organizing and empowerment and has been working with youth for ten years. While living in Pennsylvania she worked with inner-city youth and co-created a youth arts and civic education summer camp program. Ashley holds a degree in Psychology and Political Science, with Graduate coursework in Community Health. Currently she is employed within the Montpelier public school district working one-on-one with at-risk youth in behavioral and cognitive interventions. She is a life-long student of herbalism with a focus in food justice and education and volunteers with the Montpelier Community Justice Center and is an advocate with CIRCLE. She is a trained facilitator in the Living Values Education program, WRAP (Wellness Recovery Action Plan) and CCP (Creating a Culture for Peace), a non-violent activism training program.

>Daniel Stein graduated from Lehigh University with a B.A. In Political Science and a focus on Community Development. In Bethlehem, PA Daniel co-found and led with Ashley Portman, a Summer Program for At-risk youth, focusing on creative arts and civic engagement. Currently Daniel runs the Farm-to-Table program through Food Works, a Montpelier-based educational Non-profit that teaches the community how to grow, store, prepare and eat their own foods. Daniel is a certified Instructor and Trainer in the Living Values Education Program and CCP (Creating a Culture for a Peace)

column4:
> 

","We are Rising. We speak from our hearts and our Voice reverberates, touching the spirit of each person and each seed
column5: each who has the ears to hear and the heart to witness. We are rising, hands held, voices heard, action led through courage and compassion, transforming ourselves and our community, nurturing the seeds of change and harvesting the joy of our visions.

column1: Project Summary

Daniel Stein and Ashley Portman are community organizers located in the Barre-Montpelier area of Vermont. Throughout the last decade Daniel and Ashley have worked with at-risk youth in a variety of awesome and inspiring ways. Most recently they are planning a summer empowerment program for the youth of Barre City, Vermont. Barre recently lost a summer and after-school program called CityScape, which helped youth “increase academic achievement, build new skills and interests, increase health and fitness, build connections with the community, and make healthy choices.”

In light of losing CityScape, Ashley and Daniel have developed a program which focuses on personal transformation and social change through direct action, exploration of personal values, earth-centered consciousness and holistic health education.

This program will engage youth in their communities, developing and strengthening vital skills and developmental assets which will help empower and enable youth to become strong leaders in our changing world -- leaders that are connected to themselves, each other and the Earth which sustains them. With your support, youth will have the opportunity to learn about issues which affect their community and create action plans to respond.

The project will be held at Aldrich Public Library in the heart of downtown. Participants will grow a plot at their local community garden, learn how to cook healthy local foods, explore sense of self and their relations with families, communities and the Earth. But most importantly, with your help and support, youth will have the opportunity to express their Voice and Know that they are an important asset in their community.
Check out the awesome space we get to hang out in this summer.
What We Need & What You Get
This program requires two full-time positions for the summer, materials and supplies and a small general cash fund for expenses incurred throughout the project.

The exciting thing about this program is that Youth will be driving it. Our young friends will brainstorm a community issue and cooperatively create solutions that work for everybody. We believe that youth are inherently creative and innovative, and by nourishing these qualities and exhorting their personal strengths, youth will play a pivotal role in creating positive and sustainable changes in their world.

Your funds will help pay the full-time Organizers leading this initiative. It will provide each youth with a Youth Rising Toolkit, complete with lessons, activities, and art supplies. Youth will receive nourishing snacks every day and participate in cooking a meal once a week. They will have the opportunity to play at the recreation center, go swimming and explore and learn during a field trip. Funds will also support a community garden plot that will feed and nourish their friends and neighbors.
The Impact

In a world of uncertainty and change, where we are witnessing the loss of many important programs for youth, it is imperative that we guide and assist them in designing and building their own programs that directly reflect what they need and hold important for their personal growth and well-being. This summer program is the first step in a long process of offering the youth of Barre with an opportunity to create their own youth-led initiative. Essentially, the “older youth (Daniel and Ashley)” are guiding mentors who provide counsel, structure, and safety, as well as serving as a link to community resources.

In Bethlehem, PA when we created a similar program, we had 10 middle school youth, all of whom came from challenging backgrounds. However, for 8 weeks, 5 days a week, 6 hours a day these kids showed up, ready to change themselves and their community. They created campaigns, researched, interviewed community members, wrote poetry and made art, sang, danced, and most importantly they expressed their Voice! The experience was a huge success.

This summer, in Barre, Youth Rising Project will nurture a powerful seed that will sprout into a youth-led afterschool program. Youth Rising Project will continue to grow to eventually emerge as a fully youth-led organization. Supporting this project will enable youth to attend this dynamic summer program for free and strengthen their connection to their community. This is why your funds are critical to success!!
Barre, VT
Other Ways You Can Help

Thank you for getting this far and believing in the power of the youth voice! If you cannot contribute money but still wish to help, thats great!! send an e-mail to youthrisingproject@gmail.com and let us know what you'd like to do. If you live in the area and want to volunteer this summer? Do you have a box of art supplies you've been wishing to get rid of? Old laptops? Just send a note and let us know!!
About Us

Ashley Portman  has a passion for youth-led organizing and empowerment and has been working with youth for ten years. While living in Pennsylvania she worked with inner-city youth and co-created a youth arts and civic education summer camp program. Ashley holds a degree in Psychology and Political Science, with Graduate coursework in Community Health. Currently she is employed within the Montpelier public school district working one-on-one with at-risk youth in behavioral and cognitive interventions. She is a life-long student of herbalism with a focus in food justice and education and volunteers with the Montpelier Community Justice Center and is an advocate with CIRCLE. She is a trained facilitator in the Living Values Education program, WRAP (Wellness Recovery Action Plan) and CCP (Creating a Culture for Peace), a non-violent activism training program.

Daniel Stein graduated from Lehigh University with a B.A. In Political Science and a focus on Community Development. In Bethlehem, PA Daniel co-found and led with Ashley Portman, a Summer Program for At-risk youth, focusing on creative arts and civic engagement. Currently Daniel runs the Farm-to-Table program through Food Works, a Montpelier-based educational Non-profit that teaches the community how to grow, store, prepare and eat their own foods. Daniel is a certified Instructor and Trainer in the Living Values Education Program and CCP (Creating a Culture for a Peace)",5.0,0,"1 Campaign

Je m’appelle Kevin. I am a food scientist that
is focused in food safety.  In February I
was accepted to a Master’s program in food sciences in Lille, France.  I am looking to increase my knowledge through

school and cultural understanding by learning another language and culture. 

The Goal

I am asking for your support to fulfill the obligations of tuition. Tuition for one year is 4,900€ or approximately $6,900.  The bank and Indiegogo charge a fee after the end of the campaign.  $7,500 will fulfill the $6,900. All proceeds will be directed entirely toward
tuition. I ask for your support in this adventure and once in a life time
experience. All contributors will be able to follow me as I experience the
unexpected and learn from the world’s best Food Scientists.<span style=""color: rgb(106, 106, 106)
column3: >  All donations over that amount will be put toward school

column1: including insurance, books, and living expenses.
a cultural experience in itself. It embodies the romantic notions of bread,
cheese, and wine.  Every perk will
represent France’s incredible culture from pictures, postcards, to

chocolate and something specific to the region of Lille (Nord-Pas-de-Calais).  I want to share my experience with everyone, even those who can't support my adventure.   Please check out my blog at: aminnesotanabroad.blogspot.com. I am really looking forward to writing postcards and taking lots of fun pictures, so please PLEASE keep me busy!   All perks will be sent as soon as I have campaign is completed. 

Me and My Mission
Food Safety and Science is a very important
field within the world’s global community.
It gives us the art and science art of cheese making but also keeps baby
formula safe for growing minds. International cooperation and intercultural
experience will be essential to maintaining global food safety and innovation.  This Master’s program will not only introduce
me to the French food culture but also the cultures of the other international
students.  As the global community
becomes even smaller and more complicated international experience will be
invaluable.  In 2012 I graduated with a
Bachelor’s in Food Science with a minor in Food Safety from North Dakota State University.  While in France I will also be volunteering
with my undergraduate university to encourage both students from the United
States and  France to study abroad as an alumni ambassador. My goal is to gain
as much from this experience as possible and to share my experiences with those
who are curious. Since graduating from my undergraduate studies I have been
working for a upper Midwestern grocery company performing comprehensive food safety
audits of their owned stores.  I relish
the opportunity continue my education abroad and increase my knowledge of the

world.

Lille, France and ISA Lille
Lille is located in the middle of Europe in the
Nord-Pas de Calais region of Northern France.
It is within two hours of London, Brussels, and Paris by train.  ISA Lille is an international school focused
on the food sciences.  It has a learn by
experience based curriculum with internships and research/project classes. The
Master’s program has intensive French language classes with other international
students but is taught entirely in English.
During my adventure in school while in France I will be writing a blog
to explain my experiences. The link will be attached on the bottom of the page
for everyone!  The world is much larger
than northern mid-west United States and I look forward to sharing its size.
Merci

beaucoup á tous! À bientôt!

My
name is Caroline Njeri.I am a 24 years old Kenyan .I am pursuing a five year
undergraduate degree in soil,water and environmental engineering, currently in
my final year of study, in a local university called Jomo Kenyatta University
of Agriculture and Technology with a major in rain water harvesting.I am also a
freelance programmer .I would like to carry out the following project between

February 2015 to July 2015.

http://youtu.be/bW-_txBuewI

https://www.facebook.com/video.php?v=10204452538467360&
Introduction
Kibwezi is a town in Makueni County in Kenya,
one of the semi-arid regions located in Eastern Kenya. It is inhibited mainly
by the Kamba community. Kibwezi has been experiencing the impact of climate
change such as recurring seasonal drought and environmental degradation leading
to inadequate water supply for domestic and livestock use.
The community especially the women and
girls are forced to walk for long distances in search of water. The Kamba rely
on subsistence crop farming which they do during the two main rainy seasons and
sell of honey during the dry season.
The high poverty levels have led to
increased school drop outs and forced early marriages in effort to secure the
bride price as a means of acquiring wealth.
The primary schools in this area have
no access to running water, poor sanitation and children attending the schools
come from very poor backgrounds. The schools can benefit greatly from rainwater
harvesting and management systems.
The funds will help achieve the
following objective in this area:
<ul>
<li>
Improve
water access and management in 3 schools by installing 50,000liter masonry
tanks and gutter system. This will ensure that the children have clean and safe
water for drinking, cooking school meals and hand washing.
<li>Support
nutrition for children through construction of 3 farm ponds in the 3 schools
including installation of drip irrigation systems (230 liters mini tank kits)
to supply water for the school vegetable gardens and tree seedling
establishment. This act as technology demonstrations aimed at creating
awareness and enhancing adoption to improve the livelihoods of the people
through promotion of small scale farming activities.
<li>Enhancing
community capacity building initiatives through training and awareness creation
on various project components to the children, school staff and women groups in
the area. It will also include vegetable produce production under drip
irrigation, tree nursery establishment and to enhance environmental
conservation.
<li>The
schools will also acquire new ventilated pit latrines.
<li>This
projects will be managed by 3 women groups, one group per school. They will be
responsible for growing the vegetables and selling them in order to generate
income .This they will use to pay back the investment cost after the project
has been implemented for sustainability purposes.
I believe that agriculture can solve
the problem of unemployment and food insecurity in Kenya.
of Kenyan land is classified as arid and semiarid areas.60% of Kenyan land
remains uncultivated. It is projected by the World Bank that the population of
sub Saharan Africa will increase by 1.7 billion by 2050.There will be 1.1
billion young people of working age by 2050 in sub Saharan Africa. Something
must be done today for a better future.
I
also participated in an international event called Geeklist hack4good<span>  0.6 in Nairobi Kenya. The event was a
challenge that united programmers from different parts of the world to make
applications that hacked against catastrophic events caused by climate change.
During the hackathon my team participated and created an android mobile
application called Zingu that became the best under the category of hacking
against extreme climate events. Zingu would help calculate the amount of water
that can be harvest from a roofs area. It was difficult to convince people to
use the android application because many people did not have android devices.
For this reason I decided to go to the ground and practically help out create
rain water harvesting systems and promote sustainable agriculture.
Link to Zingu app: https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B59edynC3pDRRGo4SksyWk5uaGs/edit?usp=sharing
For every:
10$ = 2 gutters
10$= 1 bag of cement to make masonry tanks.
5$ = 1 tree seedling
10$ = 1 packet of vegetable seeds
10$= 1 liter of car fuel
25$= 4 laterals of 7.5m drip irrigation system
JOIN US!! Spread word about this campaign.

Teach Kids About Tech

Saturday mornings we teach kids about programming computers because everyone has computers. We want to teach them about robots and those are harder to come by:

  • Support a day of robotics education for 100 kids on July 25th, 2015.
  • Equipment bought for the event will be awarded to promising young makers, used again for future programs, and loaned to community groups and schools.
  • Your contributions help build a new generation of bright, inquisitive, and inventive humans who will power the tech industry of the future.
• Any extra funds will be turned over to a non-profit that provides grants for Seattle CoderDojo programs.
• Seattle CoderDojo is scheduled to run 38 events for kids in 2015.

We need robots, robot parts, and lunch:

  • We're trying to budget $1,000 per room for four rooms and $1,500 for lunch to teach 100 kids and feed lunch to all the kids, parents, volunteers, and community exhibitors.

• We are approaching corporate sponsors to raise larger amounts. Anything in excess of our overall funding goal from all sources ($5,500) will be donated to Urban Sparks a 501.c.3 non-profit who will hold it on account and use it to fund grants to Seattle CoderDojo for upcoming projects.
<h3>Risks &amp
<span style=""background-color: initial
column2: >If we do not meet our minimum goal of $3,500 from all sources, we may be forced to cancel the event. In that case, sponsor fees would be refunded and IndieGogo donations would be handed over to Urban Sparks.
column3:
>

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate, share the link. Come help teach. Come help make coffee. Volunteer to help put together future events. We're always open to new volunteers.

Liberland Settlement Association

The Liberland settlement Association is a Swiss non-profit association and Liberlandian NGO, accepting members from all over the world - which works on- and off-site to realize the vision of Liberland
column2: a semi-autonomous Free-trade zone on the Danube - founded in no-man's land, built on principles of individual rights and freedom.

column5: >The LSA with some 300 members - and a permanent staff both on- and off site, constitute one of the largest and oldest organizations in the Liberland movement.

column1: On-site since April 2015, our aim is to pave the way for Liberland, both practically, legally and politically. We are most known for our very public settler/activist events which are designed to show the world that Liberland is a serious and determined movement, although these events is but a very minor part of our operations.

We are a non-political organization, a private NGO (non-government organization) and are not a part of the organization referred to as the Liberland government - although we do support each and every organization or private person which works for the recognition for Liberland.

column5: >The LSA has a thoroughly practical and non-political approach to the establishment of Liberland, working mostly on-site and with the local and regional population and authorities, as well as the legal and property sides of the equation

>Our organization has its on-site headquarters in a number of houses in Bezdan, Serbia, just off Liberland. The HQ is made up of several houses, a small harbor - boats, cars and is maintained by a permanent staff.
We also have our international office in Zug, Switzerland, and  we are establishing an office in Osijek, Croatia

column1: Stated purpose of the LSA

The 'Liberland Settlement Association' (LSA) is an idealistically founded non-profit association, dedicated to the practical work of establishing a free and semi-sovereign Liberland nation/free-trade zone, and establishing a permanent settlement within it.
<ul>
<li><span style=""font-weight: normal
column2: >To maintain a permanent settlement in the area - preferably on Liberland.

column1: <li><span style=""font-weight: normal
column2: >To ensure that settlers have the facilities, tools and support with which to work.

column1: <li><span style=""font-weight: normal
column2: >To build the legal foundation for Liberland, and to provide full legal support and assistance for settlers.

column1: <li><span style=""font-weight: normal
column2: >To spread information about Liberland locally, regionally - and around the world.

column1: <li><span style=""font-weight: normal
column2: >To reach agreements with private landowners in the Liberland/Siga area in regards to purchase, ownership, and use.

column1: <li><span style=""font-weight: normal
column2: > To reach an agreement with neighboring states in regards to the creation of a semi-autonomous free-trade zone, and to enforce these agreements.

column1: <li><span style=""font-weight: normal
column2: >To show the world that the Liberland movement is serious, and not an ""internet joke"".

column1: <span style=""color: rgb(0, 0, 0)
column4: >What is it your support will be used for?

column1:
Your support will be used for the daily and extraordinary running costs of the LSA.
Since April, we have proved to be a both cost effective and well run organization.

With a fixed permanent staff - supported by dedicated volunteers, and with a board which approves extraordinary expenditures, we have realized establishing a base in Serbia, establishing a staging point on the Danube, bought and maintained several boats and cars, drones, sourced a complete army field camp including generators, water supply and field sanitation - and much more.

One of our main costs are legal costs, both in providing legal support and representation for our settlers, obtaining needed licenses, creating local legal entities, paying fines associated with settler-activism. Our legal costs are well above those of our secondary costs, such as housing, food and petrol.

  • Rent of properties
  • Basic food supplies for HQ and Base Camp
  • Needed tools for the operation on- and off-site
• Repair and maintenance costs
<li>Transportation costs &amp
• Legal costs
<li>Printed material &amp
• Local level salaries for locally sourced permanent staff
What your donated funds will NOT be used for:
<div>
<ul>
• Personal gain of LSA staff or members - directly or indirectly
• Unneeded excess or luxury items
• Alcohol and social activities outside of community dinners
• Purchase of real estate/land in the Liberland/Siga picked (managed by the Liberland Settlement Corporation)
<div>
Café Liberland
If our fund raising is successful, the Croatian legal entity of the LSA will lease a working café in Osijek, Croatia - and change it into Café Liberland.

The café will be manned by properly educated volunteers, living on-site in Osijek, and act as a working café, serving both food and drink to all guests, hopefully becoming completely expense neutral or even profitable.
It will act as a focal point for Liberland related activities in Eastern Croatia - and help to act as a local 'embassy' in spreading the message of Liberland.
Verifiable Responsible management
Often with non-profits and crowd funding projects, it can be hard to trust the receiving entity - and if the stated goals and beneficiaries are indeed those listed.

column2: >However, with the LSA, we have several months of documented and verifable work behind us - and we are thus a proven organization, worthy of your trust. We have also maintained the same core team &amp
column3:
staff throughout the lifetime of our project and existence.
We encourage potential sponsors to do due-diligence on us and our work, stretching back all the way to April. A good place to start is our FB-group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/811990405553880/

Should you want further information about our work, we will be happy to answer any questions on info@liberlandsa.org.

column1: <span style=""color: rgb(0, 0, 0)

You can also donate via bank transfers (SEPA / Int. Wire) directly to the bank account of the LSA. The banking information is as follows:

Beneficiary: BTCS Payment Services Ltd, CH-6340 Baar, Switzerland
IBAN: LI76 0880 1200 4731 0181 4
Swift/BIC: BALPLI22
Account: 200.473.101814
Bank: BANK ALPINUM AG, Austrasse 59, FL-9490 Vaduz, Liechtenstein
Reference/Message: LSA
NB. If you support via a bank transfer, but would like any of the perks for which you qualify, please let us know at info@liberlandsa.org
Bitcoin
Yes - you can donate via Bitcoin. It is actually our favorite currency and means of donation. Our donation addresss:  https://blockchain.info/address/14Jn7GDf4YsN4SENoX4AakpBb6fmom8WEK
NB. If you support via a bank transfer, but would like any of the perks for which you qualify, please let us know at info@liberlandsa.org
Perks
We have naturally added some perks in appreciation of donations to our cause.
Legal, Risks and Challenges

The LSA is a legally formed, limited liability Swiss non-profit association, with bank accounts and offices in Switzerland and Serbia (hopefully soon also on Liberty Island, Liberland).

Donating to the LSA is perfectly legal in just about any jurisdiction in the world. It is however not tax deductible, as the LSA is not a recognized charitable organization.

It should also be noted that although we do our best - along with many others, to make Liberland a reality, there is currently no guarantee that we will succeed.

Currently the Liberland project is meeting resistance on the part of Croatian authorities, and we make no secret of this. Making Liberland happen is not an overnight project, and will take the convincing of all stakeholders, especially but not only the neighboring nation states, that Liberland is a good idea which will benefit everyone.

Other ways you can help

The LSA is on constant lookout for volunteers, especially volunteers to stay long term on-site (we supply you with a bed, food - and tasks and the tools needed for them), but also capable people off-site, to participate in our legal team, our PR-team, our Infrastructure team etc. 

To learn more about joining the LSA as a volunteer, see our FB-page or contact us on info@liberlandsa.org.

We are grateful for your contribution and will strive to manage it responsibly - and put it to the good use for the furthering and realization of the Liberland project!

/Niklas Nikolajsen - Chairman
/Ben Müller - CFO
/Kenneth Lillieholm - On-Site Chief
/Nicolai Oster - Assisting On-Site Manager
","Liberland Settlement Association

The Liberland settlement Association is a Swiss non-profit association and Liberlandian NGO, accepting members from all over the world - which works on- and off-site to realize the vision of Liberland
column2: a semi-autonomous Free-trade zone on the Danube - founded in no-man's land, built on principles of individual rights and freedom.

column1: The LSA with some 300 members - and a permanent staff both on- and off site, constitute one of the largest and oldest organizations in the Liberland movement.

On-site since April 2015, our aim is to pave the way for Liberland, both practically, legally and politically. We are most known for our very public settler/activist events which are designed to show the world that Liberland is a serious and determined movement, although these events is but a very minor part of our operations.

We are a non-political organization, a private NGO (non-government organization) and are not a part of the organization referred to as the Liberland government - although we do support each and every organization or private person which works for the recognition for Liberland.

The LSA has a thoroughly practical and non-political approach to the establishment of Liberland, working mostly on-site and with the local and regional population and authorities, as well as the legal and property sides of the equation

Our organization has its on-site headquarters in a number of houses in Bezdan, Serbia, just off Liberland. The HQ is made up of several houses, a small harbor - boats, cars and is maintained by a permanent staff.We also have our international office in Zug, Switzerland, and  we are establishing an office in Osijek, Croatia
Stated purpose of the LSA

The 'Liberland Settlement Association' (LSA) is an idealistically founded non-profit association, dedicated to the practical work of establishing a free and semi-sovereign Liberland nation/free-trade zone, and establishing a permanent settlement within it.
To maintain a permanent settlement in the area - preferably on Liberland.
To ensure that settlers have the facilities, tools and support with which to work.
To build the legal foundation for Liberland, and to provide full legal support and assistance for settlers.
To spread information about Liberland locally, regionally - and around the world.
To reach agreements with private landowners in the Liberland/Siga area in regards to purchase, ownership, and use.
To reach an agreement with neighboring states in regards to the creation of a semi-autonomous free-trade zone, and to enforce these agreements.
To show the world that the Liberland movement is serious, and not an ""internet joke"".
What is it your support will be used for?

Your support will be used for the daily and extraordinary running costs of the LSA.Since April, we have proved to be a both cost effective and well run organization. With a fixed permanent staff - supported by dedicated volunteers, and with a board which approves extraordinary expenditures, we have realized establishing a base in Serbia, establishing a staging point on the Danube, bought and maintained several boats and cars, drones, sourced a complete army field camp including generators, water supply and field sanitation - and much more.One of our main costs are legal costs, both in providing legal support and representation for our settlers, obtaining needed licenses, creating local legal entities, paying fines associated with settler-activism. Our legal costs are well above those of our secondary costs, such as housing, food and petrol.  Rent of properties Basic food supplies for HQ and Base Camp Needed tools for the operation on- and off-site
Repair and maintenance costs
Transportation costs & fuel
Legal costs
Printed material & PR costs
Local level salaries for locally sourced permanent staff
What your donated funds will NOT be used for:
Personal gain of LSA staff or members - directly or indirectly
Unneeded excess or luxury items
Alcohol and social activities outside of community dinners
Purchase of real estate/land in the Liberland/Siga picked (managed by the Liberland Settlement Corporation)
Café Liberland
If our fund raising is successful, the Croatian legal entity of the LSA will lease a working café in Osijek, Croatia - and change it into Café Liberland.

The café will be manned by properly educated volunteers, living on-site in Osijek, and act as a working café, serving both food and drink to all guests, hopefully becoming completely expense neutral or even profitable.
It will act as a focal point for Liberland related activities in Eastern Croatia - and help to act as a local 'embassy' in spreading the message of Liberland.
Verifiable Responsible management
Often with non-profits and crowd funding projects, it can be hard to trust the receiving entity - and if the stated goals and beneficiaries are indeed those listed.

However, with the LSA, we have several months of documented and verifable work behind us - and we are thus a proven organization, worthy of your trust. We have also maintained the same core team & staff throughout the lifetime of our project and existence.We encourage potential sponsors to do due-diligence on us and our work, stretching back all the way to April. A good place to start is our FB-group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/811990405553880/Should you want further information about our work, we will be happy to answer any questions on info@liberlandsa.org.
Bank Transfers

You can also donate via bank transfers (SEPA / Int. Wire) directly to the bank account of the LSA. The banking information is as follows:Beneficiary: BTCS Payment Services Ltd, CH-6340 Baar, SwitzerlandIBAN: LI76 0880 1200 4731 0181 4Swift/BIC: BALPLI22Account: 200.473.101814Bank: BANK ALPINUM AG, Austrasse 59, FL-9490 Vaduz, LiechtensteinReference/Message: LSA
NB. If you support via a bank transfer, but would like any of the perks for which you qualify, please let us know at info@liberlandsa.org
Bitcoin
Yes - you can donate via Bitcoin. It is actually our favorite currency and means of donation. Our donation addresss:  https://blockchain.info/address/14Jn7GDf4YsN4SENoX4AakpBb6fmom8WEK
NB. If you support via a bank transfer, but would like any of the perks for which you qualify, please let us know at info@liberlandsa.org
Perks
We have naturally added some perks in appreciation of donations to our cause.
Legal, Risks and Challenges

The LSA is a legally formed, limited liability Swiss non-profit association, with bank accounts and offices in Switzerland and Serbia (hopefully soon also on Liberty Island, Liberland).Donating to the LSA is perfectly legal in just about any jurisdiction in the world. It is however not tax deductible, as the LSA is not a recognized charitable organization.

It should also be noted that although we do our best - along with many others, to make Liberland a reality, there is currently no guarantee that we will succeed. Currently the Liberland project is meeting resistance on the part of Croatian authorities, and we make no secret of this. Making Liberland happen is not an overnight project, and will take the convincing of all stakeholders, especially but not only the neighboring nation states, that Liberland is a good idea which will benefit everyone.   Other ways you can help

The LSA is on constant lookout for volunteers, especially volunteers to stay long term on-site (we supply you with a bed, food - and tasks and the tools needed for them), but also capable people off-site, to participate in our legal team, our PR-team, our Infrastructure team etc. To learn more about joining the LSA as a volunteer, see our FB-page or contact us on info@liberlandsa.org.We are grateful for your contribution and will strive to manage it responsibly - and put it to the good use for the furthering and realization of the Liberland project!/Niklas Nikolajsen - Chairman/Ben Müller - CFO/Kenneth Lillieholm - On-Site Chief/Nicolai Oster - Assisting On-Site Manager",9.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","Baar, Switzerland",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/liberland-settlement-association/pica

","ABOUT US:
Ana Fuentes-Palacio from ""Natural Nest Organics"" will be opening the Gables Enrichment Center and hosting ""Artists at the Falls"" 2nd location.
""Artists at the Falls"" Studio was opened in 2006 in the Falls Art District by Miami Artist Talia Rodriguez.
Since then, the studio has provided:
Fine Art Programs designed to guide, inspire & draw out natural talent for children of all ages & levels who have no exposure to the arts in school due to budget cuts!
Art Supplies for underprivileged & sick kids in local foster care programs, hospitals & after-school centers through an annual Art Collection Drive!
Summer, Winter & Spring Break Art Camps to provide a healthy & happy learning environment for creative kids!
Portfolio Preparation Art Classes for artistic children wanting to develop their abilities for high school art magnet & art college programs.
Monthly Gallery Nights to showcase the work of local & unknown artists for free during lively artwalks.
Art Birthday Parties & Ladies Night Out Paint Parties to encourage the community to celebrate creatively!
And so much more!
HOW YOU CAN HELP:
Your donations will help us fund:
Modifications to the building, required for licensing that will allow us to meet strict licensing requirements & to provide a well-equipped, safe & secure learning environment.
Free Art Classes & Art Camp Scholarships for underprivileged children who could not afford art classes otherwise!
After-School Homework Helpers and tutoring programs!
Art Supplies such as canvases, paint, brushes, paper, charcoal & more!
Art Furniture such as tables, stools, easels, lighting & more!
Art Reference material such as art history books & art instructional books!
Office Equipment such as computer, printer & computer programs such as Photoshop & Adobe Illustrator for Computer Art Classes!
Free Gallery Nights to showcase the work of local talent!
And so much more!!
OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP:
Don't worry if you can't contribute! We'd be happy if you:
Spread the word about our campaign and forwarded this to anyone who might help!
Left us a comment of encouragement on our Indiegogo.com page!
Became our friend on Facebook and Instagram at  ""Artists at the Falls""
Thank you from the very bottom of our ""arts""!!",0.0,0,"1 Campaign

overcome.” Radiant Kids has been established with the primary
objective of providing basic education to all those children who have never
gone to school or are out of school due to lack of facilities, poverty &amp
frequent migration, etc. It also provides a creative and conducive platform by

column7: >I have created this campaign on behalf of the

column1: Radiant Kids School.  This school is run by Aparna Singh in Gurgaon to
educate the children of the poorest of the poor.  She does this amazing
job relying on her own funds and donations.  This week she lost her lease
on the property she was renting to run the school.  As she is looking for
a new property to rent, she found that the rents are out of her reach.
There are currently 115 children in the school ranging in age from 3 to
18.  They are equally divided between girls and boys in a 50-50 ratio.
A majority of these kids belong to the lower castes - they are children
of rag pickers, day laborers, maids, auto-rockshaw drivers etc.  Without a
project such as Radiant Kids, these children would be walking the streets or
begging or getting into other trouble.  Aparnaa runs the school via the
non-profit EcoLibFoundation.

column7: >I am a resident of the community where Aparnaa

column1: lives and have just moved to India from Texas.  I have seen the kids from
this school perform on stage and have purchased some of the handicrafts created
by them.  My heart was touched by what Aparnaa is doing for these
children.  I was also broken hearted, along with countless other residents
in this community, to hear of the school closure.  We immediately
mobilized and collected INR 28000 for her ($450) within one day!  However,
that is not enough to save the school by renting another property.
Aparnaa needs $10,000 to sustain the school for the next year.

column7: '>All the donated funds will be utilized for the infrastructure including

column1: well- equipped library and computer lab, teachers salary, snacks for the kids
and other supplies.
column5: > If Aparnaa can raise the $10,000, she can run the school for a

column1: year and, in the meantime, find sustained corporate or social donations, to
keep it going for many years beyond.

column7: >Please share this campaign with everyone you know

column1: within your ""six degree"" radius and ask them to share it further.
It is truly a noble cause.  If we can raise the money, it will be a
changed world for these children.

","Save the
Radiant Kids School
Eco Lib Foundation (EcoLib) a registered NGO, which works through literacy,
livelihood promotion & market linkages, for assisting kids that come from
economically weaker sections of society, whose parents work as labors, domestic
workers, security and support staff in both rural and urban settings. With this
objective, Eco Lib has started “Radiant Kids” – its non-formal
education and awareness center for underprivileged children in Gurgaon.
Its motto is “Together we shall
overcome.” Radiant Kids has been established with the primary
objective of providing basic education to all those children who have never
gone to school or are out of school due to lack of facilities, poverty &
frequent migration, etc. It also provides a creative and conducive platform by
way of sports, karate, music, library,etc., not only for the holistic
development of other underprivileged kids, but also to channelize their energy
positively, as a buffer from the negative influences of their adverse
circumstances.
I have created this campaign on behalf of the
Radiant Kids School.  This school is run by Aparna Singh in Gurgaon to
educate the children of the poorest of the poor.  She does this amazing
job relying on her own funds and donations.  This week she lost her lease
on the property she was renting to run the school.  As she is looking for
a new property to rent, she found that the rents are out of her reach.
There are currently 115 children in the school ranging in age from 3 to
18.  They are equally divided between girls and boys in a 50-50 ratio.
A majority of these kids belong to the lower castes - they are children
of rag pickers, day laborers, maids, auto-rockshaw drivers etc.  Without a
project such as Radiant Kids, these children would be walking the streets or
begging or getting into other trouble.  Aparnaa runs the school via the
non-profit EcoLibFoundation.
I am a resident of the community where Aparnaa
lives and have just moved to India from Texas.  I have seen the kids from
this school perform on stage and have purchased some of the handicrafts created
by them.  My heart was touched by what Aparnaa is doing for these
children.  I was also broken hearted, along with countless other residents
in this community, to hear of the school closure.  We immediately
mobilized and collected INR 28000 for her ($450) within one day!  However,
that is not enough to save the school by renting another property.
Aparnaa needs $10,000 to sustain the school for the next year.
Where will the funds go?
All the donated funds will be utilized for the infrastructure including
well- equipped library and computer lab, teachers salary, snacks for the kids
and other supplies. If Aparnaa can raise the $10,000, she can run the school for a
year and, in the meantime, find sustained corporate or social donations, to
keep it going for many years beyond.
Please share this campaign with everyone you know
within your ""six degree"" radius and ask them to share it further.
It is truly a noble cause.  If we can raise the money, it will be a

changed world for these children.FOR PEOPLE LIVING IN INDIA - important information:Donors living in India may contribute directly to the Ecolib Foundation CURRENT account as follows:Bank Details- Eco Lib FoundationA/c no. 200998953696, IndusInd Bank,Nawal Kishor Road, Lucknow, U. P.(IFSC Code – INDB0000519,MICR Code – 226234051)
You can see
more information about the school at:
http://bit.ly/LApuBa

Please help support FORWARD's efforts to continue to provide Free programming in Washington DC.

After a 3 year process, FORWARD is honored and humbled to be able to present our culture on the steps of The Jefferson Memorial at two Free day time events, Saturday May 17th and Sunday May 18th from 12 - 7:00pm. FORWARD is also proud to continue our tradition of offering Free educational programming including Hardware and Software workshops in conjunction with our friends at Chuck Levin's Washington Music Center and Tropicalia.

In order to pull this off it takes quite a bit of funding, energy and effort - that's where we need your help!

The impact of your support is significant. It allows all of us to share what we love with more people. It helps us grow our community, touch more people, break down misconceptions and engage with a broader audience. FORWARD is entering its 7th year - we want to continue to be able to do this for an additional 7, but need your backing to make it possible. 

In particular, the money we're requesting goes towards: Artist fees, Permitting costs, The public art project, Marketing...To be honest, the actual costs are greater as they don't include equipment, gear, man hours...but we have to start somewhere!

Beyond your financial support, please help us by sharing this campaign and getting the word out about FORWARD.


For more information on our various partners and their supporting products, please visit:

Hi there!!
column4: >I'm Andrea Phillips, owner of Andrea's Angel Academy!!  I have a passion for teaching children, giving back to my community, and investing in the leaders of tomorrow!  Won't you join me??
column7: >To donate you can choose one of our INCREDIBLE perks on the right or you can donate ANY amount by clicking the CONTRIBUTE NOW button to the right or at the bottom of the page!!
column10: >EVERY DOLLAR COUNTS LADIES AND GENTLEMEN!  Remember this is for the children of our community!!!
column13: >Be sure to click on the update tab above for more information!!
column16: >Andrea's Angel Academy is an established pre-school and family daycare.  We have been at capacity since the beginning, and we now have a waiting list of Angels that we simply don't currently have room for.
column19: > In terms of my own experience I have worked with children for 20 years through all different avenues such as baby-sitting, working for other daycare centers, working with youth in the criminal justice system, substitute teaching, being a foster parent, being mother to 3 beautiful children, and of course owning my own pre-school/daycare.
column22: >I have prior management experience, and my formal education has been focused on education, sociology, and management.
column25: >I started this campaign in hopes that people would recognize and appreciate my vision.  It is my hope that even if you don't know me or any of our Angels, that you will want to invest in a campaign that will make a difference in the lives of several generations to come.  Andrea's Angel Academy has the potential to be something GREAT, not only for our current Angels, but for our community as a whole.
column28: >In addition to being an early childhood center which focuses on excellence for all of our Angels, we also hope to rise to be a strong local business which will give back to our community every day that we are open.
column31: >It is my dream to see Andrea's Angel Academy making a difference in the lives of our children and their families.  It is also my dream to begin and end this venture debt-free.  I am very good at finding a bargain, and Andrea's Angel Academy will utilize every dollar to it's most extreme potential.  We are NOT trying to build a shiny new school that doesn't put the children as our first priority.  Regardless of our growth the children will always remain our focus.
column34: >Andrea's Angel Academy believes strongly in family, compassion, education, and loyalty.  We are seeking to expand a company that started from the ground up, with one goal in mind, to care for any child who walks through our doors to the best of our ability.
column37:
>By making a generous donation towards our campaign you can make a difference in the lives of so many of our children.

What We Need &
column38:
What You Get

Andrea's Angel Academy is seeking to reach a goal of $20,000 in the next 30 days!!  I know that we can reach this goal with your help!!

This money will go towards securing our building.  As you may know it is not cheap to lease or buy a commercial space, and this is our biggest risk.  In order to avoid failure we would REALLY like to have this risk covered at the beginning so that we can focus more attention on the Angels.  $14,000 of our goal will go towards our building fund including the monthly payment and insurance along with materials that we will need like kitchen appliances, paint, ceiling tiles, and a small amount of vinyl flooring.

The remaining $6,000 will go towards furniture for our classrooms, educational materials, and outdoor play equipment.

For donating to our fundraiser you can receive some AWESOME perks!!  We are SUPER excited for growth, and we are SUPER excited that you are are willing to help us out!!

Some of the perks we are offering include t-shirts, shout outs on our blog, free enrollment fees, jewelry, Mary Kay products and a makeover party, tickets to our AWESOME VIP Grand Opening Pizza Party, and tickets to Starlight Theater!!  For those men who prefer no jewelry or makeover parties we will substitute your free gifts with more masculine items (watches, tickets to Royals game, a golf package, etc..)  We will also have a plaque in our lobby listing everyone's name and/or business name that played a very important part in our expansion.
column47: >The Impact of your involvement will be significant, and you will be able to easily see how you have helped Andrea's Angel Academy and our community.  Our Angels will have so much more room to explore, learn, and play.  We will have more room for growth.  We will be able to offer child care to more families in our area.  We will be able to create more jobs and be an employer that people want to work for.  You will be giving back to the community indirectly as well because your contribution will put us one step closer to being able to offer assistance with clothing, toys, and food to families in our area who are in need of assistance.
column52:
>Other Ways You Can Help

We would LOVE LOVE LOVE it if you could spread the word about our campaign!  The more people who see this will mean the closer we are to our goal!!  Paste it on your Facebook, Twitter, Blog, ANYWHERE, we will love ya for it!!

We are also graciously accepting donations for services such as painting, plumbing, and tree removal as well as donations of any kitchen appliances, office equipment, educational materials, books, furniture, play equipment, etc...

If you would like to donate a service or anything that you think we can use, please e-mail me directly at director@andreasangelacademy.com.

P.S...  If we are unable to meet our $20,000 goal the money earned will be put into our building fund.  The money will still be used in the same way.  We will just have to stretch it even further, and our expansion date will be pushed back.

Thank you again for your generosity!

<span style=""letter-spacing: 0.06em

Edgewater Workbench is an up and coming community workshop space. It's a place where you can work on a weekend project, learn and/or teach a new skill, and meet other creative people from the neighborhood.

The main facets of Edgewater Workbench are:

- Wood and metal workshop space/artist studio space
- Computer and 3D design/print lab
- Space for community groups to hold meetings and events

With access to space, tools, and knowledgable folks, there is a lot of potential for what you can get out of your contribution to Edgewater Workbench.

With the support of Alderman Harry Osterman, the Chicago Transit Authority, and the Edgewater Chamber of Commerce, we’ve been given access to a 1200 sq. ft. storefront in the heart of our community. Now we need some help fixing it up so you can bring your tools over and get cracking!

Edgewater Workbench will also serve as the official headquarters for Community Glue Workshop and Edgewater Reads. Community Glue Workshop offers free monthly repair clinics where volunteers try their hands at fixing just about anything you could fit through the door! Edgewater Reads is currently working on a Little Libraries initiative. We’ll store book donations, provide space and guidance on building Little Libraries, and host Edgewater Reads meetings at Edgewater Workbench.

Who are we?

Ally Brisbin and Stuart Marsh are active community members in Edgewater, Chicago. We are core members of Community Glue Workshop, a repair collective that meets monthly to provide free repairs to anything brought in. Ally is the Marketing and Events Coordinator for the Edgewater Chamber of Commerce, and has strong relationships throughout the small business community in Edgewater. Stuart is a jack of all trades. His background is in 3D design and animation, as well as carpentry and film production. 


What We Need &
column2:
What You Get

Our main funding needs are renovation costs. Right now the space is pretty raw, but we can spruce it up pretty quickly once we have the materials. We need help covering the cost of new flooring in a few areas, some paint to brighten it up, dry wall and peg board to hold us in, and some other odds and ends. We also need to furnish the place! Beyond that, we'll need help covering our overhead costs, like insurance and utilities.

If we don't reach our entire goal, the funds raised will still go toward our renovation costs. If we dramatically exceed our goal, the funds raised will go toward paying off our overhead expenses for 2014 in full.

With your contribution, you get to experience Edgewater Workbench! Get your name on our supporters' wall, attend our fundraiser party, create your own 3D printed model! We promise to deliver some fun in exchange for your donation!

The Impact

Edgewater is one of the most densely populated neighborhoods in Chicago. We also have a high concentration of self-identified artists and other creative types. However, since we’re so densely populated, that means we don’t have a lot of extra room at home to create. Edgewater Workbench aims to alleviate the pains of a living room/studio/woodshop so you can just have a living room. It will be a place to collaborate, share your knowledge, and learn from others. 

But Edgewater Workbench is more than just a workshop, it’s a community space. We’ll open our doors to community groups, theatre companies, artists, educators -- anyone who needs space to do what they do!  

A contribution to our campaign is a contribution to our community and an investment in education.

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute? You can still help our cause!

column1: • Share this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Pinterest, whatever else!
• Donate tools in good working order! Please send a private message if you are interested in donating tools.
• Tell your friends and colleagues about our fundraiser! Saturday, Jan. 25, 6-9pm at 1106 W. Thorndale Ave., home of our friends Jackalope Theatre Company!

Toastmasters International presented me a Presidential Citation at the Hall
of Fame ceremony at the 83<sup>rd</sup> International Convention in Kuala
Lumpur, Malaysia, August 20-23.
I have been involved in Toastmasters International for over
17 years. Many of my friends and colleagues have asked me why I continue in the
organization even though I have achieved the highest educational award
Toastmasters presents, the Distinguished Toastmaster. The answer is simply that
I enjoy helping people achieve their goals and transform their lives through
Toastmasters. The ultimate reward is to witness that moment when someone
finally starts to believe in themselves. I am proud to represent the Yukon Alaska Council of Toastmasters and our new club at Alaska Career College.
I am thrilled and honored to be the recipient of such a prestigious
award and to be able to receive it in person at the Hall of Fame ceremony was an unparalleled experience. As I was trying to make arrangements to attend
the International Convention, many of my friends and fellow Toastmasters asked if they could help make this goal a reality. Your generosity and support
are greatly appreciated.
To facilitate financial contributions, I have set
up this crowd funding page.
The expected costs were as follows:
Airfare:                                       $1,500
Lodging:                                        $600

Conference:                                  $450

Miscellaneous.:                            $400

Receiving the award in person: Priceless! (some things money can't buy)
I am humbled by those who have already offered support and
greatly appreciate any support you may choose to provide. If you are unable to
contribute financially, please assist by sharing this information and link

through your friends and social networks.

Short Summary:  Please see our site hofnodnj.org

IMPROVISE ADAPT AND OVERCOME

Your help will help us give students a wholesome, healthy hobby of life long values which create memories and experiences of a lifetime.  Do you remember catching your first fish?  You probably remember who you went with, and where it happened.  The excitement on a child's face after catching his first fish, is much like your face if you won the lottery.  Help us create these kind of memories for youngsters, ages K-12 !!!  beginning today, 8/5/14 till the end of the year, every dollar donated Will be matched by VIEW TRADE, An international brokeradge firm.


I am Charles Breitweiser, President of Hooked On Fishing Not On Drugs New Jersey, a 501c3 non-profit corporation.

Hooked On Fishing Not On Drugs (HOFNOD) is a national school curriculum, available in 30 states, divided into 20- 1 hour lessons which cover core curriculum such as, Biology, Health, Physical Education, Art, Science, and Conservation.  Also covered are important life skills like, ethics, decision making, planning, goal setting, interpersonal communication, courage, problem solving, and improved parent child relationships.  

     On a personal note, I'm suffering from a physical handicap due to a car accident when I was in as a senior in High School '79.  This affects the fine motor coordination of my left arm and leg.  I use this as a method to motivate students that no matter how tough life gets, you can always be tougher.  My motto is ""Improvise, Adapt and Overcome.""  I relate very well to students, because I was their age when I was injured.  COURAGE is a primary subject of those important life skills students will learn.  I will teach the teachers how to teach the course to their students, which counts toward their 100 hours of professional development. We will  take students on weekend fishing trips. Not just me, we have other certified instructors working with the students  HOFNOD is available in 30 different states and I have reports, from their state department of education, showing better test grades, attendance, and reduced incidents of drugs and alcohol.  We have been successfully operating in the Old Bridge High School for 3 years.  Please contact them to hear about the resounding success of HOFNOD.  We are eagerly seeking donations to help is continue our work on the other school districts throughout the state of New Jersey.  Anyone who can help us we will proudly post their advertisement on our website, and boast of their community responsibility.  Please contact me  at 732-762-0837,or email  hofnodnj@hotmail.com  if you have any questions or can help us.  


What We Need &
column2:
What You Get

Your generous contributions will be used to purchase curriculum textbooks, as well as fishing equipment, and funds will be used for transportation costs to get students out on weekend fishing trips.  It will also be needed to cover any administrative expenses.   We have been running Hooked On Fishing Not On Drugs successfully for 3 years in Old Bridge High School.  We have been doing and annual party boat fluke fishing trip, and we need funding to continue that successful event.

    The Impact

    Whenever I speak at the school, students tell me they love to fish but no one ever takes them.  I can imagine how it is with today's busy lifestyle, both parents working.  Whats a kid to do?  This is where I come in.  Through the school, we coordinate weekend fishing trips.  Some of these students have never fished in their lives.  They have shown, to the teachers pictures of fish they caught on their own.  This proves the long-term success of Hooked On Fishing Not On Drugs.


    This project is run by responsible role models and it shows students a wholesome way to avoid the empty problems of drugs and alcohol,and it also helps students to stay fit, and enjoy some time away from the television.   The NJ division of Wildlife did a report on the health benefits a student gets by having a direct connection to the outdoors.  The conclusion is the benefits are as vital as adequate sleep and proper nutrition.   Fishing also gives a student time to think about the challenges they face and work out things without the distractions of home life.  Fishing builds self confidence and empowers youngsters to stay involved with other students and community leaders building a healthy lifestyle.    This will reduce obesity and boredom creating a generation of productive, confident new consumers and future employees with a responsible work ethic.

    I have been running this program in Old Bridge High school for 3 years and received many accolades from the school board, teachers, parents, even the city council and mayor.  I noticed on every fluke trip how well behaved the students were.  You would expect a boat full of 49 high school kids to be arguing, name calling, and kids scuffles, but not a single negative event.  They were polite, listened attentively, and cooperative.  I admired how students helped one another.  And this wasn't just one time.  Every year has been a rounding success.  I urge you to call the Old Bridge School district and find out for yourself how successful this course is, and how enthused the school board is about continuing the course. 

    Risks &

column1:
• The only real challenge I have is reaching out to new schools.  Some schools are reluctant to add another course to an already busy school schedule.  I advise the board members, this is an extracurricular course, not to interfere with the busy school day.  Besides, since the course covers core curriculum it can be taught instead of a science, or gym class.  There are teachers who would love to take on a new curriculum.

    • Other Ways You Can Help

    There are over 800 school districts in New Jersey.  It is likely I will have too many schools to work with.  If you love to fish,  and enjoy working with children, like me, or just want to spend some quality time outdoors with your local community.  We will be needing volunteers to help fish with the students.  Just contact me hofnodnj@hotmail.com and I will schedule a 1 day training seminar, so you can be a certified instructor.  Or you can speak to your local school board and tell them about the project.  Better yet, tell the students about Hooked on Fishing Not On Drugs, and they will really get the BUZZ going.

• Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

    • And that's all there is to it.

Manierre Elementary School
column3: >Manierre Elementary School is sandwiched between two worlds, the affluence of Lincoln Park and Old Town are in stark contrast to the children's  homes.  This year the school hopes to send all of their pupils on a school trip to Washington, DC. For many of the children it will be their first time out of the state. We would appreciate any help that you are willing to offer, as each dollar can make a difference.

column1: <li>The cost per pupil is $600
column2: many of the families were not able to cover the cost themselves so, we are reaching out to the community for help.

column1: • This trip is so much more than just a field trip, it is a chance for the students to be exposed to a world that they may not have had a chance to experience otherwise.
• We hope that this will serve as an inspiration

column6:
>We still need to raise nearly $6000

So far we have been able to raise nearly $27,000 but, there are still 10 students that remain unable to go due to the cost. We do not want anyone to be left behind! It is heartbreaking to think that these ten children would be sitting in Chicago knowing that their classmates were in Washington, DC and that they were unable to go due to the cost of the trip.

Help for children of the South-East of Ukraine
In
Ukraine, now there is no money, not even for the smallest patients. Being
injured in the South-East, the children are in need of medical assistance.
Dozens of
young patients are in need of medical and humanitarian aid, but, in Ukraine,
there is absolutely no budget funds for them. Simply put, there is not much to
help with!
Hemodialysis
for patients with renal insufficiency is a huge problem. Besides, there is the
urgent need for pacemakers. There is a disastrous lack of surgical instruments.
The help
is needed both for those who remained in Ukraine, and for those who, escaping
the war, fled to Russia.
There are
many children, whose parents arrived together with them from Ukraine, but they
do not have the status of forced migrants. And their children suffer from
juvenile rheumatoid arthritis. For some reason, there are lots of such children
in Ukraine, and this disease presumes that they inevitably need injections to
be given. One ampoule costs about 700 EUR! They must be helped urgently with
these!
We urge
everyone to help in raising funds for treatment, medications and humanitarian
aid for the children, who suffered in the South-East of Ukraine.
Help us
help them!
Hilfe für die Kinder aus der Ostukraine
Nicht
einmal für die kleinsten Patienten gibt es derzeit Geld in der Ukraine.
Verletzte Kinder in der Ostukraine brauchen medizinische Hilfe.
Dutzende
kleine Patienten warten auf medizinische und humanitäre Hilfe, aber in der
Ukraine gibt es dafür überhaupt kein Geld. Einfach kein Geld!
Das größte
Problem stellen Dialysepatienten mit schweren Nierenversagen dar. Darüber
hinaus werden dringend Herzschrittmacher benötigt. Katastrophal fehlt es an
chirurgischen Instrumenten.
Hilfe
brauchen Menschen, die in der Ukraine geblieben sind und auch die, die wegen
des Krieges nach Russland geflüchtet sind.
In
Russland befinden sich viele Kinder mit ihren Eltern, die allerdings rechtlich
keinen Einwanderer-Status haben. Kinder aus der Ukraine leiden häufig an
juveniler rheumatoide Arthritis, eine der chronischen Erkrankungen im
Kindesalter. Für die Behandlung dieser Krankheit werden unbedingt Injektionen
benötigt. Eine Ampulle kostet um die 700 Euro! Dafür wird dringendst Hilfe
gesucht!
Bitte
helfen Sie mit Ihrer Spende! Kinder aus der Ostukraine brauchen dringend
medizinische Behandlung, Medikamente und humanitäre Hilfe.
Bitte
helfen Sie uns ihnen zu helfen!

MY STORY

Hello friends! Izzy here, aged 24. This year, I’ve decided to do something more with my life

– by helping others and sharing my time and heart through volunteering. I have committed to volunteer programs in The Philippines and Crete, Greece in 2015/16. I ask you to share in my journey and support my fundraising campaign which will run through April.

The Philippines
Since I was in high
school, I have wanted to go back to my parents' home country, The Philippines, and
help the community. My parents moved to Australia in 1990. They didn’t have much at
all and they moved here so that I could have an opportunity for a better, safer
life. Growing up, I’ve often thought about what my life  would have been like -
and how could I help others back home?
The volunteer
program involves teaching English in a rural primary school in Tacloban, a town that was devastated by Typhoon Yolanda in 2013. Unfortunately, many rural
schools are overcrowded and lack teachers and learning materials. Children are squeezed into small classrooms
and schools don’t have facilities such as a library.
I want to help change
this! I am asking for your support in raising funds to buy learning materials
for the children such as books, posters, stationery and more!
Crete, Greece
I loved my trip to Greece

last year and found the culture so vibrant. When I return in July this year, I want to help the community. I will be joining a great volunteer program in Crete where I will be teaching English to promising children from underprivileged backgrounds. I am so excited to share my time and efforts in teaching the children.

Where does the money go?
• Your donation will support purchases of learning materials for the children such as books, posters, stationery
• Your donation will also help fund my volunteer program fee (covers costs to host family, volunteering support and safety supervision)

Short Summary
We are a group of 21 Pararescue/Combat Rescue Officer Trainees in our final 6 month course of an arduous 2 year pipeline.

""Pararescuemen are United States Air Force Special Operations Command (AFSOC) and Air Combat Command (ACC) operatives tasked with recovery and medical treatment of personnel in humanitarian and combat environments. Also known as ""PJs"" (Pararescue Jumpers), these special operations members are attached to other SOF teams from all branches to conduct other operations as appropriate. Of the 22 enlisted Air Force Cross recipients, 12 are Pararescuemen. They wear the maroon beret as a symbol of their elite status, and to symbolize the blood shed by past PJs, as well as the blood current PJs are willing to shed to save lives.""
This page is to serve as an accessible means for our friends and family who have expressed interest in donating to our team!
*NOTE: This fundraiser is not in an official capacity represented by the USAF.
<div>
What We Need and The Impact

In this final course, we are looking to raise money (a team fund if you will) to help out with team dinners, gear (that we must purchase on our own), patches, and morale activities as well as money for our final team graduation and plaque.
<div>
Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate, it's okay, we understand! Please feel free to send out this information to any family or friends that you may think can help us. Anything helps and is greatly appreciated. Thank you!

Dear friends,

I'm planning to visit an elementary school in the remote mountain area in China's Shanxi province at the end of May. The place is 5 hours away by car from Taiyuan, the capital city of Shanxi . It's an unpreviledged area that people don't even have access to Internet. All they need is love and dream. I want to ask a favor from you: please spread your love and enlighten their dreams by simply contributing a small amount of money (our goal is $2000) for us to buy living goods, DVD players, books, music instruments for them. Even if it's just a music CD, a DVD, or some travel documentary, it means a great lot to the little kids there. It means they have a better chance of seeing the outside world and their dreams will be inspired. If you have any extra books, DVDs or other items you want to spare, please kindly send them to the following address: 山西省石楼县小蒜镇田家岔村田家岔小学 薛老師收

Their dreams are at your fingertips.

Thank you everyone from the bottom of my heart.
