Sobre mi...

column2: >Hola, soy Javier Patiño Castro y tengo 24 años. Desde hace dos años que fundé mi empresa, me he dedicado a través de ésta a apoyar a emprendedores para que alcancen sus sueños y puedan dedicarse a lo que realmente les apasiona. Acompañándolos en el proceso de transformar sus ideas en proyectos innovadores y sostenibles, he contribuido junto con mi equipo de trabajo a que nuestros clientes se conviertan en personas felices, exitosas y comprometidas en aportar a la construcción de un país y un mundo mejor.

column1: En lo que necesito apoyo...

column2: >Hace un mes inicié un curso de liderazgo que sé que me ayudará a ser una mejor persona, con más herramientas para poder guiar a mi equipo de trabajo y a mis clientes hacia metas más grandes.

>Decidí asumir este curso a título personal debido a que mi empresa está en medio de su proceso de fortalecimiento y no dispone de la liquidez suficiente para apoyarme en este momento. Es por esto que me remito a todos ustedes y les agradecería enormemente que me apoyaran de la forma que ustedes puedan y prefieran. US$1.000 es lo que me hace falta para poder completar la segunda parte del curso. Sin embargo, no se preocupen si su contribución no es económica, existen más formas de apoyarme y cualquier forma en la que decidan hacerlo, será igualmente valorada y eternamente agradecida. Si quieren, pueden compartir este link en sus redes sociales para que se corra la voz.

column1: El impacto de su contribución...

column2: >Mi empresa ""The S' Lab"" desarrolla proyectos en los que la innovación social, el diseño de servicios y el diseño estratégico deben ser componentes esenciales. De esta forma, podemos obtener resultados que impacten positivamente a la competitividad de la región, desde más de una perspectiva. En otras palabras, lo que hacemos es construir modelos de negocio que brinden un servicio útil a las personas, contribuyan a la sociedad y que fácilmente se re-inventen así mismos a medida que evoluciona el mercado.

>En este momento TS'L está creciendo, los proyectos son cada vez más complejos y requieren de equipos de trabajo más grandes. Además, en este momento estamos a punto de iniciar nuestro primer proyecto fuera de Colombia así que la responsabilidad es mayor. Debemos estar más preparados para empezar a demostrarle al mundo lo que los Colombianos podemos hacer por él.
>Con su apoyo, contribuirán a que ""The S' Lab"" llegue cada vez más lejos acompañando a las personas con buenas ideas que pueden hacer del mundo un mejor lugar para vivir.

column1: Como agradecimiento...

column2: >Como agradecimiento a su contribución, seré feliz de apoyarlos en la construcción de su idea de negocio en caso de que tengan una. Estaré en plena disposición de aportarles en lo que pueda y les enseñare una serie de herramientas que les pueden ser útiles para lograr lo que quieren. Solo necesitarán contactarme.
>Muchas gracias por tomarse el tiempo de leer esto y por su apoyo.

column1: About me

My name is Javier Patiño Castro, I'm 24 years old. As a designer since I founded my company 2 years ago, my team and I have been supporting entrepreneurs to reach their dreams by translating their ideas in sustainable and innovative proyects, that not only let them be happy and successful people but also allowing them to contribute in the construcciton of a better world.
What I need
One month ago I began a teams leadership program that I know will be really helpful to let me be a better person with more skills to guide my team and my clients unto better results and bigger goals.

I decided to take this program as a personal task because my company, in the middle of it's getting stronger process, do not have the solvency to support me at this moment. So that's why I'm requiring your help. US$ 1.000 is what I need to complete the program's second part. Please contribute whatever you can afford. Because every little bit counts you should not worry if you can't afford a financial contribution. There are other ways you can help me. For example you could share this with your friends to spread the word.
The Impact

My company ""The S' Lab"" develops projects in which social innovatión, service design and business strategy must be involved, so its results positively impact the region's competitiveness in many ways. In other words we develope business that serves people, contribute to the society and that easily reinvents it self in the market.

At this moment my company is getting stronger, the projects are more complex and they require bigger teams. Beside, now we are starting our first job outside Colombia so the responsability is major. We must be more prepared to begin showing the world what Colombian people can do for it.
With your support, ""The S' Lab"" will be able to reach farther accompanying more people with great ideas that could make world a better place to live.
What you get and other ways You Can Help

In exchange for your contribution, I will be happy to support you on your business idea construction, giving you advice and teaching you how to use different tools to help you accomplish what you want. Just contact me. Please share this with your friends on all your social networks to spread the word.
Thank you for your support!
PROYECTS ON COURSE//
www.the-service-lab.com.co/ecohotel
www.smantaniacafe.co

Mi empresa ""The S' Lab"" desarrolla proyectos en los que la innovación social, el diseño de servicios y el diseño estratégico deben ser componentes esenciales. De esta forma, podemos obtener resultados que impacten positivamente a la competitividad de la región, desde más de una perspectiva. En otras palabras, lo que hacemos es construir modelos de negocio que brinden un servicio útil a las personas, contribuyan a la sociedad y que fácilmente se re-inventen así mismos a medida que evoluciona el mercado.

En este momento TS'L está creciendo, los proyectos son cada vez más complejos y requieren de equipos de trabajo más grandes. Además, en este momento estamos a punto de iniciar nuestro primer proyecto fuera de Colombia así que la responsabilidad es mayor. Debemos estar más preparados para empezar a demostrarle al mundo lo que los Colombianos podemos hacer por él.
Con su apoyo, contribuirán a que ""The S' Lab"" llegue cada vez más lejos acompañando a las personas con buenas ideas que pueden hacer del mundo un mejor lugar para vivir.
Como agradecimiento...

Como agradecimiento a su contribución, seré feliz de apoyarlos en la construcción de su idea de negocio en caso de que tengan una. Estaré en plena disposición de aportarles en lo que pueda y les enseñare una serie de herramientas que les pueden ser útiles para lograr lo que quieren. Solo necesitarán contactarme.
Muchas gracias por tomarse el tiempo de leer esto y por su apoyo.
PROYECTOS EN CURSO//
www.the-service-lab.com.co/ecohotel
www.smantaniacafe.co
About me

My name is Javier Patiño Castro, I'm 24 years old. As a designer since I founded my company 2 years ago, my team and I have been supporting entrepreneurs to reach their dreams by translating their ideas in sustainable and innovative proyects, that not only let them be happy and successful people but also allowing them to contribute in the construcciton of a better world.
What I need
One month ago I began a teams leadership program that I know will be really helpful to let me be a better person with more skills to guide my team and my clients unto better results and bigger goals.

I decided to take this program as a personal task because my company, in the middle of it's getting stronger process, do not have the solvency to support me at this moment. So that's why I'm requiring your help. US$ 1.000 is what I need to complete the program's second part. Please contribute whatever you can afford. Because every little bit counts you should not worry if you can't afford a financial contribution. There are other ways you can help me. For example you could share this with your friends to spread the word.
The Impact

My company ""The S' Lab"" develops projects in which social innovatión, service design and business strategy must be involved, so its results positively impact the region's competitiveness in many ways. In other words we develope business that serves people, contribute to the society and that easily reinvents it self in the market.

At this moment my company is getting stronger, the projects are more complex and they require bigger teams. Beside, now we are starting our first job outside Colombia so the responsability is major. We must be more prepared to begin showing the world what Colombian people can do for it.
With your support, ""The S' Lab"" will be able to reach farther accompanying more people with great ideas that could make world a better place to live.
What you get and other ways You Can Help

In exchange for your contribution, I will be happy to support you on your business idea construction, giving you advice and teaching you how to use different tools to help you accomplish what you want. Just contact me. Please share this with your friends on all your social networks to spread the word.
Thank you for your support!

Our Story

column3: >This 20 minute documentary, titled ""Not Forgotten,"" exposes the secret of Autism in Ukraine and what can be done to aid and educate professionals and parents.

column5: >Our primary mission? To aid in education of professionals who work with Autism in Ukraine and to create a support system for parents of children with Autism.
>Our success stories with our mission?
column8: >We have worked in the field of Autism for the past 5 years, taking professional and parents of children with Autism who are Americans and have worked with teachers both on the university level as well as in the classroom. We have successfully taught parents basic skills with living with and raising a child on the Autism Spectrum.

column1: An Ever Present Secret - by Tom Saxon

The waves of the sea ebb and flow, coming upon the shore with great beauty and force only to recede quietly and secretively back into its own. Such is the ideology of post-Communist Eastern European ideology. Decades of Communist thought and ethics melded with an enforced Godless mandate has wounded the inner men and women of generations past, present and for the foreseeable future. These scars can be seen clearly in a societyâ€™s attitude and approach to disabilities, specifically in children with Autism.

For the past twelve years I have been traveling with teams to Odessa, Ukraine, the last four years of which have been to work in a school dedicated to teaching children with Autism.  It is the only school/facility we have been able to identify in Ukraine that serves the children with these special needs.  Taking Autism Specialists from the US to help instruct Ukrainian teachers who have little to no training and a modicum of success with these precious children of Autism and offering help for parents ill-equipped to relate to their children has been primary in our time in Ukraine.

Fear, shame, exhaustion and hopelessness permeate each consultation with parents.  These parents love their uncommunicative, chaotic and incomprehensible children, though questions regarding the condition plague throughout the world plague them: Why? What did we do to cause this?  Will my child get better?  Children with Autism live secretively and alone.  Eastern Europe keeps disabilities, especially Autism, hidden from view in order to hide the shame, culturally and individually.  READ MORE HERE
Cities highlighted in this documentary:
Kiev, Ukraine
Cherkasy, Ukraine
Odessa, Ukraine

","Our Story
This 20 minute documentary, titled ""Not Forgotten,"" exposes the secret of Autism in Ukraine and what can be done to aid and educate professionals and parents.
Our primary mission? To aid in education of professionals who work with Autism in Ukraine and to create a support system for parents of children with Autism.

Our success stories with our mission? We have worked in the field of Autism for the past 5 years, taking professional and parents of children with Autism who are Americans and have worked with teachers both on the university level as well as in the classroom. We have successfully taught parents basic skills with living with and raising a child on the Autism Spectrum.
An Ever Present Secret - by Tom Saxon

The waves of the sea ebb and flow, coming upon the shore with great beauty and force only to recede quietly and secretively back into its own. Such is the ideology of post-Communist Eastern European ideology. Decades of Communist thought and ethics melded with an enforced Godless mandate has wounded the inner men and women of generations past, present and for the foreseeable future. These scars can be seen clearly in a societyâ€™s attitude and approach to disabilities, specifically in children with Autism.

For the past twelve years I have been traveling with teams to Odessa, Ukraine, the last four years of which have been to work in a school dedicated to teaching children with Autism.  It is the only school/facility we have been able to identify in Ukraine that serves the children with these special needs.  Taking Autism Specialists from the US to help instruct Ukrainian teachers who have little to no training and a modicum of success with these precious children of Autism and offering help for parents ill-equipped to relate to their children has been primary in our time in Ukraine.

Fear, shame, exhaustion and hopelessness permeate each consultation with parents.  These parents love their uncommunicative, chaotic and incomprehensible children, though questions regarding the condition plague throughout the world plague them: Why? What did we do to cause this?  Will my child get better?  Children with Autism live secretively and alone.  Eastern Europe keeps disabilities, especially Autism, hidden from view in order to hide the shame, culturally and individually.  READ MORE HERE
Cities highlighted in this documentary:
Kiev, Ukraine
Cherkasy, Ukraine
Odessa, Ukraine

Produced by: CELLAR MEDIA

Special Effects by: TIM MILLER
Editor: MATT BLICK
Directed by: MATT BLICK
Story Concept by: TOM SAXON

more you pledge, the better the rewards! Take a look at the column on the right
to see what's available.

we make the goal by the deadline, your credit card is charged what you pledged
(but not until then). We get to finish the documentary, you get your rewards,
and everyone's happy.  Actually, we'll be extremely overjoyed in getting to
get this project out to the public!
If
we don't make the goal by the deadline (falling even a penny short), your
credit card is not charged, we get nothing, you don't get any reward(s), and
Autism will continue to stay a secret in Ukraine.

Another way you can participate (other than backing this documentary) is to SPREAD THE WORD about it!  Share it on facebook, post it to a forum, tweet about it... anyway that you can get the word out about this project would be much appreciated.
Feel free to ask me any questions you have by contacting us on here or by www.notforgottenthemovie.com.
What We Need & What You Get

Our budget is $13,000 and all donations will be put directly into post-production of the documentary. As many of you know... costs to produce a film are enormous.  We still need funds to pay for the edit, the original score (by the talented Jurgen Beck), special effects and post-production backup.

We've had many generous donations by people who are inspired by the documentary and the filmmakers.  With your help, we'll be able to begin the free-flow of information on Autism from the West to Ukraine and begin to educate parents and specialists who are in desperate need of help and hope.
Rewards, Rewards, Rewards

Take a look at all the great rewards you get when you pledge to this wonderful opportunity.  You can claim anything from a digital download of the soundtrack to a paid trip to Ukraine to your logo on the film as a sponsor!
Other Ways You Can Help
Please help spread the word by sharing our campaign on Facebook, Twitter and NotForgottenTheMovie.com!",4.0,0,"1 Campaign

We're waiting. Our kids are not.
Who are we and why do we care?

Ophea is a not-for-profit organization of almost 30 people (including parents, educators, cyclists, pilots, poets, yogis, bloggers, bakers and one wannabe Batman) dedicated to improving the health of children and youth across Ontario. For years we’ve been fighting for the release of the revised Health and Physical Education (H&
column2: PE) curriculum so that all kids have access to quality H&amp
column3: PE, including meaningful sexual health education. Three years after the revised curriculum was released (and a portion quickly revoked) students are still learning from a curriculum older than they are. We need your help.

column1: Kids have a right to learn about their body and health in a straightforward way so that they can make informed decisions to avoid negative outcomes. Ontario students have a right to have a curriculum that meets their needs in today’s ever-changing world, made even more complex by social media, increased technology use, and a cultural shift towards a more open and tolerant society.
What is the situation?
In January 2010, the Ministry of Education released a revised H&
column2: PE curriculum that covers a broad range of topics including healthy eating, physical activity, substance use, mental health and sexual health.

column1: In 2010, after misinformation was used to attack the sexual health education section of the elementary H&
column2: PE curriculum, the Ministry of Education withdrew that portion of the document. A few months later, they also backed away from releasing the secondary H&amp
column3: PE curriculum. Ever since, teachers have been using all or part of a 15-year-old document to teach sexual health and the other components of the H&amp
column4: PE curriculum. We are well behind other provinces in the country and we owe our 2.1 million students more.

column1: It’s time to bring the H&
<table><tbody><tr>
What is at stake?
The health and well-being of our kids is at stake.
<ul>
• 45% of students feel that sex education classes do not adequately address their concerns.
• 36% of students would not know where to go for help if they or a friend was experiencing mental health problems, such as stress, anxiety or depression.

• Ontario Principals, when asked to comment on the major issues in their schools, most commonly responded that they felt ill prepared to deal with the increasing number of mental health issues they were seeing.
• Almost 1 in 5 students reported that they were intoxicated at school at least once in a 12 month period.
• Less than half of children and youth are getting the recommended number of servings of fruit and vegetables daily.
• Only 5.5% of children and youth in Canada are getting the recommended 60 minutes of daily physical activity.
The revised H&
column2: PE curriculum focuses on building skills for active, healthy living that benefit students now and for the rest of their lives. This includes being emotionally and physically healthy, being better able to make informed choices, building relationships based on respect and trust, and developing communities of inclusion.

column1: <table><tbody><tr>
What can you do?
Ontario students need the revised H&
column2: PE curriculum now so that more students don't miss out on quality education they need. Please support our campaign by donating what you can so that we can build awareness and insist that government follow through on their promise to release and implement the revised H&amp

column1: This is how we plan to do it:
For $20,000 we will place public service announcements (PSAs) in 5 municipal papers.
For $50,000 we will place PSAs in 5 municipal papers and a ¼ page PSA in a provincial paper.
For $100,000 we will place PSAs in 5 municipal papers and a full-page PSA in a provincial paper.
For $150,000 we will place PSAs in 5 municipal papers, a full-page PSA in a provincial paper and 5 online PSAs.
For $200,000 we will place PSAs in 5 municipal papers and full-page PSAs in two provincial papers.

It's time for everyone to take action for Ontario's kids.

","We're waiting. Our kids are not.
Who are we and why do we care?

Ophea is a not-for-profit organization of almost 30 people (including parents, educators, cyclists, pilots, poets, yogis, bloggers, bakers and one wannabe Batman) dedicated to improving the health of children and youth across Ontario. For years we’ve been fighting for the release of the revised Health and Physical Education (H&PE) curriculum so that all kids have access to quality H&PE, including meaningful sexual health education. Three years after the revised curriculum was released (and a portion quickly revoked) students are still learning from a curriculum older than they are. We need your help.

Kids have a right to learn about their body and health in a straightforward way so that they can make informed decisions to avoid negative outcomes. Ontario students have a right to have a curriculum that meets their needs in today’s ever-changing world, made even more complex by social media, increased technology use, and a cultural shift towards a more open and tolerant society.
What is the situation?

In January 2010, the Ministry of Education released a revised H&PE curriculum that covers a broad range of topics including healthy eating, physical activity, substance use, mental health and sexual health.

In 2010, after misinformation was used to attack the sexual health education section of the elementary H&PE curriculum, the Ministry of Education withdrew that portion of the document. A few months later, they also backed away from releasing the secondary H&PE curriculum. Ever since, teachers have been using all or part of a 15-year-old document to teach sexual health and the other components of the H&PE curriculum. We are well behind other provinces in the country and we owe our 2.1 million students more.
It’s time to bring the H&PE curriculum into this century.
What is at stake?
The health and well-being of our kids is at stake.
45% of students feel that sex education classes do not adequately address their concerns.
36% of students would not know where to go for help if they or a friend was experiencing mental health problems, such as stress, anxiety or depression.

Ontario Principals, when asked to comment on the major issues in their schools, most commonly responded that they felt ill prepared to deal with the increasing number of mental health issues they were seeing.
Almost 1 in 5 students reported that they were intoxicated at school at least once in a 12 month period.
Less than half of children and youth are getting the recommended number of servings of fruit and vegetables daily.
Only 5.5% of children and youth in Canada are getting the recommended 60 minutes of daily physical activity.

The revised H&PE curriculum focuses on building skills for active, healthy living that benefit students now and for the rest of their lives. This includes being emotionally and physically healthy, being better able to make informed choices, building relationships based on respect and trust, and developing communities of inclusion.
What can you do?

Ontario students need the revised H&PE curriculum now so that more students don't miss out on quality education they need. Please support our campaign by donating what you can so that we can build awareness and insist that government follow through on their promise to release and implement the revised H&PE curriculum.
This is how we plan to do it:
For $20,000 we will place public service announcements (PSAs) in 5 municipal papers.
For $50,000 we will place PSAs in 5 municipal papers and a ¼ page PSA in a provincial paper.
For $100,000 we will place PSAs in 5 municipal papers and a full-page PSA in a provincial paper.
For $150,000 we will place PSAs in 5 municipal papers, a full-page PSA in a provincial paper and 5 online PSAs.
For $200,000 we will place PSAs in 5 municipal papers and full-page PSAs in two provincial papers.
It's time for everyone to take action for Ontario's kids.",4.0,1,"1 Campaign
|","Toronto, Canada",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/sexual-health-education-in-ontario-classrooms/pica

I have been writing all my life.

I wrote my first novel when I was in Junior High School, had my own zine before anyone knew what a zine was which I started as a freshman in high school, and have contributed short stories to small press magazines, as well as online stuff to the Huffington Post and elsewhere.
I like writing. It's part of who I am.

It's not all I am, of course. I'm also a husband and the father of three children (3, 8 and 11). And I am a non-traditional college student, going full-time and working full-time, seeking to get degreed in the field of Psychology.

But that itch to satisfy my desire to write hasn't dissipated, even as I pore over research and statistics, learn ANOVA tables and design methods for experimenting with human beings, and study in a somewhat different way than Dostoevsky intended, ""what it means to be human"". So, to balance out my psyche and fulfill ALL my interests, I decided to minor in Creative Writing.

That's where I saw the opportunity to participate in the very first Institute of New Writing\ Ashland (INWA) (http://sou.edu/inwa/) sponsored by the College of Arts and Sciences at Southern Oregon University this summer. I had to write a biographical proposal to get in, plus submit my own creative material. In response, I was selected to participate in the Advancing Constructions of the 21st Century Short Story workshop, facilitated by local writer Vincent Craig Wright. It would be great to attend, but unfortunately...well, you can guess the rest.
The good news is I was granted a scholarship.

The tuition for the INWA worship is a little steep for me, given that I have used up my financial aid taking all kinds of mind-blowing Psychology and writing courses already this year. The College of Arts and Sciences were kind enough to grant me a scholarship of $100 in order to attend. Since the tuition for the workshop is $950, that leaves me with a deficit of $850 to come up with before the registration deadline of July 1. Given my familial responsibilities, I can likely come up with some of that, but not the full amount. That's why I am seeking your help.

Any and all funds will go towards attending the workshop. Although it isn't expected, any excess funds will go toward financing my education next year. If I fall short of the amount needed for tuition for the workshop, and haven't made enough to supplement my goal of attending, any funds recieved will go toward attending the same workshop or a similar workshop later.
You can check out my writing.

Posted here is an attachment of the piece of writing that I submitted to gain acceptance to the workshop. I have other kinds of writing available too, including non-fiction essays, at my Wordpress website and on my Tumblr.

Short Summary

Dean is a sophomore who has just finished his HS basketball season as a starter on the Varsity basketball team. He is only the 5th sophomore in the history of his high school to be named an all league player. In addition to being a leader on the court, he is also a gifted student maintaing a 3.8+ GPA throughout his highschool career as well as being nominated to participate in a Student Campus Leadership program. This Spring and Summer he has the opportunity to train with some incredible trainers including former and currrent NBA players and to attend a Scholar/Athlete BB camp at University of California, San Diego in order to be seen by college coaches and scouts. Dean lives with a single mom and two sibling, one of whom has a disability. The family will do whatever it takes for him to be able to attend college and to continue to follow his passion which is Basketball.
<div>
What We Need:
<ul>
• Monthly training cost: $400.00 totalling $2000.00
• 6 tournaments with 2 being out of state totalling approximately $2000.00 in travel and lodging
• Camp cost: $450.00 plus travel and lodging
<div>
The Impact
As a single mom, I do all I can to provide my children with every opportunity to make all of their dreams come true and to reach their fullest potential.

Helping Dean to train this summer between his sophomore and junior yaer will provide him with broader opportunities and options for his college education. He has an incrdible work ethic and keeps his academics on track and in balance with his dedication to basket ball.
<div>
Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not in a position to help sponsor Dean at this time, please consider forwarding this information or talking to people you may know who are in a postion to support an athlete with a lot of potentential but limited resources. Thank you!!

Josh Kiener is a local Bellingham musician, skater, snowboarder, student, aspiring physical therapist, and all around great guy that we are all very lucky to have in our lives. Most importantly though, he is in need of some help.

On May 11 of this year, Josh was the unnecessary victim of a shooting. After succesful surgeries removing bullets from each leg as well as his stomach, Josh was cleared to leave the hospital but spent a month moving only by wheelchair and crutches. This time has had severe effects on his muscle mass and range of motion.

As stated before, skateboarding and snowboarding have always been a huge part of Josh's life, but these activities are things he is going to have to work very hard to be able to do again. Josh is fortunate enough that the Washington Crime Victim's Assistance program has covered the costs of his time in the hospital, but the buck stops there. His range of motion has been vastly limited since the shooting, and he needs to start intensive physical therapy program to gain back what he can. In addition to the long road ahead to physically recover from the shooting, Josh was forced to drop out of his last quarter at Western Washington University and will need to re-enroll to complete these classes to finish his degree in Kinesiology.

Josh's physical therapy, tuition and school costs, as well as his time lost from work are all things that he is left to finance on his own in order to return to normal life. As a hard working student, the thought of your career goals being delayed is difficult to come to terms with. As an aspiring physical therapist, the irony of the situation is painful in thinking about just how hard people have to work to get back to where they were physically after an incident like this.

No one deserves to be the victim of a shooting, but asking for help is hard when the effects of a tragedy like this are so widespread. Being faced with the possibility of losing the ability to participate in activities you have spent most of your life doing is even harder. If you or anyone you know is an avid skateboarder, snowboarder, cyclist, hiker, runner, or enjoyer of any rewarding yet physically demanding activity, you can imagine how hard it would be to see that part of your life taken away from you.

Josh is an extremely motivated individual who is committed to and invested in making as full of a recovery as he can so he can continue pursuing his career and being an active and hard working human being. By conributing to Josh's recovery program, you are helping someone in their efforts to reinstate the happiness, fulfillment, and pride they find in doing what they love. Anything will help towards Josh's goal.

We all need help sometimes, but sometimes we're just not prepared for how much.

","Josh Kiener is a local Bellingham musician, skater, snowboarder, student, aspiring physical therapist, and all around great guy that we are all very lucky to have in our lives. Most importantly though, he is in need of some help.

On May 11 of this year, Josh was the unnecessary victim of a shooting. After succesful surgeries removing bullets from each leg as well as his stomach, Josh was cleared to leave the hospital but spent a month moving only by wheelchair and crutches. This time has had severe effects on his muscle mass and range of motion.

As stated before, skateboarding and snowboarding have always been a huge part of Josh's life, but these activities are things he is going to have to work very hard to be able to do again. 0,"

My name is Tia Danay Fry, and I am in love with the yoga arts. 

A little over a year ago I took a small amount of interest in yoga and decided to try it out for myself. I had danced classical ballet most of my life and was missing the spark that creative movement gave me. I instantly felt hooked once I started my own simple practice, even though it wasn't in a class with professional instruction. Something about yoga has been extremely grounding to me personally and spiritually. My love for this art form has only grown over time to where I am currently. I do a daily yoga practice that is mostly my own Vinyasa flow.

What was a small interest, has quickly turned into a deep passion of mine that I love to share with others. I encourage anyone to try yoga, no matter fitness level, age or gender. Yoga is for all people to enjoy and embrace!

I wish to complete a 200 hour yoga teacher training program within the next year. The best time would be the first couple months of 2015. I hope by becoming certified I can then go on and professionally teach what I love most. I will be studying in either India or Costa Rica. The exact date and program has not been decided, but by reaching the goals of this campaign I will have the opportunity to evaluate what will be the best fit for me personally as well as financially. By sharing this love with others, then they too can find the intimate connection I have found with yoga.
column5: > Thank you so much for your time and for taking a look at my campaign!
column9:
>Namaste!

column2: >Mi nombre es Daniel Barrientos, tengo 23 años, mi país natal es El Salvador y soy becario del gobierno de Rusia para estudiar música, especialidad viola, en la Academia Gnessin de Música en Moscú.
column3:
>Mi beca, en el primer año, no incluye clases de instrumento solamente la preparación del idioma. Un estudiante de música debe de estar en constante instrucción y la academia me ofrece las lecciones de mi instrumento por un costo de 2000$ por ello recurro a su generosa ayuda debido a que mi situación económica no me permite pagarlos.

Por su ayuda y gentil atención a este joven y sus sueños 

спасибо большое!
column4:
>My name is Daniel Barrientos. I’m 23 years old and I come from El Salvador. I’m a grantee from the Russian government for studying music, with Viola as my specialty, at the Gnessin Academy of Music in Moscow
My scholarship, in the first year, does not include instrument instruction
column5: only the language preparation. A musician must be in continuous preparation and my academy offers this with a cost of $2,000. Hence, I appeal on your generous help, since my economic situation doesn’t allow me to pay for it.
column6:
>
For taking the time to read this, your kindness and help


Thank You! / спасибо большое!
